business_name: hub by Premier Inn London Clerkenwell hotel
review: Wow! We were really impressed. We weren‚Äôt really expecting much due to the price, but this was amazing! The room was a decent size with lots of storage space. There was also a smart TV as well as LOTS of plugs and USB ports for charging ‚Ä¶

business_name: hub by Premier Inn London Clerkenwell hotel
review:
I have had an excellent stay here, second time with Hub by Premier Inn and first time at this location. The rooms are cosy and well maintained. Cleanliness was great, beds comfy, complementary bottle of water every day. The rooms have a perfect size for a solo traveller like me, I would say for a couple the space might be a bit tight. It's also very quiet in the hotel so I got a good rest and night's sleep.

The team is extremely friendly and they allowed me to use the hotel address for online shopping, which was convenient for me as a non UK resident.

The location is a bit of a walk from the station, the area is safe though. The connections from Farringdon on the Elizabeth Line are very quick and convenient. I'll look forward to future stays with the Hub.

business_name: hub by Premier Inn London Clerkenwell hotel
review: Excellent value for money, nothing else like it in the area. Very clean rooms and lounge area. All you can eat breakfast very nice. Location is lovely, beside Exmouth Market. Large room. Quiet enough to sleep well. Comfortable bedding and heating/air con. Staff very friendly. Compares to 4 star hotels in my opinion. Highly recommend!

business_name: hub by Premier Inn London Clerkenwell hotel
review:
Very satisfied with our stay at the Hub.
The hotel was happy to store our bags prior to check in.
The room was spotlessly clean & the beds were comfy (though we did request extra pillows).
The nighttimes were peaceful & there was a black out blinds on the window.
All the staff, including the duty manager & chefs were very friendly & happy to accommodate my partners dietary requirements and the bar/breakfast are was comfortable.
The location was very convenient, as was the 12 noon check out time.
I would note even the larger of the rooms are on the small side & perhaps more suitable for a single person and I found the way the lighting in the bathroom was connected to the lighting in the room a little odd.

business_name: hub by Premier Inn London Clerkenwell hotel
review:
This was a wonderful and comfortable stay.

The staff were so welcoming and friendly with an excellent coffee whilst we waited for our room to be ready.

The hotel is in an excellent location, right next to Exmouth market that has great restaurants and shops.

The rooms were basic but comfortable, spotless and well designed. The windows were designed to block out any noise making it completely quiet. It did feel a bit stuffy but was okay when you changed the settings on the air conditioning.

Will be coming back.

business_name: hub by Premier Inn London Clerkenwell hotel
review: Easy self chick in. Small but perfectly formed rooms,with comfy bed. Would be nice to have a kettle though. 24hr bar is a plus - we went to a gig, so was nice to be able to come back for a drink. Breakfast was fine - although staff were a bit slow to restock food and crockery/cutlery. Good location for train station.... Will come again

business_name: hub by Premier Inn London Clerkenwell hotel
review: We had a great experience. We bought early check in from 11 to be able to drop our bags off for the day. The hotel is nice clean and modern and has a nice bar. The location is great and is a quick walk to the Farringdon tube station and modern Elizabeth line tube which have nicer trains with good air con. The staff were friendly and overall great stay for the price

business_name: hub by Premier Inn London Clerkenwell hotel
review: I love the Hub by Premier Inn hotels and this one was no exception. Excellent location near King's Cross and Farringdon. Comfy bed and very clean. No kettle in the room but you can access hot drinks for free in the bar area. Basic breakfast but everything you would need for the price. Did self check in but the staff seemed friendly too. Nice and quiet room. Highly recommended.

business_name: hub by Premier Inn London Clerkenwell hotel
review:
Excellent stay. Check in was prompt. Room cleanliness was 10/10. All staff really friendly and welcoming. Exmouth Market is a very short distance with lots of cafes and eateries. Short walk to tube station at Farringdon, with direct access to Wembley. King's Cross is around 20 mins walk.
Would definitely stay here again when visiting London.
Thank you

business_name: hub by Premier Inn London Clerkenwell hotel
review: Fab hotel, ideal base for exploring London. 20 min walk from King's Cross. Hotel clean & modern. Staff helpful. Breakfast was great for ¬£8, would highly recommend rather than traipsing round looking for places to eat. Eating & bar area very clean & food items topped up regularly.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Óóä

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
We were celebrating our engagement with a Champagne Afternoon Tea.
The sandwiches were so fresh, the Scone and Cakes were delicious.
We chose Darjeeling Tea which was soooooo nice!!
The only thing I would say is, we were sat for almost 35 mins before we got our food, then another 10-15mins until the pot of tea arrived.  We found we had to slow down the eating in order to enjoy everything together.
It‚Äôs within a beautiful building that also houses shops such as Boodles, Omega and Tiffany‚Äôs and the Engel bar.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
A Wonderful Place for a Snack
The Big 3s:

Ambience: nothing better than this area and surroundings

Service: a few in the morning sharing duties but the Mr. from Peru was the nicest who also told me about discount in the store with my receipt; the Italian girl also kind; the British gentleman told me I could not get brown toast for my Welsh Rarebit since "it's already premade" which doesn't sound very appetizing

Food: 6 out of 1-10 as it's just super simple on a dish and white bread at that

Unique Point: for same day to the store adjacent we save 10% for being a customer of the restaurant bar; unsure if the same is true if you shop in store to get a discount back in the restaurant

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: I came here with a colleague after work. I ordered a glass of champagne, scotch eggs, and a side of salad, and I loved it. Simple but good food and champagne in a beautiful setting. This, plus the good company, made for a wonderful evening, so a 5 stars all around for me.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
I'm so glad to have chosen this restaurant for our recent visit to London.

The atmospheric surroundings from the old building were amazing. The food was magnificent, and staff were all supper helpful and brilliant.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
A fantastic spot for a glass of champagne in a truly historic setting! Located within the iconic Royal Exchange, which dates back to 1571, Fortnum‚Äôs Bar offers a refined atmosphere surrounded by luxury boutiques.

The bar is open Monday to Friday from 7:30 AM to 10:30 PM, making it a great choice for breakfast, afternoon tea, or an elegant evening drink. The service is impeccable, and the selection of Fortnum & Mason‚Äôs signature drinks and light bites is excellent.

Sitting under the grand arches of the Royal Exchange while enjoying a chilled glass of champagne is a wonderful experience‚Äîperfect for a break from shopping or a stylish catch-up with friends. Highly recommended for those who appreciate history, luxury, and great hospitality!

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
A great bar to come and chill for a drink with colleagues, friends, and family. It‚Äôs nice to sit among locals and enjoy a nice cup of tea or coffee. The seating at the bar was quite comfortable (although we would‚Äôve preferred to sit at the tables with the nice blankets ‚Äì this seating was reserved for patrons who were eating). We stopped here for tea and a latte after spending time at the Bank of England across the street. I love this tea so much that I had to buy more at the F&M store next to the bar. The bar staff were extremely friendly and they were quick to serve and clean the area.
It was an amazing experience to sit at the bar, enjoy a fresh cup of tea and stare at the store and lovely architecture surrounding you.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
The tea is very good, but the customer service is 1 star.
When a customer dropped the menu list on the floor, the waiter stepped on it and put it on the desk without replacing it.
Also, water is refilled for Caucasians but not for Asians (not racist, but I feel there is some kind of difference in service delivery to customers)
There is also a
store in Tokyo, so I thought about going there, but I won't be going there anymore,

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Best table service I've had outside a Michelin star restaurant. Excellent drinks and food, would love to visit again. Had the fixed price menu and chose the Scotch egg, steak and knickerbocker glory, all were fabulous and better than expected.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Such a beautiful setting. Service impeccable. Thank you making things so special for my friend and I üëçüèæüòé

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Great building. Great food.
We had steak (+¬£8), chips (+¬£6.50) and vegetables (+¬£6.50).
All food was tasty but be prepared to pay a bit extra for drink and sides.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Lovely experience using my virgin experience voucher for 3 course dinner.

The set menu options were quite varied. Ordered the Beetroot salad and renowned scotch egg, both lovely.

Then had the steak with peppercorn sauce, quite different, sauce was sweet but delicious and steaks were cooked very nicely.

For dessert we had the crepe suzette - nice experience watching this cooked tableside. And the brownie which was very warming and super chocolatey.

Staff were also attentive and friendly.

Location is lovely, just bear in mind it's a little dark at night as the lighting is only from the dimly lit lamps.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Great experience and open area to enjoy your meal
According to the staff everything on the menu is popular

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: We got gifted a virgin experience to come and eat here and it was lovely. The ambience was great and the service was really good. The beer selection was the only let down for me.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Well I used to love this place. The food is excellent and the people are lovely. Except today.  It was 10% occupied at 9am. I am unable to perch on the high stools due to an injury. I wanted to meet a friend for coffee, but was told the tables were all taken. They weren't. The maitre d' would not hear me. We went somewhere else.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Tourist Trap. Avoid.

Wonderful atmosphere, nice staff. Unfortunately the afternoon tea set was terrible. We were both nauseous after the food. The sandwiches were not fresh. Been made and left out too long. ¬£50/per person yet they cannot manage a decent sandwich, it is pretty inexcusable. Pastries were also overly, sickly sweet and not fresh. Soggy even. Massive disappointment.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: 5 Stars Luxury Experience! We booked with the Virgin Experience for our 2nd Anniversary, we had a delicious and amazing dinner, the food it's incredible tasty and the service is more than perfect! The waitresses were so kind and helpful and they offer us a dessert for our anniversary. They have been amazing and we loved everything!! Absolutely recommended as a restaurant if you want to have a special moment with someone you love. Thank you for this amazing dinner!

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Gift from friend for our Wedding Gift from this Virgin experience day üéÅ Walked in each to their own preference the claimed "most instagramable" I didn't think it was wow factor. There's 4 entrances and the seatings your placed kinda right in the middle, 360 surrounded by luxury jewelery shops with some Fortnum and Mason kinda bit exposed from my view, strangers walking past because anyone could walk in and not sure who prefers that (also the chairs were not comfortable at all and our table was unbalanced so it was wonky). In-addition, if you're like first time visit your kinda lost where to go cause there's not really a recognised reception point so you kinda just walk towards a member of staff to ask. Food selection was alright for my selection and happy to pay extra. But partner had this steak (Medium Rare request but more Medium Well) with Pepporncorn sauce tasted weird with a fishy trout taste, I'm unsure of this reason but she didn't want me to raise the issue for ¬£15 additional expected something better but I guess it's Bank, location location! Service greeting was friendly at all times, but there were some like serving staff that was a bit like okay... example I ordered a big sparkling bottle of water to share, opened it poured it for us very nice but then took the lid cap away leaving the bottle of sparkling exposed throughout the dinner of Service. I expected better as imagine paying ¬£85 already then topping up another ¬£50 on top including the service charge (we ordered extra food) for 2 ppl but I guess this is standard for Bank again. Oh the cocktail üç∏  was not for me, the Pale ale was nice though üëå Overall, experience didn't do it for me üòÖ but you can't please  everyone, try it for your own point for view.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Had a champagne afternoon tea for two here and enjoyed the experience for the most part.
It was difficult to find space on the table for everything, and it felt a bit strange to be in the middle of the room here with events going on upstairs though. The food was also not the best afternoon tea food I've ever had - it was by no means bad, just a bit plain.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: The food was good not the best I've ever had but the location and attentive staff more than made up for it. We had a set menu as a present (¬£100) but still paid for extra and drinks, it cost about ¬£65. You could do it for the cost of the voucher and it would be very nice. Over all I would have to say I've had better for less.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
It‚Äôs a shame that such a beautiful location doesn‚Äôt have nice service.

Server literally forgot to add the food snack I requested, upon my reiterated request, he fuzzed off ‚Äúit was not charged‚Äù and tried to order it again, in vain, he forgot again.

Tried to enquiry him information about the menu, impossible.

Noticed preference towards regular customers, which is a shame as I am also a local but first timer here, which may be the last, at least wouldn‚Äôt recommend the bar.

the policy of having tables only for dining is absurd, sometimes you start with drinks and add food later, you are self limiting your customer‚Äôs taps by arrogant staff attitude

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Had a wonderful 3 course meal here, which was part of a gift voucher package.
The staff were very attentive and there was a good chance of dishes.

The food was amazing and such good portions.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: This branch is located inside the Royal exchange. Its not as grand as the actual branch but it still offers a lovely vibe. The place is beautiful especially with Christmas decorations. Stopped there for a quick coffee. Service was good and coffee was great, we had Americanos. However, the price is just too much for a cup of coffee.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Tasty dinner in a beautiful building with friendly and professional service. We enjoyed all our dishes especially the scotch egg and the sea bass. Both desserts were good too. The crumble topping on the apple and rhubarb crumble was the lightest and crispiest crumble I have had. A classic British dessert stylishly delivered.

Special thanks to our waiter Roy for his attentive service with a smile.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
We made a reservation for 13:45, intending to enjoy a two-hour period for both lunch and afternoon tea. However, we were denied the opportunity to order afternoon tea, which is available from 14:30 onwards. When we inquired about the restriction, they explained that our reservation was specifically for lunch, not afternoon tea. It struck us as odd ‚Äì how could they assume we wouldn't be interested in afternoon tea following a light lunch?

Moving on, the Scott eggs had an average taste, accompanied by heavily Maggie's seasoned powdered defrosted peas and carrots.

The interior was stunning, and the location exudes a cool vibe reminiscent of the financial district in downtown Manhattan. Numerous iconic landmarks are situated nearby. Only the lunch wasn't giving.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Had an evening meal here through Virgin experiences. We really enjoyed the experience which was very relaxed and casual. The building itself is stunning. The food was delicious, all of it was great quality, although the options were a little limited. The staff were very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. We were even late for our booking but staff made sure all of our courses were prepared before the kitchen closed.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Afternoon tea with a touch of Xmas in the stunning al fresco-style surroundings of the Royal Exchange‚Äôs spectacular central courtyard with bonus stars lights display probably only in December was well worth the price. Gingerbread mini loaf, pistachio white chocolate bauble and violet choux were nice but not the best, however sandwiches were of quality and scones served with lemon curd in addition to jam and clotted cream were well made. Service was fine. Recommended.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: had afternoon tea here and service was terrible. front of house/manager and servers were unfriendly from the beginning and acted as if they did not want to serve our table and would rather serve others. they did not greet us, and served us carelessly and ignored our table multiple times. my expectations of a f&m were sorely unmet, and would rather patronise other places for afternoon tea with better service overall.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
The classic afternoon tea was proper. The service was perfect - discreet, agreeable, and attentive - and the place is stunning. Even though everything was quite good, the food was not extraordinary to be honest (you'd expect almost perfection from such a place).

For ¬£35 as of February 2023 (very pricey, but with the past few years' inflation it is sadly currently one of the least expensive luxurious afternoon teas you can find), you get 5 sandwiches (e.g. smoked trout, cucumber, egg, ham, curry), 2 scones with clotted cream, lemon curd & strawberry jam, and 3 mini pastries, along with a tea to choose from a selection.
Scones and jams were delicious, but the sandwiches could have had more fillings given the slices of bread - very good - were quite thick. Being French I found 1 of the 3 pasties was delicious while the others were just fine.

They don't tell you that there and the website doesn't say it either, but at ¬£35 it's good to know that you can ask refills of whatever you want for no extra charge. The price also includes a tea tasting. It's best to not go too late before the end of the service to make sure you can actually get refills and taste different teas.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Lovely staff, in relaxed up-market shopping mall eatery and bar, great to dine in such an open large space and admire the architecture. Like most diners we ate with the Virgin experience dinner mene, good selection and great cocktails.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Gorgeous spot for intimate dinner with a delicious cocktail and wine selection and well seasoned dishes. Definitely go for the three course dinner. The ambience, the service, and the food were all top notch. I will definitely return!

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Absolutely fantastic.
Food and service was outstanding üëå you can add to the menu for a few pounds.
We had 2020 Argentian Malbec and it was beautiful.
Location was stunning üòç
Staff who served us where a credit to the company.
Highly recommended üëå

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
I tried a small plate as I wasn't too hungry - I had the beluga which comes with a nice presentation, and scrambled eggs to your liking, cooked on an arriving trolley.  Excellent with a nice glass of champagne.

With the Royal Exchange behind as a backdrop, one cant really complain, can one?  Recommend this place for a nice high end drink for meeting and chatting with friends or family.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Gave 4 overall as we were sitting near the door and every time it opened a cold gust of wind came in.
Staff advised there was nothing they could do other than provide a blanket

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Enjoyed a really lovely meal here, definitely retains  the class, charm and pomp of the St James‚Äôs location and that helps sell the experience of a quintessentially British menu. I ordered here the Dorset crab and the calves liver and bacon, both of which were delicious but the liver really stood out to me as classic comfort food.

The staff were all friendly and attentive if a little slow in service, but you really can‚Äôt fault it.

Would highly recommend this place to anyone!

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: We had afternoon Tea at this place. It was brilliant and very tasty. The Tea flavours was fantastic and the scones was best of all the choosings. And after the Tea go to the shop and buy the Tea in beautifully boxes

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Beautiful buding and extraordinary location. You feel royal having a cup of tea or English breakfast here. Accomodates to dietary requirements. The building is a little bit cold like a typical old building or museum so I always bring a silk cashmere scarf from Hermes as a blanket when eating here. The toilets are downstairs to the left directly after the entrance in case you dont like asking for locations. There is a Fortnum & Mason gift shop next to the restaurant where you can buy great teas and high end biscuits or jams. The shop is much more luxurious and peaceful than the original stressful shop near Green Park. We hosted an engagement dinner here one evening as there was live music in the large building with great accustics while dining. I hope this helps. Kindest #ingavardhan

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: This little outpost of Fortnum & Mason is like one of those London secrets you don't want to share. The location is outstanding. The champagne is delicious. It's got the feeling of a first class lounge - classy, quiet, relaxed and just a touch indulgent. All the things I love. The oysters are fantastic, as is the service. And on top of all that, I think it's extraordinary good value for money.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Popped in for a drink last night whilst checking out the area around The Ned where we are staying this week.

The bar staff member that served us couldn't understand my BBC Scottish accent, which is fine. But he just looked annoyed that we were there. Not the best service or experience really considering how lovely all the other F&M venues are.

The floor staff were lovely and courteous.

Very good Espresso Martini.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Giving the service 4 because the guy who sat us was big and gruff (not smiley)but perfectly polite (had a nasty cough unfortunately). I just would‚Äôve preferred a more genteel type of service. Also very very strong wind and cold because of the v big automatic doors on 3 of the 4 walls!  They provide a blanket for your lap, however it‚Äôs an uncomfortable picnic blanket (plastic
On inner) to put around your shoulders when your back is to the doors!!  Could be a snuggly throw? The food was delightful and it‚Äôs a stunning venue which I would recommend. I am a little picky!

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Fantastic spot for lunch in the City. Food and service were exceptional. Ordered the fish and chips and my friend ordered the Chicken Caesar- both were great. Highly recommended for lunch.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Waited 15 minutes after being seated to be acknowledged. Totally ignored by various members of staff when the place was not even full. Gave up and left for some place better.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
The staff are awful, we stand at the entrance waiting for a seat and no one cares about us. Even if they notice us and don't wanna greet us.

So disappointed with that and we decided to just turn around straight away. Hope not related to discrimination because we got an Asian face?

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Had a great experience, the food was lovely, however, the main course was only warm rather than hot.
Everything else was superb.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Amazing building here! It was quite interesting to have afternoon tea in Royal Exchange. But I was disappointed to say the food and tea was below Fortnum & Mason standards.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Fortnum & Mason has a reputation for great food as somewhere so when I found out they had a restaurant in the city I was very keen to go. Unfortunately we left disappointed with our experience. Firstly, the menu we were given on arrival was different to the one on their website (I was particularly looking forward to trying the Beef Wellington which appears on their website in the Dinner menu). The woman, who I believe was the manager,
said ‚Äúwe changed the menu today‚Äù. We asked for some recommendations and I decided to go for the shrimp burger, however, this was out of stock. Finally, my third choice was the Lobster spaghetti, which although at least available was quite tasteless. The whole experience was pretty underwhelming and not what you‚Äôd expect from Fortnum‚Äôs. The only good thing was the service from Arthur, who was very friendly and helpful, and served us a lovely tea at the end.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: My favorite place for a cocktail close to my office. Everyone I bring here loves it.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Was a great experience the locations was really nice and had a good atmosphere. Teas selection was really good and different the sandwiches and cakes was standard

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Patricia is a fantastic example of exactly what an attentive and professional waitress should be. Humorous and generous, made the experience very enjoyable.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Usually I don‚Äôt go to such a touristic place to eat. But I know that F&M has a very good lunches and wanted to take my parents there for an afternoon tea. Our plans changed and I‚Äôve rescheduled the table for earlier time just for lunch. As we arrived there we were not too hungry to have a full lunch but wanted some starters and drinks. The food was great. But. The service is so awful!! The guy first gave us only lunch menu. I then asked for drinks menu. Hi gave it to me after 5min waiting (and the place was not too busy). We wanted to have a look at deserts and I needed to ask for menu again. The guy was already not happy. But come on, we may order whatever we want!
The guy was grumpy when we asked for second blanket (it was very chilly). My dad had tea (loose leaf in teapot). I asked waiter if we could add some hot water, he took the teapot and threw couple of words leaving the table ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt do this here‚Äù. He may just told us in a kindly way and explain. In 5 min he brought a new teapot and add it in bill.
The atmosphere was already ruined.
When we asked for a bill, I decided to check it. They added items worth ¬£30 that we didn‚Äôt order!
How come such a well known place couldn‚Äôt manage their stuff to be more friendly?
Disappointed.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: The food was great, good selection and amazing presentation. The quality of the service really lacked even meeting some the basic standards. We waited about 30min before being able to order our food, we tried numerous times to make eye contact with the waiter but he was constantly on his phone. This happened multiple times, throughout the evening. At the end of the meal while trying to order desert there was about 10min that went by where we couldn‚Äôt see a waiter anywhere. Shame that the service ruined this dinner for us.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Had a fantastic experience at Fortnum & Mason Royal Exchange! The ambiance was elegant, the food exquisite, and the service outstanding. A special thanks to Petras and Romi for their warm hospitality and great recommendations. Looking forward to returning!

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: First time I visited and I would definitely recommend.  It was such a lovely experience, first class service and food.  I had bacon and tomato with sourdough toast and it was all well presented, fresh and beautifully cooked.  It certainly lived up to its reputation.  Our waitress was very friendly and helpful and we did not feel rushed. I would certainly visit again.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Food very good and the service was good. Would thoroughly recommend. Brilliant.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: the best selections on the set menu have an additional cost e.g. limited choice if you have a voucher.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: We enjoyed the most amazing breakfast here. The service was great and the setting is beautiful.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: If you like awesome service with a friendly smile good quality menu a most go place if you like English tea, surround by a historical building but keep in mind that all this comes at a price it should be a treat unless you have money to go there every day

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: What a nice surrounding with great food and service.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
We used a Virginia Experience voucher, lovely venue with beautiful shops and architecture all around the glass roof courtyard.
The fixed menu was varied and the food really tasty.
We were treated as valued guests, not rushed, had a great time.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: We popped in here whilst it was tipping down outside.  We often visit the shop but wanted to try the champers and oysters at the bar! Unfortunately the manager here has a dreadful inferiority complex which means he feels he has to be rude and superior to assert his authority.  The staff were all grumpy and have no hospitality training whatsoever, no service, no smile, no how was your experience, the chap that gave us the bill could barely grunt at us. Very disappointing given that the staff in the shop are excellent and make the shopping experience there extra special, especially the lady from New Zealand who is fabulous and obviously loves her job.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: A wonderful place to visit for a special treat for afternoon tea. The service was impeccable and the afternoon tea was very generous for the price.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Fortum's shop in the Royal Exchange is an absolute gem in the neighborhood. You have a great selection of teas, biscuits, honey and jam. Tea tasting is available every day. The interaction with the staff is friendly and fun. Love going there for a little break!

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: One of my go to places in London for Welsh rarebit which is getting harder and harder to find these days. During times of Covid I actually feel comfortable eating here even though it‚Äôs indoors because the building is so large that you can actually feel air currents moving around

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Overall a great experience. We used the Virgin Experience package for a special night out. The building is amazing and the general atmosphere is pretty good. Only complaint is it said cocktail and we clearly just got bubbles. Would have been cool to get a nice cocktail to add to the experience.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Lovely venue but service was very poor. The manager is not welcoming. Claims it‚Äôs only a place for dinner and don‚Äôt serve coffee or tea at 4pm. It‚Äôs a convenient place to meet up but after one experience I won‚Äôt recommend it.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Amazing location,  friendly staff and high quality food.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
One of the blond female reception staff was so rude! She was shouted to some customers said "Go to the bar not here!!". Where is your manner seriously?
It‚Äôs a shame that such a beautiful location doesn‚Äôt have nice service. I seriously think that they better need to change the staff.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: It‚Äôs a beautiful place to sit for a drink especially with all of the Christmas decorations, however when we had a drink here we did seem to be invisible to the staff when it came to ordering... it does have a bit of a snobby vibe, not sure I‚Äôd bother returning, I think there‚Äôs better places around with much better service for a similar kind of price.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: This is a special place to eat (if it's not cold outside) fab setting. Food was good, although I didn't agree with adding items with a surcharge to the voucher experience menu. Sides are expensive for what they are - new potatoes ¬£6.50. But overall worth going to

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Great iconic place. Food OK but expected more for that price.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Perfect food and perfect service, was a lovely experience and felt very welcomed

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Great food and atmosphere. Service left more to be desired with regards to how long they took to serve us & politeness. In condolence we were offered a free round of champagne

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Came here with one of my friends. we used  the virgin experience voucher. Menu was very limited and most dishes required us to pay extra.
Table service was ok but I felt they were rushing us and kept bringing the next course before we had even finished the first. They just wanted us out as soon as possible.
The cocktails were very unpleasant and neither of us drunk them. We weren‚Äôt even asked or given an option about which cocktail we would like.  The waiter just brought the cocktails to the table and they tasted more like undiluted blueberry squash.
Wouldn‚Äôt come back in a rush if at all.
Starters were delicious but they replaced the trout for salmon hoping we didn‚Äôt notice that. Main dish was ok nothing amazing and the cake was pretty average too.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
I remember the good old days when customer service was a Fortnum & Mason priority - oh, how times have changed!

I told the server I was here for coffee and business meeting - I was seated at 11am.  At 11:15 I was asked to order food or move!  Really?  I queried why and was told "you are not eating"  Duh!  I told you I was not from the outset.

I was moved to the bar and subsequently charged 12.5% service charge for the privilege!  Yet another shady practice.

Come on F&M - sort it out!

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: A lovely experience. Staff were great. Food and drink was lovely. Definitely recommend

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: We had a lovely meal as a gift from our youngest son for my birthday. Beautiful surroundings and the food was very good. Our Hungarian server Robbie was excellent. Very attentive and full of knowledge about the Royal Exchange. Recommend

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: If service is anything to go by, it was mediocre at best. Food was good, and the ambiance was tremendous! We had two different waiter (I think there was a change in shift). Both competed in being rude and unwelcoming. Is that a part of the trademark? Is it what makes them special? Was it because I was a tourist? Anyway being from Dubai, I was not impressed and was happy to leave as soon as possible and have lunch elsewhere. Even my guests, who work in the City looked a bit embarrassed.  Not again!

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
Cool location at the Royal Exchange, like the teas and coffee of Fortnum's but service at the bar where I was made to sit lacked friendly service with a smile. I only ordered a latte but would have anticipated a glass of water and a napkin, neither were supplied and the bill arrived with no smile and  service charge.

Hopefully, basic hospitality training will fix these slight problems.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Very disappointed. I made a reservation for lunch and then called to see if we could just come in for tea service. I was told absolutely and that a reservation wasn‚Äôt needed and we could just come in. I therefore canceled the lunch reservation. When we arrived we were informed that you could only have tea service with a reservation and that drinks and a bar menu were available at the bar. On a first come first served basis.  When we explained the situation and what we had been told we then had a manager explain their whole policy to us. While we confirmed we now understood their policy, we repeated what we had been told on the phone and remembered the name of who we spoke to. The manager kept repeating their policy and reservation procedure which of course was not what we had been told on the phone. No apology or accommodation was given and we were made to feel that we must had been confused and made the error. Poor customer service.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review: Lovely experience as always. Live music came on about 7/8pm on the Tuesday we were there.

business_name: The Fortnum‚Äôs Bar & Restaurant at Royal Exchange
review:
I honestly think that if you're paying c.¬£70 for 2 glasses of champagne each that maybe the service could be, you know, nice and polite?  We weren't even provided a napkin, certainly no nuts and the service from the barman was surly, disinterested and with zero proactivity. I noticed his attitude changed when he was talking to an attractive female.  Naturally they add a 12.5% service charge, which I nearly asked to be removed, but thought it easier to just pay and leave.
The champagne (F&M Blanc to Blanc) wasn't particularly outstanding either.
I think we'll spend our money elsewhere in future.
Óóä

Circolo Popolare is such a stunning place ‚Äî the interior alone makes it worth visiting, with its warm, lively atmosphere and beautiful design.

The food was simply delicious, full of flavor and clearly made with care. Everything felt fresh and authentic, making the whole dining experience even more special.

The staff were welcoming and attentive, even with how busy it gets. Overall, it‚Äôs a must-visit spot in Paris if you‚Äôre looking for great food in an unforgettable setting.

When you see a restaurant with 30k reviews at 4.8 you really good into it expecting a lot. Unfortunately for us it was just overrated?
The setting of the restaurant is beautiful. Really eclectic and super fun to look around. Its busy but can talk comfortably and the cocktails and drinks looked excellent. As far as our experience of getting some pasta and tiramisu, it had much to be desired.
I didnt think the service was exceptional considering the optional 12.5% tip and the pasta was bland. High quality ingredients, but just very 'English' in flavour profile and lacked any complicated depth i would expect.
It wasn't bad, but it definitely wasn't amazing for the London price.

I was visiting London for tourism with my boyfriend and came across Circolo Popolare on social media and it looked beautiful, so we decided to try it for my birthday lunch, and I‚Äôm so glad we did! The space is absolutely stunning, the food was amazing with great portion sizes, and the service truly made the experience special. Every staff member was so kind, they kept wishing me a happy birthday, and the servers even gave me a card and sang happy birthday to me! It was such a sweet and personal touch. This place made my birthday feel extra special. Highly recommend for a memorable meal in London!

Such a beautiful place and the food was amazing. The truffle pasta and the tiramisu were delicious. The chicken Milanese was alright. Great service and there was no waiting time as if you came in with no booking they can seat you at the sharing table. Maria at the reception was very friendly.

Wonderful recommendation from a friend and it did not disappoint. Very popular even on a Thursday afternoon and queue stared forming well before the doors open at noon. Excellent service. But the table was too tiny for the size of the plates. The fish was yummy. The pizza is good but the best of the best was the heavenly tiramisu. To die for!

I‚Äôm a fan of Big Mama. Circolo Popolare one of my favourite Italian restaurants in London. Amazing & stunning decoration.Drink & Food was perfect.I really love pasta. Services was good and all staffs very friendly. Reasonable price and good atmosphere. Highly recommend.

We had a wonderful experience ü§© The pastas were perfectly cooked and full of flavor, and the pizza was just as impressive, fresh ingredients and a delicious crust. Everything tasted authentic and comforting. A lovely place for anyone craving true Italian food

The place is super nicely decorated great for a date. Unfortunately our waiter was not the best that day he actually went to the terrace to sleep and then no one was attending our table. Food was good I recommend the fried cheese and the fresh mozzarella, we missed to order the carbonara pasta that looked amazing! You need to order the lemon pie for dessert It was really really good!

The restaurant was wonderfully decorated, quite a big area full of vibrance totally giving the sicilian ambience. The staff were attentive and helpful especially Rohit, their service was perfect. We ordered the blue cheese ravioli ( super yum) and the aubergine milanese- which was quite perfect for me. My spouse ordered the chicken with lemon and crispy potatoes- the potatoes were seasoned also the vege but the chicken were underwhelmingly bland ( should have ordered something else). We ordered profiteroles ( crunchy, well balanced and perfect), the tiramisu lacks the richness in taste.

Such a great atmosphere and food to suit! All the staff were so friendly and welcoming, so happy to be there. They sang Happy Birthday to all the birthday bookings too! The truffle pasta was amazing absolutely the best in London ‚ò∫Ô∏è pizza was amazing and drinks are great! Fantastic aesthetics too for the restaurant with high ceilings and loads of green plants.

The ambience at Circolo Popolare is undeniably cool. The decor is stunning, the atmosphere is buzzing, and it feels like a special place to be. This, combined with their truffle pasta ‚Äì which is genuinely spectacular and a 5-star dish on its own ‚Äì should be a recipe for success.

Unfortunately, beyond that single pasta dish, the food was consistently disappointing. The "warm" focaccia was obviously microwaved, with cold spots and an uneven texture (albeit, it was still very tasty). On the other hand, the "Some Like it Hot" pizza was a misnomer; it lacked any spice or flavour, and was strangely sweet.

Our waiter was attentive and friendly, and we genuinely appreciated their service. However, the experience was soured at the end when they explicitly asked us to leave a positive review and mention them by name. We were planning to praise their service anyway, but the direct request made the interaction feel transactional and a bit disingenuous, as if the good service was performed solely for a public mention.

This feeling was compounded by the frustrating payment process. We were pushed to use an app which charged a non-optional 13.5% (not the usual 12.5%) "discretionary" tip (you have to awkwardly ask staff to change it) and an additional "platform fee." It's baffling to be charged extra for a system that replaces a simple, personal interaction.

While the vibe and the truffle pasta are major draws, they aren't enough to make up for inconsistent food and an experience that ultimately feels more focused on image and upselling than genuine hospitality.

Food was great and unique, really good service. Very popular destination for photos so please do make your reservations in advance, it‚Äôs essential.
(There is a 12.5% compulsory service fee applied)

Lunch for my mum‚Äôs birthday was very disappointing.
The restaurant looked lovely and staff were friendly.
Unfortunately the food looked pretty but was very disappointing. We ordered 5 meals and they were lukewarm at best and lacked flavour.
We spent ¬£191, left more food than we ate and had to go to another restaurant after because we all left hungry.

The reviews are accurate. It‚Äôs great food and an amazing space
Weirdly never been here before‚Ä¶ but glad we went (purely on the basis of the Google reviews)
The foods was delicious. Particularly the starters.
But more than anything it was the atmosphere that separates this restaurant from its competitors
Make sure you book early  - because the restaurant gets extremely busy

Very beautiful place, food was okay, however service was not great, my wife booked a table and told them it's my husband birthday, no cake, no Ice cream, when requested, so end up leaving, soon mains was served. Food was great but service was shit.... I heard alot good reviews but shame when I went nothing!

From the moment you walk in, you‚Äôre transported into a dreamy Italian escape. The vibe is electric lush decor, twinkling lights, and walls lined with bottles give it such a cozy yet vibrant atmosphere. The food? Incredible. Every dish is bursting with flavor and so beautifully presented, the truffle pasta was absolute standout.

The staff is super friendly and attentive, making the whole experience even more enjoyable. It‚Äôs one of those places you just can‚Äôt stop thinking about. I‚Äôm honestly obsessed, can‚Äôt wait to come back!

Great food and great ambiance. We had the truffle pizza and crab pasta. Our two year old enjoyed the butter pasta. They brought truffle pasta instead of the pizza by mistake but then still offered that to us free of cost. The pizza was one of the beat we have had in our life. The dough literally melted in the mouth. Definitely recommend this to anyone looking for good Italian food

A perfect place, perfect pizzas, pastas and all food and drinks. The environment is very well designed, the lighting and service are super. The staff is very professional and they give you informative explanations about the food. A perfect place, a must visit on every London trip.

Ambience and decor is a 10/10 for this restaurant. Absolutely charming and super cosy at the same time!

Reservations are necessary especially for dinner as they are mostly booked out, and that makes walk-ins nearly impossible. Lucked out when I tried to walk-in for a lunch on a weekday.

Food was good (burrata was fresh, pasta cooked al dente), well prepared but not mind-blowing. I guess I had very high expectations from the high 4.8 star Google rating and after reading the reviews.

Service crew were attentive and super friendly. I enjoyed my time dining at Circolo, and will come back if I‚Äôm around the area.

Circolo Popolare is a total vibe! The ambiance is absolutely stunning‚Äîevery corner feels like a celebration. The food? Delicious from start to finish, full of bold, fresh flavours. Perfect spot for a memorable night out with friends or a special date. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!

Absolutely beautiful cosy Italian in central London. Lovely authentic Italian menu and some nice cocktail options. The food was amazing, best Pizza I've ever had! Never seen a thinner crust. Staff was super friendly. We were there with a one year old and they were extremely accommodating with the buggy and high chair and also everyone was entertaining the baby : ) rare to find such a lovely place with actual friendly staff in London, so all the 5 star reviews are completely justified.

I came to this restaurant with high expectations, but unfortunately left very disappointed. The portions are extremely small for the price ‚Äì after my main dish I was still hungry. On top of that, the service could use serious improvement: my food was served on a chipped plate, which is unacceptable for a place that tries to appear upscale. The worst part, however, was my drink ‚Äì it came with a fly in it. The staff didn‚Äôt handle the situation professionally; they just replaced the glass without even offering an apology.
Overall: I cannot recommend this restaurant. For these prices, you can easily find places nearby where the food is both satisfying and served under proper hygienic conditions

Freshly made, good food.
Great wine and cocktail selections. Unfortunately, the Staff was experiencing an 'off' night?
Honestly,  it felt touristy and a more authentic Italian experience could be had elsewhere.

Circolo Popolare is a feast for the senses ‚Äî the atmosphere is vibrant, the decor is stunning, and the food is simply unforgettable. Every dish was bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. The staff were incredibly friendly and made us feel so welcome. A must-visit gem in London!

Tonight, my family and I went to Circolo Popolare restaurant.
The table they had chosen for us was in a cozy corner of the second section of the Restaurant‚Äîa peaceful and comfortable spot.
We started with Sangiovese wine, which was Absolutely Rich and Splendid.
For starters, we ordered PROSCIUTTO DI PARMA, STRACCHINO FRITTO, and ASPARAGUS SALAD. The salad was amazing.
For the main course, we had SPIEDINO DI POLLO AL LIMONE, LA GRAN CARBONARA, BURRATA AL PESTO DI BASILICO, and DANCING QUEEN‚Äîall of them were incredibly tasty.
Now, about the atmosphere and vibe‚Äîthe moment we stepped in, it felt so inviting! It truly felt like stepping into Italy.The d√©cor was beautiful and vintage, adding to the charm of the place.
Our waiter, Stephanie, was absolutely delightful, warm, and friendly. She took great care of our table and made sure everything was perfect.
Overall, everything was amazing! We had a fantastic time and will definitely be coming back!

We had booked this place weeks in advance knowing it would be difficult to find a spot otherwise, and it was absolutely worth the effort. Circolo Popolare‚Äôs atmosphere is bold, lively, and theatrical‚Äîwalls stacked floor-to-ceiling with thousands of bottles, ceilings draped with string lights and greenery, and a warm golden glow that makes the space feel festive and inviting. The vibe is buzzing and playful, more like a big Italian family gathering than a quiet dinner, with friendly service that keeps pace despite the energy. It‚Äôs an immersive setting that‚Äôs as much about the spectacle as the food, making it one of the most visually memorable dining experiences in London.

The food was top notch from start to finish. For starters, we had the fried mozzarella, carpaccio, and focaccia with bruschetta. All were excellent, but the bruschetta stood out for its twist on the classic‚Äîit was topped with grilled red and yellow peppers, which added a smoky sweetness and worked beautifully. I‚Äôd recommend all of them. For mains, we went with the classic Margherita pizza, the truffle pasta, and the crab spaghetti. The pizza had a light, Neapolitan-style dough‚Äîslightly soggy in the middle but redeemed by its airy, charred crust that gave it character. The crab spaghetti was flavorful and a strong option for seafood lovers, while the truffle pasta was easily the star of the night. It‚Äôs one of their signature dishes for good reason: creamy sauce, perfectly cooked pasta, and a luxurious flavor combination that made it an easy 10/10.

Overall, if you‚Äôre in the mood for a contemporary Italian dinner with a vibrant, festive atmosphere and food that delivers on quality, this place is a must-visit in London.
The food was good, atmosphere excellent, just be prepared for sharing tables. Service was a little inattentive. Venue is very pretty.

Excellent food. Good service. Festive atmosphere. This place is huge but gets booked up quickly. The food, taste, quality and portions are really good!
The steak was just right. Pizza was tasty. Ravioli was good.

The price is suitable and equitable. We had to use our phones to access the menu. I do hope they have physical menus to ensure it is accessible to all. Whilst I didn't like that I had to use my phone to access the menu, I guess it helps remove additional clutter. But I think people should readily have the option. Or at least one paper menu per table.
For some reason there were no point glasses or something. But the menu for drinks were using that measurement. We were told instead of a pint that we can do two halves and we had to ensure that we paid for a pint rather than the charged us for 2 half pints as that wasn't a fault of ours.
Whilst the food was on point, I really went  to try the lemon meringue pie. I was too full by the time it arrived but it was really good. It was so over the top, in a hood way. We clearly over ordered on desserts...ah well.
The one main thing I didn't like was the hidden charge in paying the bill via the QR code and having the customer pay to use their platform. That is less of a service and we are paying more for that. Again, it wasn't our choice to use the platform, so do not enforce a charge on us.
Overall, worthwhile... as the food is good quality. But careful on the subtleties of some unnecessary charges.

This was my second time in Circolo and it was a wonderful experience yet again. Brought in with me my sister and friends, it was their first time. Excellent food and cocktails, top-notch service and very professional staff. Shoutout to Eijaz who was serving our table, very helpful and accommodating. He made my mum's birthday celebration even more special with complimentary Tiramisu and Limoncello shots. We all had a great time. Thank you for the experience. Highly recommend, will visit again :)

We can here in 15th April for a bug dinner to celebrate our wedding day! We had a table of 17!!! And our server was amazing!!! Angel was our server and they were amazing!! Angel was so accommodating and kind! Angel is a credit to the restaurant and went well out their way to give us the most amazing wedding dinner!

The food was amazing! Everyone was happy and full by the end of the evening! I could not recommend this place enough! ü©∑

The place was very busy, the service was excellent. Feels very homely and professional at the same time. Lovely decor and music to create the vibes. Lemon meringue pie was very tangy lemon on the base and a very light Creamy meringue mousse. Ragu dish was meaty and not too heavy. Recommend the foccacia and parma ham.

Everything was perfect and delicious!! Our server Roby went above and beyond to make our dinner special. She gave us the best recommendations for drink and dinner. I‚Äôve never had better service! Even the managers stopped by to check on us to make sure we were enjoying our experience. Every single person from the hosts to the bartenders were so friendly. I‚Äôm traveling from the US but will make sure to come back again!

Lovely place 3min. walk from TottCourt Road station. The decor is truly amazing, nice athmosphere, good service and quality food. This was our 2nd time visit; this time we had a lunch on Friday afternoon, it was busy so reservation is needed. We ordered some antipasti then pasta & pizza main course (pasta with fresh truffle was really tasty) and dessert (tiramisu - top score plus some icecream).

Beautiful restaurant with really tasty fluffy-crust pizzas and fun mocktails. I like that the menu has calorie content listed, as well.
The pastas tasted a little plain for the money, but there were plenty of choices and it was worth trying.

Came for my birthday and although we were late they were incredibly accommodating! The service was excellent and loved their touches like the signed card and dessert with candle!
Bathrooms are clean  and the food was well seasoned and tasty. We had the truffle pasta. Music is kind of loud so you struggle to talk at a normal volume. Would recommend.

We had a fantastic time at Circolo Popolare. The restaurant was really busy (no surprise given how popular it is!) but it didn‚Äôt affect the service at all ‚Äî everything was smooth, friendly, and efficient.

The food was absolutely gorgeous. Every dish was full of flavour, but the standout for us was the lemon meringue pie ‚Äî not only delicious, but massive! Definitely one to share (or not!).

The atmosphere was lively with great vibes all round. A brilliant spot if you‚Äôre after authentic Italian food in a fun, buzzing setting.

This is one of those destination restaurants within London for birthdays and celebrations, or just to have a great meal within a beautifully decorated space.

Our waiters who took our orders were lovely and the welcoming, also food was great, however some of the food runners and other staff could have had better attitudes.

This place offers the experience of pasta by your table, it‚Äôs a great selling point and one that draws the influencers in who promote it on socials.

We are not that type but we wanted a video and picture by our table nonetheless, we were met with less that enthusiastic responses that left us feeling ashamed in some way for even asking.

They are no doubt sick of people asking for photos and what not, but that‚Äôs part of the job.

Could not fault the food and it was indeed vary tasty, drinks were top notch and made perfectly.

We will be back and I would highly recommend this restaurant.

We had an amazing experience. Everything was perfect, from the service to the food. Our waiter Felix made our time in the restaurant even better. I highly recommend, and will be coming back for sure!!

Took my mum here for a Mother‚Äôs Day treat and it did not disappoint. Truly a memorable experience, great food (very big portions!!), fantastic decor, and superb drinks. My mum said her fish was so good it melted in the mouth. Will definitely be back :)

Although it is extremely popular and needs to be booked weeks in advance, this restaurant did not leave a perfect impression. The food is tasty but not the best, although compared to other London restaurants, it is excellent. The pizza is average, as is the pasta. The chicken with potatoes was great, but the portion could have been bigger.
The best thing was the tiramisu‚Äîhighly recommended!

A downside is the digital menu, which is difficult to navigate. Additionally, payment can be made online without calling the waiter, but a 13.5% tip is automatically added, which can be an unpleasant surprise for guests. On top of that, there is an extra charge for using the digital payment service, but with a note that this fee can be avoided if a waiter is called. However, when we called the waiter, he directed us back to digital payment, putting the guest in an awkward position.

You NEED a reservation, its always so busy. Food was great, service was good too. You can tell they are constantly busy but food came fast. I do feel like it was a little over prices for what is was, it ended up being one of the more expensive meals we had on our trip but definitely not the best. Still great though!! Just be prepared to spend a lot. Not a huge fan of the desserts but the pistachio sorbet was good.

1. Good place to celebrate birthday or anniversary. The staffs will give you a card with their signatures! So warm! Ofc birthday song!
2. Buonissimo!! The food is great! Above average! Love the ravioli and the truffle pasta!!
3. The decoration is very beautiful too! Full of wine bottles, plates and photos!
4. Easy to pay!!! Spilt or pay together by phone(Apple Pay)

Come with friends or family!! Better not come alone, otherwise you will feel lonely:)

Had a lovely dinner here with a group of friends. We were lucky to get a table without a reservation, but I‚Äôd definitely recommend booking ahead‚Äîyou won‚Äôt want to miss out on the wonderful food. Our server, F√©lix, was fantastic: knowledgeable, friendly, and made the whole experience even better.

Don't believe the negative feedback until you truly experience it yourself.
Top restaurant ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
Pros:
1. Excellent staff service. Luis was so friendly and warm. Everyone made our experience magical.
2. Food is better than in Italy when I went.
3. Clean and immaculate place.
4. Food is affordable, I was expecting it to be pricier.
5. Magical, Instagrammable worthy restaurant.
6. Loved the Carbonara, Truffle pizza and Tiramisu is the best in the country. Hands down. Wow!
7. Accessible through tube travel.
Cons:
1. Open style toilet by the sink for male and female that they have to dim the lights so down low. My sister slipped.
2. Could have a bigger sign outside the restaurant.
They gave me a birthday card and free tiramisu that was enough for 3x people for free. They sang to me ü•∞ thanks for the wonderful staff who work here. Highly recommended! Thank you ‚ù§Ô∏èü´∂

Had a family meal for my daughter‚Äôs birthday and it was excellent, from beginning to end. Our waiter, Felix, was the perfect host, the food was incredible (my foodie son declared the carbonara the best he‚Äôd ever tasted) and the atmosphere brilliant- we were near the pass - felt like we were in an episode of The Bear! Just loved it and would highly recommend

My girlfriend and I are huge fans of Italian cuisine, so we had high expectations‚Äîand this place completely exceeded them! The atmosphere was beautiful, and the food was easily some of the best Italian we‚Äôve ever had. We started with the prosciutto and focaccia (not pictured), which were both incredible. The focaccia was soft and tender, and the prosciutto tasted fresh and authentically Italian. I ordered the grilled steak with salsa verde and a side of potatoes (also not pictured), and everything was full of flavor and perfectly cooked.
The real standout, though, was the ravioli‚Äîit was hands down the best we‚Äôve ever had. Every bite was rich, flavorful, and unforgettable. The drinks were also excellent, rounding out an amazing meal. We‚Äôre already planning our next visit!

Really enjoyed celebrating my friend‚Äôs birthday here! The service was good and the food was really nice too! The pasta was flavourful and cooked perfectly. We were worried that the food won‚Äôt be as good as it is a social media famous please but we were pleasantly surprised.
We couldn‚Äôt resist ordering another portion of the carbonara because it came with the cheese wheel.
Would come here again for a special occasion!

Food is good!! Tiramisu just melt in my mouth‚Ä¶ but still felt heavy.

It‚Äôs so busy so I went in the afternoon. Still the waiters seem to be stressed out because it‚Äôs too busy, and not enough waiters to take care of everyone‚Ä¶ hard to catch their attention. I asked for tab water 2 times and it only came after I finished all my food and dessert. I was so thirsty and I had to pour from the table next to me who had their tab water‚Ä¶ in the end when I pay there was no paper of details, they just type a number on the card machine.

The food overall was nice, however, we ordered an arrabbiata (which wasn‚Äôt listed on the menu). What arrived was simply spaghetti in a plain tomato sauce‚Äîcompletely bland and lacking any seasoning‚Äîso we returned it.

Service left a lot to be desired. We struggled to get the waiter‚Äôs attention both when ordering dessert and again when asking for the bill. At one point, we were abruptly told there would be no dessert menu and that we had to use the QR code instead, before the staff member briskly walked away. It left us feeling as though we weren‚Äôt worth their time.

The venue and atmosphere is lovely.

Managed to snag a weekday reservation with a few friends. One of the most gorgeous restaurant interiors I‚Äôve ever been in. Beautifully ordained ceilings with fairly lights engrossed in green vines and of course the iconic walls decorated with thousands of drink bottles. The restaurant is also much larger than images would lead to believe and our table was actually at the far back in a wide open area and we had a glimpse of a very lovely looking outdoor seating area as well. The tableware is all very lovely too but we noticed many were a bit chipped or slightly dirty upon arrival.

This is the second of the Big Mamma restaurants I have visited (the other being Gloria) and is definitely an improvement. From the sides we had their focaccia, deep-fried stracchino, courgette salad, beef leg carpaccio, and beef tartare. Everything tasted great with the beef tartare and deep-fried stracchino sticks being standouts. The beef leg carpaccio was good but had a slight fruitiness which I‚Äôm not too sure if is to my taste. Based on experience I would go for some of their other cured meat options but their beef tartare is a must.

From the mains we had the truffle pasta which I had at Gloria as well. This does not come with a wheel of cheese at Circolo (that is now reserved for their carbonara) but means you can order a single portion. Whilst somewhat bland at Gloria, here it was a delight and was a favourite among my group. We also had their veal ragu pasta which was excellent and might have been favourite pasta I‚Äôve had yet from Big Mamma. We also had their chicken skewers which came with crispy smashed potatoes and aubergine. This was good and came with decent variety. From the veggie options we had the spring fling pizza and the crispy breaded aubergine. The latter was fantastic and an excellent vegan option. The pizza however was not to my taste at all since it was adorned with many of their house olives which are quite strong. However, other members of my group did enjoy it so only order if you are sure to like their olives.

Lastly, from dessert we had their strawberry tomato salad and their profiterole. Both were great and the strawberry salad was a nice fresh finish to the meal. I would say that their lemon meringue pie is still probably the best dessert along with their cheesecake (which was unfortunately not available here).

Service was good, sometimes a bit muddled when taking additional orders and at one point gave us sparkling instead of tap water. Quite nice overall though. Overall, would definitely recommend trying if you can get a reservation but wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs worth booking months in advance unless you want a real showstopping experience for friends and family.

Absolutely stunning place, decoration is so immersive. Food was delicious, very well served dessert portions!
The cocktails were very good too!

We had a pre-theatre lunch here and it was incredible! The staff are so friendly and attentive. Even those who weren‚Äôt looking after us would give a smile. The food is so tasty and you get a great portion size. Highly recommend the asparagus antipasti! We will be back :)
Delicious food and great service. Place is a bit overcrowded and you need to book in advance. But it‚Äôs worth it. Strongly recommend.

We had we had a great evening! The dishes we had was most perfect and also favorite delicious. The pizza was one of the best I ever had the tomato sauce on that pizza was just amazing. We also very much liked all all the dishes. We will recommend everybody to come back to this place.
Amazing food, especially La Gran Carbonara (takes a bit long to make but definitely worth the wait). The restaurant‚Äôs decoration is from another world. Great experience!!!

the pizza was soo good. the crust was chewy but not overly thick, and the slight spiciness from the olives was calmed down by the cold burrata on top. the coldness of the burrata also juxtaposed with the hot crust, which was just an amazing flavour explosion.

the stracciatella was also a 10/10 - no surprise becsuse burrata is always delicious and this one was very fresh. the focaccia was good but wasn't toasted and didn't feel super fresh but was still delicious. the beef didn't have an overwhelmingly strong or raw taste, which made it a nice experience to eat.

however, the pastas were more mediocre for me. my friends claimed that the noodles were not soggy or weirdly sticky and chewy but i thought otherwise. the sauce for both pastas
were good though - very rich and flavourful

The food is alright, did not blow us away but was still tasty. The pasta was a bit hard, almost like it was undercooked rather than just al dente. However, the lemon tart was incredible - definitely recommend that! But all in all, it‚Äôs a really lovely restaurant / atmosphere and the staff were extremely friendly. We felt so comfortable dining here and didn‚Äôt feel rushed by the staff at all.

This restaurant is absolutely beautiful inside. elegant, romantic, and perfect for couples. The food was delicious, the service was excellent, and the prices were very reasonable. The focaccia was a tad too salty for my taste, but everything else was spot on. I‚Äôd definitely return and highly recommend it for a special evening out.

I found this restaurant on google as highly recommended. I showed up for lunch without a reservation and was able to eat 50 min later. Reserve ahead üôÇ

My server was slow to come and slow to deliver my drink but was friendly. My server was also slow to take my order. This is not necessarily a critique if you want to take your time üôÇ

I wanted the carbonara but was by myself so my server and I discussed some other options before she announced they could do carbonara for one üíô

I am sorry to say that my carbonara was very oversalted. It was edible but nothing special

I then put out my credit card to pay and was informed I could see my bill using the QR code. They add a tip and you have to ask your serve to remove it.

I‚Äôve increasingly noticed European restaurants following this American trend despite paying far better wages built into the prices

I did think the prices were reasonable

So that‚Äôs my opinion of this very popular place
Good food, we shared the famous lemon meringue pie (was very hot outside so think it melted!) and had the truffle pizza with tomato salad. Nice atomosphere would come again!

Hello.  Circolo Popolare was an incredible experience for us.  The greatest spot to have delicious Italian meals as a single person, couple, or group.  We ordered some testy cocktails and enjoyed a great pasta dish and a rocket pizza. The venue was really elegant, the personnel was quite pleasant, and the service was excellent.  In ten minutes, I received my order.  The employee that took our orders was Angel.  He gave a thorough explanation of everything.  He was fantastic.  He was especially helpful in selecting the food and beverages, both of which were excellent.  I would like to mention that the birthday celebration was unforgettable.  Although it was my first time, it won't be my last.  Many thanks

Everything about this place is just fantastic. Food is delicious on another level, beautifully served + great selection of drinks, both alcoholic and non-alcoholic. Botanical decor makes you feel like you are sitting in an Italian tavern. Good customer service, you feel welcomed and looked after from the entry. Will be back for more!

Stunning Interior, Mediocre Food

We visited Circolo Popolare mainly for its gorgeous, chic interior ‚Äì and it definitely delivered on atmosphere and design. The place is visually stunning and has a great vibe.

Unfortunately, the food didn‚Äôt quite match the setting. The truffle pasta was overcooked and overly buttery ‚Äì the truffle flavor was lost under all that richness. The meat was undercooked, which was disappointing.

On the bright side, the staff acknowledged the kitchen issues and offered us extra champagne, which was a nice gesture.

Overall, it was a mediocre experience ‚Äì beautiful setting, but the food needs to live up to the hype.

Had a nice meal. I'm not a huge fan of shared tables, but it worked out they accommodated us anyway, If that's not for you .. make a reservation!
!*** update***, All the food tasted quite good and was quick to the table,
We had the Carpaccio, foccacia, and pizza.

Such a beautifully designed restaurant with great atmosphere and service. The food was good, but for the look, cost of it and difficulty getting a reservation I did expect more. There was no stand out dish to for me.

Great restaurant and the service from all the staff was very good. Ambience is lovely and wasn‚Äôt overly loud and could comfortably have a conversation with a partner/friends.

One thing I would have liked as a standard thing, is to have physical food menus rather than scanning a code to access it. Would be nice to have this without having to ask for it. The wine and drinks list came as a physical menu, but this was not the case for the food menu.

Overall a nice restaurant and would recommend to use again in the future.

Lovely place to come for food. Came with my friends for two of their birthdays. The staff were very attentive and even gave my friends birthday cards! We all agreed our starters were quite bland, however our mains were fantastic! I had the Tagliatella All‚ÄôOssobuco, which had a lovely ragu sauce with tons of flavour and depth. The prices were reasonable for the quality of the food and the service. An amazing place I would definitely recommend‚ù§Ô∏è

Not sure where to start, but I will say that everything was just perfect. I booked a table for myself and my mum for Mother‚Äôs Day and we had some of the antipasti, the carbonara that came served in the Parmesan wheel and of course a pizza (one of the best pizza tasted) because we like food and we ended with one lemon pie to share. We both loved the experience, the food and the service. Highly recommend and we will be back. ü•≥
The restaurant is beautiful!! The cocktail was tasty and refreshing , the pizza is ok, the carb pasta was delicious and the desserts were really yummy.

I‚Äôve tried several dishes at Circolo Popolare. Not all their pasta is to my taste‚ÄîI'm not a fan of the Crab Pasta, but I really enjoyed the Ravioli alla Bolognese. Their Truffle Pizza is definitely a must-try! The ambiance is really nice and lively, making it a great place to dine. As for the tiramisu, it‚Äôs just okay for me, but of course, it depends on your personal taste. Overall, worth a visit with some dishes worth trying!

Not worth the hype.

Lovely ambiance but a dated ‚Äòchain feeling‚Äô restaurant.
Some of the food we had for the standard of restaurant was sub-par, burnt bread and chicken on the pinker side. The pasta dishes were gorgeous and perfectly cooked (crab).

Most of the crockery was beautiful looking but a lot of it had chips and dents.

We were told to pay via the QR code app which automatically submits service charge and then asks for additional tip on top of previous service charge and then adds an admin fee per transaction on top!

Overall nice causal restaurant but not a special experience.

Food wasn‚Äôt amazing. Ordered carbonara for 2 ppl in round pecorino cheese. The sauce stayed inside the cheese and has been taken away therefore pasta was dry and also hard (not even al dente). I mean hard. Also literally had 3 pieces of meat inside for each person. Coctails were small and expensive. The tiramisu was also small portion. The only thing we liked was the lemon tart. We won‚Äôt be back for sure.

Lovely place. Great food - loved the truffle pizza, Burrata, and the small plates we ordered. Stunning interiors from the walls decorated with vintage bottles, ceiling decor etc. Staff were cordial, and service was super quick. We had a lovely time. I‚Äôm kicking myself that I was too full to try any of their desserts. Would highly recommend!

Lovely Italian restaurant with an amazing atmosphere. Circolo Popolare has a large menu for all types of eaters. The carpaccio was just perfect and went well with the focaccia. Also their pasta dishes are delicious. It's a bit pricey but would definitely recommend it. Don't forget to make a reservation.

The food was amazingly delicious and a very good service. I will recommend it. Also, it would be good to include more vegan options for the mains with protein, normally it is just one for primo and one for secondo. The vegan dessert was superb.

Circolo Popolare is a must-visit for all foodies around the world. First and foremost, the restaurant is a gem in terms of design‚Äîone of the most beautiful places I've been to; I can't imagine anything surpassing it in this regard.
