Regarding the food, we ordered several pasta dishes, meat with vegetables, and truffle pizza, which was my favorite dish. At the restaurants in the Big Mamma group, you simply can't go wrong with pizza. The desserts and cocktails were good, but not incredible; the price was a bit high considering their taste.

On the downside, you might be unlucky enough to be seated at a cramped table, perhaps too close to other people; this wasn't our case, but we noticed it with other patrons. Additionally, you might feel a bit rushed; the food arrives very quickly, and all the waiters are very well-trained, but you're always aware that you should hurry‚Äîyou can't linger, which prevents you from having a perfect experience. However, this is understandable given the place's popularity. Reservations are mandatory, probably made at least two weeks in advance to ensure you get a spot on your desired day.

I will definitely return to this gorgeous restaurant when I visit London again.

It is such a beautiful restaurant, every single bottle of alcohol you can imagine all around. It has such a lovely atmosphere. The staff are really friendly.

How would I rate the food? We went with the ‚ÄòSome like it Hot‚Äô and ‚ÄòMargarita‚Äô pizza and a side of Siracchino Fritto. The pizza was a classic Italian pizza fire oven, with a thick crust and thin base. The spicy pizza I went for had so many nice flavours. I wasn‚Äôt a huge fan of the tarragon herb on top which was a new one I hadn‚Äôt tried before. It has a licorice taste to it. Personally I don‚Äôt think this worked with the sweet and spicy flavours. I picked this off and it was a very enjoyable pizza. From pizzas I‚Äôve had and how this compares, I felt that the pizza was quite watery in the centre. The fried cheese we had on the side were cooked perfectly but didn‚Äôt have much flavour. The tomato sauce helped save the taste adding more of a rich, salty taste to it.

I think overall Circolo Popolare is a fantastic place to visit if your ever in London, for the experience. Not so much for the food. The food is great and it‚Äôs not terrible but it‚Äôs not up there with anything incredible. Overall I would rate it a 7/10. üçï

The food was delicious, the atmosphere absolutely stunning, and our server was excellent ‚Äî truly a memorable dining experience overall. I would have given 5 stars, but two things held me back. First, one staff member saw me waving for attention, made eye contact, then turned away without acknowledgment simply because she wasn‚Äôt in charge of our section. A small gesture like a nod or smile would have gone a long way. Then, as I was leaving, a waitress accidentally spilled drinks on me and a few other patrons. Mistakes happen, of course ‚Äî but an apology would‚Äôve been appreciated. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
Everything was great, and the location is amazing. We had to wait a bit for the main course, but it was worth it! I‚Äôll definitely come back! Highly recommended!

Food was lovely, service too. We didn‚Äôt like the fact that one of the waiters was collecting all dirty napkins next to us, this should have been done in settings where customers shouldn‚Äôt see this.
Óóä

The food was excellent ‚Äî fresh flavors, beautifully balanced, and presented with a clean, refined aesthetic. Each dish reflected great attention to detail in execution.

Unfortunately, the service fell short of the same standard. While the plates spoke for themselves, the experience was let down when our waiter began walking away midway through explaining a dish. It disrupted the flow and diminished what should have been a polished, engaging moment.

Overall, the cooking deserves recognition, but service consistency needs to match the quality coming out of the kitchen for the experience to truly shine.

We celebrated an anniversary at Hide, and were lucky enough to have received a gift voucher to use for dinner. We decided on the tasting menu which was divine. The service was mostly fantastic, and we enjoyed the special experience as a whole.

We weren‚Äôt given a wine list to ascertain prices or review what we might like to drink. We were basically just asked what we like, and could‚Äôve been given ¬£¬£¬£ wines by the glass. I wasn‚Äôt overly impressed with this and it felt like a fuss to ask for the menu.

The music was not a vibe and I often found it too loud. It was like classic hits and pop songs rather than an ambient, elegant restaurant playlist which I feel would be better.

The signature dessert let the entire menu down. It‚Äôs beautiful being modelled on the staircase, but the dominant banana flavour I really didn‚Äôt enjoy, and I didn‚Äôt finish it.

Overall, we did love the dinner but there were a few details that let some parts down.

Difficult to assess. We were told initially we were going to be upstairs, but we were sat downstairs. Very busy venue with lots of groups some quieter than others. We went for breakfast and I am a huge fan of cooked breakfasts. The ‚Äúfry up‚Äù was a very small mushroom, one unexciting sausage of no great flavour and two small rashers of streaky bacon and half a large tomato with a thick central core. The food was reasonably free of too much grease, but not overly flavoursome, sadly a nice but underwhelming breakfast, not least for the price. At ¬£30 one expects great textured flavour rich sausages. Eggs were just ages nicely cooked but not much more to say. Staff were lovely breakfast was ok. My sourdough toast was good and my daughter was thrilled with her huge croissant with a number of choices of spreads and jams. Is it interesting? Yes, was it the sort of meal I would expect to see at a one Michelin starred venue not really

Went here for our anniversary dinner and had the tasting menu which was wonderful.
I wanted to especially mention our server Chloe - she was incredible. She made our evening so special and she took special care with the dietary requirements as I was pregnant. She really is a credit to this restaurant.
Chloe - if you‚Äôre reading this, you were right - we had a girl! :)

‚≠êÔ∏è5 stars ‚Äì One of London‚Äôs finest, consistently exceptional.

Took my best friend here for a treat and had the tasting menu, absolutely incredible. Every dish was refined, refreshing, and packed with thoughtful flavours. It‚Äôs the kind of food you simply can‚Äôt replicate at home, which makes the experience feel special.

The portions were just right: satisfying without being overwhelming. Service was polished, friendly, and perfectly paced. You leave feeling well looked after, not overly full or rushed.

This spot has been holding the bar high for years and still delivers every single time. A true favourite. 10/10.

The unusual menu format drew me to Hide but I found the whole experience surpassed my expectations and was far better than the foamy fare of standard Michelin Star places. The rotation of charming service staff with each dish was a nice touch to sync in with the variety of the courses. Our favorite course was the Not A Bread but it was one of many stand outs. Ambience, design and music also all excellent. Wine pairing was mixed and didn't stand out. Would benefit from more unusual offerings complimenting the menu style.

It was still a wonderful dining experience but felt a little different this time due to the recent change of chef and menu. Service is good - warm and professional, and nothing is overlooked from start to end. The updated menu is quite intriguing. A couple of dishes stand out, strong getting wowed of the truffle tart. Even so, we were sad to not see some hits from the previous repeats and overall flavour profile felt a bit less bold. It is still one of the finest dinning places in the surrounding area. Eager to see how the new chef will take the culinary directions further.

I‚Äôll save you time- book reservations here now. Hands down the best breakfast experience I‚Äôve ever had. I especially loved the small menu of rare and fine coffees, which were all absolutely delicious with unexpected flavors. The porridge, granola, black truffle, scrambled eggs, and croque monsieur were all absolutely exceptional. To top everything off, the sleek and organic design aesthetic adds to your experience as well as the great customer service. I highly recommend and hope I can return soon!

My friend and I had the tasting menu. Food was nice. The first few snacks were amazing in terms of variety and presentation, but it went downhill as we moved to the fish and lamb courses. They were still nice but not memorable, really. The restaurant was so dark at that point that we almost had to blind test our taste buds, the experience which I didn't enjoy as much. Colour vibrancy was essential to me, especially at over ¬£200 price point without alcoholic consumption. Service was lacking. The sever didn't place cutlery gently or with precision. The restaurant didn't give me a fine dining setting anyway. Explanation of the dishes was not clear, and adding on top of the lack of visual presentation in the dark, I could hardly tell which was which. The oak staircase was great. The water tank-like glass facade facing the buzz of the city was controversial at ground level though.

Tucked away from central London‚Äôs chaos, this must-visit spot offers a truly memorable dining experience. The serene, picturesque setting and unique aesthetics transport you far from the city the moment you arrive.

Service is top-tier; warm, thoughtful, and attentive. During a special occasion, the staff quietly offered a better table when one opened up, making the time there even more special.

The curated menu balances creativity with comfort, with each dish feeling purposeful and refined.

Perfect for celebrations or quiet escapes, this restaurant is a rare find, charming, calming, and unforgettable.

The service? Outstanding! The interior design? Amazing.
The food was also very good, but I have to say, the buckwheat dish (and that's the only dish I can give an opinion on) was a tad bit too acidic. Instead of raw onions, caramelised ones would give a bit of sweetness and a bit crisp, I suppose. Great quality nevertheless, and the service was amazing, very kind people. In general, more on the expensive side, but the interior design alone is worth paying a visit. Very earthy.
The tea was also very good (could be a bit stronger, though (French Blue).

Service was outstanding. Immaculately presented food. The flavour profile of the dishes left me wanting, just a little bit; not quite as balanced as I would have hoped for, considering the price. Outstanding in catering for dietary requirements.

We booked a breakfast reservation at Hide, and it exceeded all our expectations! This one Michelin star restaurant offers breakfast, lunch, and dinner, but the breakfast alone is worth the visit. We were seated promptly, and the ambiance was elegant with a unique woody and quirky charm. Don‚Äôt miss the stunning spiral staircase‚Äîit‚Äôs perfect for a photo op. They offer a great selection of specialty coffees and beans; my iced coffee was excellent. The standout for me was the granola yogurt‚Äîit was absolutely fantastic. Highly recommend this spot for a refined and memorable breakfast experience!
Nice breakfast experience. A bit on the pricy side but you pay for the place and location. Brioche bread on the toast and scrambled eggs a bit dry, but nothing a good spoon of butter can‚Äôt fix.

Nice venue, good service. My main course was a rabbit lasagna (¬£8 supplement and not really worth it as it was very small for what you get).

Americano charged at ¬£6.50 and you don‚Äôt even get a small biscuit or chocolate- a rip off for a coffee.

Compared to other restaurants, I found the venue on the overprice side  for what you get.

Breakfast at Hide during the Pride parade - booked it via a phone call as there was no more availability for the time we wanted online - window seat to watch the parade - Magic.  Everything we ordered was seriously good.  The seasonal Danish was AMAZING. Strawberry and tonka bean - who knew?

I had a really nice lunch at HIDE the other day. The lunch menu is pretty well priced and comes with a starter, main, and dessert. The oyster tempura was definitely my favourite. The dessert is not as good as the mains unfortunately.

The service however could have been better - the staff were a bit cold, and it didn‚Äôt really have the attentiveness you‚Äôd expect from a Michelin-starred restaurant.

Had a lovely dinner at Hide, invited by a business partner. The food was creative and tasty with a very cohesive menu. The service was friendly, and our glasses were always full. The cocktail prices are quite reasonable, I'd be gladly back to have their tasting menu. Highlights for me were the amazing breads and the mushroom broth!

I had an unforgettable lunch experience at Hide. From the moment I walked in, the service was impeccable ‚Äî warm, professional, and perfectly in line with Michelin standards. The lunch set menu was beautifully curated, offering refined flavors, artistic presentation, and thoughtful balance in every course. The ambiance was elegant yet relaxed, allowing me to fully enjoy each dish in comfort. Every detail, from the freshly baked bread to the final petit fours, reflected a high level of care and craftsmanship. I highly recommend Hide for anyone looking for an exceptional fine dining experience in London.

My first birthday celebration in London with a beautiful soul who is really thoughtful. It was a bit surprise for me as I just mentioned the name of the restaurant randomly.‚ô•Ô∏è

Thank you so much for the wonderful experience. I enjoyed the dishes we ordered and the special cards with the little candle ~ it was such a joyful moment.

I am not a wine drinker but I quite enjoyed drinking the red wine here üç∑ and it didn‚Äôt make my face red at all.

‚Ä¢ Ambiance: 5/5
‚Ä¢ Service: 5/5 ‚Äî attentive without being pushy
‚Ä¢ Food: 5/5 ‚Äî full of rich, flavorful taste
‚Ä¢ Company: 6/5

Highly recommend for a ‚≠êÔ∏è star-level dining experience or celebrating special events!

Really striking restaurant- light and airy and the seating was incredibly comfortable
We were there for Sunday lunch - each course was well made and tasty - everyone enjoyed their dishes.
The stand out was the rabbit lasagne - would come back for they alone.
The desserts which are typically my favourite course were too sweet and rich with no relief or something to cut through the sugar
Would def come back to have dinner
The only let down for us was the service - unfortunately our waitress was not the nicest coming across as quite curt - asking for anything eg the drinks menu etc seemed to be a hassle for her which dampened our experience

Little disappointed from this over hyped restaurant.

The setting is beautiful, the staircase is a showstopper, staff are welcoming and professional.

Attention to detail is lacking, my water glass smelled like egg (it was replaced, but should not have been at the table), sugar bowl was chipped and for a restaurant of this calibre should not have been placed at the table.

Croque monsieur was delicious but the crust was hard to cut or bite into.

The Florentine eggs were very slightly undercooked as you had the gelatinous white. The spinach was well seasoned and perfectly cooked.

For the famous banana and pecan croissant and French toast, what a disappointment.
Both lacked in taste, very soggy and uninteresting.

This was not my first nor will it be  my last time the place is beautiful, staff are lovely and I'm sure there is plenty of other dishes to try.

Breakfast here was such a vibe. We had the Full English, truffle scrambled eggs on toast, egg Benedict and blueberry toast. I highly recommend the blueberry toast, however the only thing that wasn‚Äôt to my taste was the Thai coffee. Being Thai myself I should‚Äôve known! Really looking forward to my next visit here.

Exceptional food, beautiful decor, fantastic ambience and perfect service.
Having visited a few times now I have never had a bad experience at Hide.
There is something for everyone on the menu and no dish will disappoint you, particular highlights being the softshell crab, bread basket (absolute must) and the potato cakes. All of the steaks are high quality meat cooked to perfection.
The staff are plentiful and extremely attentive but without feeling overbearing. They're always there when you need them but unlike some establishments they aren't constantly interrupting you. The sommelier team and the selection of wines behind them are the icing on the cake to the brilliant food.
From full meals, to snacks to drinks in the bar downstairs you will never be disappointed here.

This place was beyond my expectations. Appart from the amazing service, the food was delicious. Everything, from the bread at the start to the desert at the end was perfect. I enjoyed every moment of it. Now the place itself ‚Ä¶ simply gorgeous. The stair is actually made from one single tree. When you go there, visit the private rooms downstairs (if they are empty). Each one of them is decorated with a theme. I would recommended a hundreds times !!!

The service was exceptional, the ambiance was beautiful, and the atmosphere was just perfect. The food? Absolutely unforgettable - the best breakfast I‚Äôve ever had! Whatever you do, don‚Äôt skip the soaked pistachio orange bun, it was pure perfection. Words can‚Äôt truly capture how amazing this experience was, so just go and see for yourself!

We had a nice breakfast experience here overall. The free cloakroom was a nice touch as we entered. The restaurant itself is beautiful; yes, the stairs are pretty cool. The service was quite friendly and we were served fairly quickly. The croque monsieur was tasty, though the coffee was not particularly memorable, certainly not for the price.

Two young kids (3, 5) and a tasting menu at a Michelin star restaurant often isn‚Äôt a good idea. It was the best experience at HIDE! We were all made to feel so welcome. Phenomenal food. The ‚Äúiconic‚Äù pairing was great. Couldn‚Äôt recommend it more! Thank-you HIDE for an epic, memorable experience üôè

Hide was definitely one of the best restaurants I‚Äôve ever eaten at in London! This was my fifth time visiting, and I usually spend a week dining out. I‚Äôm happy to say that Hide is in my top three!

The atmosphere is fantastic, the service is excellent, and the food was absolutely on point! We also tried a vintage dessert wine, which was just perfect.

We loved it so much that we recommended it to our friends, and they loved it too!

Amazing front of house team. Amazing energy and warming team. Good mushroom, black pudding and sausage. Sour dough bread was super hard, tomato needs seasoning and flavour like the mushroom. Egg where cold and so was the pate

I visited Hide during December and to this day I still think of it often as their interior to their food was so memorable. Starting from the beautiful open inside that spirals up a mystical feeling tree carved stair case. The Croque Madame was incredible and their Nova Lox wrap was a very creative take on meal that I have myself often at home. Service here was great and drinks were also delicious.

Just keep coming back! Food and Service outstanding and not to mention the wine list. Especially Sanita went above and beyond to share the secrets of the staircase. Will definitely be booking to come back soon.
Hide is just fantastic! The atmosphere is great and it is just a very good place to enjoy high quality food! From the pastries, to the sweets and savory tu dishes! Really enjoyed the experience!

Great spot for brunch for a special occasion - they gave me a card and a candle on my pastry for my birthday. Loved the truffle scramble eggs on toast and we also had the buckwheat pancake waffle with smoked salmon (less memorable). The pain au chocolate was also lovely though and the staff were super attentive and willing to go the extra mile to take photos for us. Coffee was also great and good selection of beans.

Fantastic breakfast. The fresh sweet mango is prepared particularly special. We also had the avocado and poached eggs and fresh juices. The centre piece of the restaurant is the spiral hand carved staircase and the front door is also amazing in that it‚Äôs almost ‚Äúhidden‚Äù

We visited for breakfast, the pastries and croque Madame were really good. Unfortunately found the brioche for the truffle scrambled egg quite dry.
Service was great and was nice atmosphere.

Celebrated my birthday here last week. The food was beautifully presented and delicious. We got the bread basket (highly recommend), the nest egg (10/10), beetroot starter (7/10), scallops (8/10), mains were venison (7/10) and octopus (8/10), with a pear sorbet (9/10).

It was a great experience and the service was excellent! The decor is beautiful as well, we will be back to experience the breakfast:)

I‚Äôve been here twice for breakfast/brunch. I wouldn‚Äôt say the food is amazing, but it‚Äôs really, really good. It‚Äôs a little pricey, but since it‚Äôs a fancy place, that‚Äôs expected. The ambiance is super stylish‚ÄîI especially like their area on the upper floor. My a√ßa√≠ bowl was just okay, but the matcha was really good, and the pastries were excellent.
Great meal out last night in the UK.  Order two bread baskets, one goes quick.  Food and service were outstanding.  Great night out.

Been here twice for brunch. Once solo and one with friends for my birthday. Each time I received impeccable friendly service. The breakfast and pastries were both divine. Such a pretty restaurant too.

Lovely restaurant, swift service and great presentation. The price you pay, the portions you receive not worth it at all. Food was very average at best. Menu description was great and really oversold very average food.

Was not impressed with the way they portrayed the choice of waiters/waitresses for food service. They had chosen a few certain ethnic backgrounds which isn't an issue but the way they were serving was as if they had been told to act a certain way. Reminded me of slaves. Really not impressed.
Great food. Egg royale is very recommended. The service was great and waited maximum 5 minutes until I got my order. Should note that the prices are high.
Loved the meal here! Serves were knowledgable, super friendly and they gave us a tour of the wine cellar too! Great evening out

What a lovely experience.
We got a table that overlooked Green Park which was a lovely sight.
The food was good, perhaps slightly underwhelming for a one star restaurant.
Service was on point, the sommelier was very friendly and knowledgeable.
We didn‚Äôt feel rushed and enjoy every single minute of our experience.
For a treat, go and try Hide. You overall won‚Äôt be disappointed

This restaurant has been our favourite for years, we always recommended it to friends and visitors. But the last visit was a waste of money, sadly. We couldn‚Äôt understand the change but later learnt that Ollie is no longer the chef there üíî he would have never put raw unseasoned cucumbers at the top like that. Smaller portions and thin flavour. I understand the loyalty to promote your other staff but won‚Äôt be surprised if you lose your star next year. The desserts were great but it‚Äôs just one course from 4 we tried. Gutted to lose this place ü•∫

Is the staircase amazing? Yes
Is the service good? Yes
Is the food excellent? Yes
Is the view nice? Yes

But, I've had better pastries elsewhere in London for way cheaper (it cost me ¬£72 for 2 drinks and 3 dishes of food.)

It's definitely an experience and somewhere to have a celebration, but I don't think we'd ever come back on a whim.

Had an intimate wedding dinner in a private room (reading room). Thoughtful and whimsical decor. The staff was exceptional! Not only in knowledge of what they were doing, also very personal and authentic. THATS what you need in a great service team! Food was excellent as well, as expected from a Michelin Restaurant, but the service was what makes you feel at home. Thank you ‚ô•Ô∏è

Very happy with the set lunch (though still pricey, nett ¬£64).
Lamb tartare starter - excellent, prata bread and greens complemented perfectly.
Steamed cod - excellent, flavourful mussel broth, perfectly cooked fish to the ideal texture, and a satisfying portion size
Lava tart and oak ice cream - average. Ice cream was quite melted (maybe the bowl wasn‚Äôt pre-chilled)

We have lovely breakfast.  We like it esp the French Toast.
Both decoration and ambience is very nice.

One of my favourite restaurants in London. I‚Äôve been at least 8 times and the breakfast and lunch are both equally amazing, alongside the service and ambience. The bar downstairs is also great with wonderful negronis. The bread basket is the best bread basket I‚Äôve ever had.

Food was outstanding, but our service and experience was disappointing. I think we got unlucky with our waiter, we were left waiting 30 minutes to order our food and he got my main order wrong. He was very uncommunicative and didn‚Äôt double check our order at all. We were visiting for breakfast and got very hungry. I noticed people around us had a stall for their bags, but we weren‚Äôt given this. I was expecting a lot better from a Michelin star restaurant. We were visiting for a special occasion (anniversary) and did not feel like it was as much of a treat as it should have been.
Our first time here, ordered croque madame with truffle. It was pretty nice. Enjoyed much.
Lovely restaurant with pleasant staff. Price commentate to location and decor. Food was good.

I was genuinely excited to have breakfast at HIDE, but left disappointed. I ordered the ‚ÄúRipe honey mango with Thai basil & kaffir lime‚Äù the description sounded refined and thoughtful. In reality, it was just two plain mango slices with a few micro herbs on top. No noticeable kaffir lime, no complexity, no special touch. Just mango. It felt more like a garnish than a standalone dish

Also, many dishes are not available for takeaway ‚Äúdue to sauces or presentation,‚Äù which makes it unnecessarily restrictive especially when the food is quite simple

A beautiful place, but the experience didn‚Äôt live up to expectations

Style over substance. The bread is it's high and it goes down from there. Had the tasting menu which is hors d'oeuvre 3 courses and petit fours. For ¬£165 not good value! The food whilst cooked well was unimaginative and I wasn't wowed by the flavour. The lamb dish was a toughish piece of meat and the fat not rendered down.

Any easy pass

I had high expectations for the food considering the Michelin star and the rave reviews online by influencers. Unfortunately, I thought that the food was lacklustre considering the price point and what the restaurant sets out to achieve.

Firstly, the French toast was decent but not amazing. The insides were more mushy than soft, hence there was a lack of bite to the dish.

Secondly, the croissants I ordered - chocolate and pecan banana were served cold, and I think they would have tasted better if they were warm. There was hardly any chocolate in the chocolate croissant at all.

Oysters were okay if on the small side.

Service was decent but restaurant was really busy on the day I went so staff was unable to interact much with guests.

Overall, would expect better for the price point of the restaurant.

Was there a few weeks ago to celebrate a friend‚Äôs birthday, and it was a great dining experience. The service was attentive, friendly, and thoughtful, making the occasion feel extra special.

The food was was beautifully presented. Some of the dishes that I enjoyed were so unique as well like the scallops specifically. The restraunt‚Äôs ambiance made this a memorable experience.

Staff were friendly and attentive, food and drinks were effortless, quick to arrive and very tasty for breakfast. The speciality coffee was amazing, have never tasted such a smooth coffee in my life. Price point was fair for quality and service. Can‚Äôt wait to come back, maybe for dinner next time.
Fine dining done right! The food was great overall but the buckwheat pancake with salmon and cream cheese was the star of the show üåü

Great experience all round. Good food, excellent service and relaxed but still nice environment.
Stand-out menu item was the French toast. The banana pecan croissant was not everything it was hyped to be. Everything else was great.

It was an amazing celebration of my birthday in such a beautiful, cozy atmosphere of the highest quality restaurant in the heart of central London. Thank you so much for that evening üòä.  Everything was perfect üëå.

We had an amazing anniversary dinner. Special mention to our server SINITA not sure of the spelling. But she really did a great job explaining the dishes to us. Our favorite is the carabineros prawns it was superb highly recommended. ü•∞

During my recent visit to The Hide, I found the food to be decent but not particularly remarkable. Among the dishes we tried, the egg nest and grilled octopus stood out as the better options, showcasing some creativity and flavor. However, the overall dining experience was marred by service issues.

It was a busy night at the restaurant, which undoubtedly contributed to the challenges we faced in getting attention from our server. We often found ourselves needing to flag down someone just to refill our water or wine glasses, which is frustrating during a celebratory girls' night out in London.

When our main courses arrived, there was a notable mix-up with the orders. The server seemed confused about which dish belonged to whom, which is quite unacceptable, especially in a busy restaurant setting. This added a layer of stress to the evening that detracted from our enjoyment.

Ultimately, the lack of timely refills for our drinks significantly impacted our experience. It‚Äôs disappointing when a night out is overshadowed by service shortcomings, despite the potential for a good meal. I hope The Hide can address these issues, as the food has promise, but the service needs improvement to match.

Visited HIDE for breakfast and I would say it has to be one of the most opulent breakfast experiences I've had!

The venue is truly stunning and ascending the iconic staircase to my table really set the scene for the experience.

I ordered the Full English with poached eggs and a Flat White. Both were excellent, every element of the breakfast plate was meticulously prepared and presented. The bread and butter were incredibly good and the eggs were poached to perfection. The coffee was also excellent, I chose an Ethiopian Yirgacheffe coffee however there are a variety of coffees to choose from.

Service was relaxed and attentive without being overbearing.

It's not every day one gets the chance to have a Michelin-starred breakfast. It's a very enjoyable experience and one I would recommend!

Ngl I feel like Ive just been scammed. Ridiculous price for such a bad experience, the starter was the first but not the last disappointment, I was expected to experience the journey of Italian cuisine, not an Asian parent‚Äôs simulator, the starter what was the name? Meat n Bones? Just a small piece of bacon wrapped around a bone like stick no taste no flavor just purely for show. It‚Äôs like you(an Asian) were presented with your firstborn child and you don‚Äôt know what to do with the child so you tried to give the kid every chances in life only for it to end up as a mixture of fancy useless failure. The rest of the dishes were the same as the first, bunches of f disappointment. The attitude of one of the waitress was not very polite, we were talking when the waitresses bring out the dishes and started coughing or something, trying to stop us from talking so she can introduce the dish(it happened many times not just once), very unprofessional, is what normal people would say but for me, she is a spoiled brat who were definitely raised by a bad single parent(clearly she did not know how to behave in such environment) because what she was doing not only damaged her reputation but the restaurant too, she must know that actions have consequences, I normally would leave a 15% tips but for her action I regret that I can not take the tips from her. (personally Im asian and where Im from, attitudes, especially in the service‚Äôs industry is everything, the key to success or their downfall). Last but not least, the atmosphere was in fact the most pleasant thing out of everything I had just mentioned above. The wooden stair was alright but still nothing impressive like Bacchanalia. For conclusion, save your money for other high-end restaurants, this one does not worth the hype nor the price. I only choose to go to this one on valentine because others are fully booked. Just for the final nail in the coffin, anyone know the differences between jokes and food from HIDE? Jokes have meanings. I am being generous to give it a 2 stars rating, it deserves 0,5.

Visited HIDE before Christmas for lunch.

Overall we found this place lived upto our expectations, with great front of house staff, lovely atmosphere and stunning surroundings.

The food was expectational but even for regulars to Michelin star restaurants, we found it very expensive.

Very bland fish with two pieces of a vegetable, 3 mussels and of course a foamy sauce. Pretty tasteless, not worth the hype. The waiter kept coming to talk to us which was irritating, called us "his lovely ladies" üôÑ Also we took tap water but they put still water on our bill and almost charged us.

From the moment I walked in, the space felt elegant but still super inviting, with all the natural light coming through those huge glass windows. Walking up the iconic staircase to my table really set the vibe for something special. The service was on point; really friendly and attentive but not over the top. For the quality of food and the whole experience, I‚Äôd say it was well worth it. If you‚Äôre looking for a fancy but relaxed breakfast spot in London, this is it. Whether you‚Äôre into Michelin-starred dining or just want to treat yourself, I‚Äôd definitely recommend giving it a try!

To me, one of the best restaurants in London for all occasions. Service is exceptional. Ambience, food servicing, selection of spirits, it all gives you a unique experience.
My personal top choice is breakfast for sure, definitely go for French toast, and try any pastry (these are freshly baked every morning)
Dinner is also worth mentioning. Every dish is a masterpiece. From starters, I really enjoyed scallops and mackerel tartar.
As for the main, my go-to is octopus (it just melts)
Service and location make this place worth a visit.  Sit on the 1st floor with a view of Green Park.    The Mango dish was yummy, but very small.    Croque Monsieur hit the mark.

Hands down best breakfast place in London. Obsessed with their food. Come here every couple of weeks to check out new pastries on the menu- always innovative! It is pricey, but as expected in Mayfair. Service not always on point (they seem to have a lot of rotation), but that‚Äôs just a detail and the food is worth it! Nice coffee selection with some interesting choices. Try it!

One of the best dining experiences I've had, not just in London, but in all of the places I've ever travelled to. I was down with work and brought along my partner - and we both LOVED the food and hospitality was next level. Can't recommend this place enough to anyone that loves dining at the next level.

I unfortunately was not looking at the menu prices properly or it's just I didn't think that my starter which I chose XL size prawns wouldn't cost me a 90¬£ , but I was wrong and I actually didn't really enjoy them as of I payed 90¬£ ,but didn't had any satisfaction from having it. Glad it isn't me the one who payed our bill :)))

This was our first time in a Michelin starred restaurant, and thus at HIDE. Everything was perfect, from service to food. Everyone was very welcoming, waiters gave us awesome food recommendations! For the quality of the food we tasted, this felt perfectly priced. This is hands on the best restaurant I‚Äôve been to.
I‚Äôd recommend trying the chicken liver parfait, and the chocolate pot, both were wow.

It was an amazing evening at HIDE. The team was so hospitable and delivered from the moment we stepped into the restaurant till the end.

From introducing the menu to giving recommendations, we were easily convinced by the knowledgeable staff.

Food in general was really presentable, we were a little underwhelmed by the highly acclaimed appetiser - nest egg. It was solid but it didn‚Äôt deliver the wow factor we were expecting. However, the meticulous craftsmanship dedicated to creating the dish and the egg itself was appreciated.

The mains were just gorgeous, we ordered chicken, pork and squid. They were all very delicious and cooked to perfection, we didn‚Äôt leave anything behind. We also really loved how the meat dishes were prepared in more than one ways, so you can get variations out of the dishes. It was a lovely bonus! We order some sides and they were all solid.

The highlight of the evening had got to be the acorn cake, we ordered one each and we all thoroughly enjoyed every single bite of the searing and bubbling cake, which was a well made brioche soaked in syrup, caramel and alcohol. It was dense, but it was divine.

The only hiccup that evening was the server of our table had been mixing up the sparkling and still water preferences for guests, at one point he even mixed different water into our glasses.

Went to HIDE to try their breakfast, which I‚Äôve heard is the best in London. Was it? Not really, but it was good overall.
Staff was great, even when they forgot our hot drinks order they were very apologetic.
Pastries were absolutely incredible, if this is something you have to try there, it‚Äôs that. Also, please try them all. Hats off to the pastry chef there.
When it comes to savoury food, this is where it gets a bit‚Ä¶ different. Hollandaise was very vinegary, eggs on the croque madame was overcooked, my buckwheat waffle pancake was lacking flavour, and overall it was all very fat.
Will I go back? Not for breakfast for sure.

Food is perfect. But my friends and I will never come to this restaurant again because I was discriminated against by the Asian waitress in your restaurant!!
There was an Asian waitress with long hair and white shirt. She had a very terrible attitude to me. When I walked in, she saw me but didn't talk to me and stand at the front desk Ôºàlike a sculpture as she doesn‚Äôt move at allÔºâwaited for me to come in and ask , like my boss. She didn't help me to save my coat and spoke in a very soft voice so I can‚Äôt hear her voice clearly.ÔºàI thought she was sickÔºâ. She also was very impatient when I asked her to repeatÔºàwith extremely mean tone and she always rolled her eyes at me!! ÔºâAnd she didn't lead me the way!! Why do other customers have waiters to guide them, but I don‚Äôt? I walk to downstairs alone to wait for a table. However, I saw that she smiled at other customers and had a very good attitude. She also took their coats, except me. So I suspect she discriminates against me. It needs to be emphasized that we were here to celebrated a birthday üòÉüòÉüòÉüòÉüòÉ
The food in the restaurant was delicious and  other waiters were very nice. Except this Asian waitress. Please fire her. If she continues to treat Asians like this, your restaurant will soon lose all Asian customers.

Reminder‚ö†Ô∏è: If you are Asian customer please don't let this Asian waitress serve you because she doesn't seem to like our race.

Th√© service was averagely good. From the moment we entered, they took our coats and hanged them with them.
We were then seated and whilst they took time to take our order; they later were fairly better as they noticed us more and gave us our dishes, changed our plates and handed us the cheques.
We ordered three dishes for breakfast:
Avocado toast: delicious. Loved the blend of flavours and the citrus flavour. A bit difficult to cut through
French toast: delicious and soft; easy to cut through. The blueberry and the cr√®me were superb. Loved the freshness of them
Pain au chocolat: soft and a bit crunchy. The chocolate was fine. I wouldn‚Äôt order it again though.

The atmosphere was lovely. Loved the decoration. Clean toilets.

Great quality ingredients, the prawns with flat bread were a real highlight.

Very nice use of local leafy greens with interesting textures and flavour profiles.

Hide has been an iconic establishment in the London food scene for a few years now and has a Michelin star. I have been here for breakfast and meals for a few times and the place never fails and has always had an amazing service and food. It‚Äôs got a great wine and champagne selection to suit all wallets. My only suggestion is that the menu is same for so long that I have been through the entire menu over the last few visits. It needs some refreshing and new features.
Breakfast is still amazing and has the best croissants and coffees in town.
Verdict is 5/5
Budget meal for two is easily ¬£200 with couple of glasses of simple basic wines. Of course goes up with cocktails and bottles of wine.
Óóä

To make our overseas friend‚Äôs Birthday celebration memorable, particularly as this was their second visit to London, we selected the Tattu restaurant, which exceeded our expectations from the moment we entered through the eliminated tunnel and ascended the lift. We were warmly greeted at the lift with exceptional hospitality while proceeding  to our table.

The restaurant‚Äôs ambiance is equally impressive, featuring exquisite decor. And The live DJ playing great music in the background.

The culinary offerings were equally impressive, with each delectable dish presented artistically and bursting with incredible flavours. The service was smooth, friendly, and never rushed, the attentive waiter further contributed to the exceptional ambience of the evening.
They even brought out a surprise birthday treat for our friend. it was a lovely touch that made the evening more special.

I highly recommend dining at Tattu, a renowned restaurant celebrated for its exceptional cuisine, impeccable service, and memorable dining experience.

Tattu London offers a refined and elegant dining experience. The atmosphere is chic and intimate, perfect for a special evening out. The service was impeccable ‚Äî attentive, warm, and professional from start to finish.

The food was beautifully presented and full of flavor. The duck dumplings were a standout ‚Äî rich, tender, and perfectly balanced ‚Äî definitely my favorite dish of the evening. Most of the dishes were excellent, though the salmon was slightly overcooked for my taste. Still, everything else was absolutely delicious.

I was a bit less impressed by the cocktails. Despite the restaurant‚Äôs strong reputation, I found them overpriced and not particularly well-balanced ‚Äî the alcohol was barely noticeable, which made them feel a bit flat.

One drawback worth mentioning: there was no air conditioning, and it got uncomfortably warm inside, which detracted a little from the overall experience given the summer heat.

Overall, Tattu is a wonderful place for a stylish night out, with fantastic food, a lovely ambiance, and top-tier service ‚Äî just a few details that could be improved.

Service was excellent from start to finish with everyone from the hostess to our waiter. We were initially given a set menu with very limited options, but the staff were very accommodating and kindly provided us with the larger dinner menu for more choice.

The food itself was good, but unfortunately wasn‚Äôt great value for money. Portions were quite small and a bit underwhelming in taste, though beautifully presented and definitely picture worthy.

The atmosphere was lovely, especially in the evening when the lighting and ambience really elevated the experience. One small downside is that they don‚Äôt allow cakes or desserts from outside, which can be inconvenient for celebrations (but expected for fine dining).

Loved the experience. We booked a reservation for 2 people, a week in advance and received a warm welcome on our arrival. We were served by Ahmed, who was very helpful in selecting our course of food. We received an impeccable service with great food (even with vegetarian meals). It was a great experience. Would definitely recommend and we will be visiting again as well.

Great service and really lovely interiors and views of the city, but I‚Äôd say quite overpriced. The food was good but not good enough to get me back a second time around. I feel like the flavour combinations could be a bit more creative.

My husband and I came for our anniversary and had two starters, the honey pork (best of the dishes we tried) as a main, and the pear sticky toffee pudding for dessert.
Absolutely incredible and delicious. Fabulous decor. The place to go in London. The beef and duck fried rice were perfect. We enjoyed many bites and full plates. I wish we had more room to eat more.

Delicious restaurant with unique and flavorful food. The staff was very professional and courteous. I had a meeting with two American friends hadn't seen in two years. we wanted to remember a great moment. Was pricing but the experience is worth it. We enjoyed the view of the city and the decoration.

Everything about this place was/is amazing. From the walk upto the restaurant through the lit up tunnel, going up in the lift, being met at the lift exit and walking through the restaurant to your table. The views from your table are fantastic.  The service is exceptional and omg, the food is unbelievable. Probably one of the best restaurant ive been to. Planning another trip to london just i can go back here again with my husband (visited with my eldest son for an after show birthday treat, they even broughtout a treat for him for his birthday). Had the set menu (¬£36.90) fantastic value. Pre ordered the the dragon cocktails (¬£50x2, one would have been enough for 2 ppl)
Would highly recommended, they were delicious and good fun.
Thank you so much Tattu for helping our stay in London that bit more special

A fantastic spot with incredible food and a stunning atmosphere. The squid was incredibly fresh, and the salmon was perfectly cooked with a sweet tang sauce. The steak was cooked to perfection .For dessert, the sticky toffee pudding was rich, warm, and served with ice cream. The views of London are breathtaking, and the decor is impeccable, making it an ideal choice for a romantic date night.

The only reason I‚Äôm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because they forgot our drinks, and the service was on the slower side. That said, I‚Äôd still highly recommend it for a special evening out.

Went for a late lunch birthday celebration with my wife, and it did not disappoint. The atmosphere was calm and relaxed, just what we were hoping for. The staff were incredibly welcoming, and our waiter, Ahmed, was absolutely fantastic. We ordered the sharing platter, and every dish was packed with flavour‚Äîtruly delicious. We‚Äôll definitely be coming back for more!

Great atmosphere with live DJ music, and Morden Chinese style decorations. The restaurant is super busy, completely full, but the service is still good. The only downside is the taste of the food is not super good at the this price level.

I visited Tattu last night and had an amazing dining experience. From the moment I walked in, the venue impressed me ‚Äî beautifully decorated with a stunning, ambient atmosphere that sets the perfect tone for an evening out. It‚Äôs the kind of place that makes you want to linger a little longer.

For food, I ordered the BBQ Chinese chicken, salmon, spicy noodles, and jasmine rice. Each dish was full of flavour and beautifully presented. The spicy noodles had just the right kick, and the BBQ chicken was a standout ‚Äî rich, smoky, and perfectly cooked.

Drinks were equally enjoyable. I started with a glass of Ros√©, and to my surprise, I found they served Guyanese El Dorado rum ‚Äî a rare and welcome treat. I had it with a dash of Coke, and it was the perfect finish to the meal.

Overall, the experience was fantastic. Tattu nails both style and substance, making it ideal for anything from a special dinner to a casual lunch date. I‚Äôll definitely be back ‚Äî next time, maybe for a relaxed afternoon meal.

I visited this restaurant on a Thursday afternoon to celebrate receiving my university offer, and I can honestly say it was the best dining experience I‚Äôve ever had. I was seated on the 6th floor, which offered a great atmosphere and view. The staff were absolutely lovely, and the food was immaculate! The overall vibe and energy of the place were brilliant ‚Äî warm, welcoming, and full of life.

We were served by a wonderful waitress named Lin, whose service was exceptional. She was attentive, friendly, and made the whole experience even more special. Her colleagues were also fantastic ‚Äî professional, kind, and clearly passionate about what they do.

I‚Äôll definitely be coming back, and I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for an unforgettable meal.

A really nice rooftop restaurant! We were in London for five days and managed to eat here twice! The food looks amazing and tastes really good! The staff is friendly and service minded. The price is a bit too high but we really enjoyed both our visits!

Food was delicious and our waitress Melissa was super sweet, helpful and attentive. Ambiance was beautiful! I 100% recommend. The one thing is that when we went the Chili beef was out! Too bad since it‚Äôs my favourite! Thank you Tattu! ‚ô°

I finally made it to Tattu, and honestly, it lived up to the hype. From the moment I walked in, the space pulled me in, moody lighting, that cherry blossom tree centerpiece, and a vibe that feels luxe without being over the top.

The food? Beautifully done. The caramel soy beef was melt-in-your-mouth good, and the Szechuan rock shrimp had just the right kick. Every plate looked like it belonged in an art gallery, but thankfully tasted even better than it looked.

Drinks were another highlight ‚Äî I had the Skull Candy and loved how playful but well-balanced it was. Service was smooth, friendly, and never rushed ‚Äî which I appreciated.

It‚Äôs definitely a bit of a splurge, but for a night out where you want to treat yourself (or someone else), Tattu absolutely delivers. I‚Äôll be back, next time with more room for dessert.

Really nice restaurant, friendly and helpful staff. The food was really good. The salmon could have a bit more flavour, but all the other dishes were amazing. I enjoyed the cocktails on the terrace before the dinner. We did have the 2 course dinner menu, and it had a good selection. We did add a couple of dishes from the A la carte to try, and we were not disappointed. Will definitely come back again.

Tattu London offers an incredible dining experience The interior design is dramatic and elegant perfect for a special night out or date.

The cocktails are inventive and beautifully presented, and the desserts are both artistic and delicious. Service was professional and attentive throughout.

Expect premium prices, but the overall ambiance and attention to detail make it worth it. Highly recommend if you're looking for something upscale with a wow factor.

Gorgeous and stunning venue!

I took my wife here for our anniversary and she loved every bit of the experience. From the moment you enter the venue, the ambience was perfect. The food was great as well, and our server Lin went above and beyond to make our experience 10/10. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
GORGEOUS setting. The food was amazing and the vegan options did not disappoint. Staff were so wonderful, especially bartender who gave great recommendations for cocktail.

We had a wonderful and delicious dinner at Tattu about two weeks ago and I still think about all the delicious flavors we discovered.

Denis our waiter was really nice, helpful and attentive during the whole meal and we really appreciated it! Thank you again to Denis and the whole Tattu-Team and chefs!

If we make it back to London some time, we will definitely come back to taste more delicious dishesü§©.

We recommend this restaurant without a doubt ü§ó

Had a wonderful lunch, served by Ahmed who was very attentive and gave lots of information about the menu. A beautiful setting - wonderful food, amazing drinks, can‚Äôt complain! A great central london gem and pretty good value for what it is! Lovely for a special occasion!

Had an amazing birthday celebration!
Ahmed was fantastic attentive, warm, and made the evening feel extra special. The food was outstanding, and I highly recommend trying the Emperor‚Äôs Choice menu, absolutely epic. I‚Äôd definitely go again!

I visited this restaurant for the first time to try the London location, and it was a lovely evening with my friends.

I wasn‚Äôt entirely happy with our initial seating, but Melissa went above and beyond to move us to a nicer spot. She explained the menu, gave great recommendations, and was always ready to help with any request my friends had.

Thank you so much for your kindness‚Äîwe had a fantastic night and will definitely be coming back.

The 2025 menu is outstanding. The wild mushrooms and the crispy shredded chilli beef were absolutely delicious‚Äîeasily my favourites.

Went here for my friends birthday, food was amazing with even better service! Definitely recommend the set menu with the angry bird chicken. Our outstanding waitress Lin did everything to make sure we were comfortable! She also took some amazing pictures for us we would come back just for her!!

Had a really lovely evening for our wedding anniversary. From the moment we were so warmly greeted by Joanna to leaving with very full bellies as well as a doggy bag,  we were constantly smiling.
The food was utterly delicious and we were very well looked after by our server, Lin. Nothing was too much trouble and even though it was a busy Friday night it felt relaxed and chilled. It was a great anniversary dinner!

Came here for my partner‚Äôs birthday meal and was served by Ahmed, who was great at recommending cocktails and very attentive!
Most of the food was tasty, some of the dishes could have had more flavours considering the price of them.
The birthday sparklers and plate was a lovely touch that left a smile on our faces

Food was so mid. Wagyu fried rice was just‚Ä¶..no. Tiny bit of beef in a mediocre, wok hey less mixture of rice and egg ‚Äî you can get better from wok to walk. Crispy chilli beef and curry sauce tasted exactly like those you get from takeout.

Service was great, but the food seriously needs some improvement.

My friend recommended Tattu as I was looking for a special place to take my client for our anniversary. I‚Äôm so glad I chose this restaurant. It truly exceeded expectations.

From the moment we arrived, the atmosphere was elegant and inviting. We ordered the Tattu Special set menu, which came highly recommended, and every dish was absolutely delicious. The portions were generous, so much so that we couldn‚Äôt even finish everything. Every course from the starters to the mains and dessert was beautifully presented and packed with incredible flavours.

The service was exceptional. Zsanett who was serving us made the evening special. The staff was very friendly, attentive, and thoughtful, even going the extra mile by adding a personal wish message inside the fortune cookie and on the dessert. Such a lovely touch.

We had a table by the window on the 6th floor, offering stunning views of London, which made the experience even more memorable.

Overall, Tattu London is a must-visit for anyone looking for outstanding food, impeccable service, and a truly special dining experience. I will definitely be returning.

Absolutely fantastic experience! This place is worth every penny‚Äî100%. The food is outstanding, with top-quality ingredients and generous portions. The atmosphere is a perfect 10/10, but the service goes beyond expectations‚Äî20/10! Our waitress, Asya, was exceptional and made our visit even more enjoyable. Highly recommended! They made my birthday celebration perfect.

Had an amazing dining experience! The food was absolutely delicious, and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. The highlight of our visit was the exceptional customer service provided by Lin‚Äîso attentive, friendly, and professional. Highly recommend this place for a great meal and wonderful hospitality

Lunch set menu is good value, but nothing special. Restaurant was very quiet which is sometimes unavoidable but this means service should have been exceptional, but wasn't. Felt more cafe than stylish Restaurant as portrayed on social media. And birthday although acknowledged on entry the special desert was forgotten. When you don't drink alcohol you expect food to be top notch

I visited it once and everything was amazing.

We tried the following:

Wagyu Beef Dumpling
Lobster and Scallop Toast
Emperor‚Äôs Duck Breast
Spicy Egg Noodles
Kung Po King Prawns

Great flavors, beautifully presented dishes, a relaxing atmosphere, and excellent staff.

I would definitely choose it again.

Follow me for more on Insta @sofis_food_passport & TikTok @sofis_food.passport

Great place!

Went for a birthday celebration and had a lovely time. The food was excellent and the decor and atmosphere was great.

It was busy and the service was hard to get their attention at times, but it was good when we were able to. It is pricey, but it‚Äôs central London, so to be expected.

Would definitely go back.

This has to be one of my favourites restaurants in the world.
The service, the food and the prices were outstanding.
I was so amazed by paying only ¬£38 for this amazing food, the place is so lovely. Couldn't believe it. 10/10

Went for a family dinner and it was lovely.
Food is good, service is excellent and the atmosphere is beautiful.
Zsanett was an excellent waitress, kind and professional.
Dani was also really nice.
We definitely recommend!

Amazing experience.
We ordered the 3 course meal (+2 side dishes), and everything was delicious. The presentation was marvelous and the service provided by Ahmed was perfect.
Recomended!
Absolutely incredible. The food was unbelievable and the service was impressive. Every cocktail I had was amazing. The outside bar is really cute and all the views from the restaurant are impressive

An Amazing Experience at Tattu London!
We accidentally booked a table at the Manchester location instead of London, but the team was incredibly kind and accommodating in resolving the mix-up. Despite the Christmas Eve rush, they ensured we had a wonderful evening.
The food was absolutely fantastic‚Äîrefined flavors and beautifully presented. The dragon cocktail was a delightful surprise: unique, delicious, and a real treat. The interior was absolutely stunning, with an elegant and modern design that created the perfect atmosphere for a special evening.
A special thanks to Lin, who made our evening even more special with her friendliness and excellent service. Highly recommend for anyone who loves great food, unique drinks, and exceptional service in a breathtaking setting. We‚Äôll definitely be back!

We came here to celebrate our first wedding anniversary - we couldn't have asked for a nicer night. The food and service both were incredible - Our waitress Lin was fantastic, she sent us a complimentary dessert to help us celebrate and she gave us some brilliant recommendations - the Shanghai black cod and caramel soy aged beef were our favourites. We went for the Taste of Tattu set menu and the portions were huge - we couldn't even finish it all. Would highly recommend

Gorgeous restaurant,  excellent service, and excellent food. We particularly enjoyed the squid started, the steaks, and the desserts! Huge thanks to Raul and the team for the little birthday surprise! <3

Came as a walk in - reception team was sooooo welcoming I lived for the girlsssss üíñ thank you to Bernadetta, Dora, Kia and Aysha for making our birthday celebration amazing!
Thank you to Amed and Dennis for the splendid recommendations!
Excellent atmosphere, perfect service. The foos is not only presented like an art but also delicious. Cannot wait to go back to London just to dine in Tatu!

From the moment we stepped in, Raul was super attentive, gave us some really great recommendations on the food and had a great sense of humour, had a wonderful evening! The hazelnut chocolate pagoda is a must!

It is a magical place, I went there for the first time and was amazed.  The atmosphere was great, the place looks so beautiful with the Sakura trees,  just wow!!!!! The lady who was serving our table Lin was very nice, friendly and very helpful,  she explained everything by the menu and suggested many things. The cocktail I had called Scull Candy- its so good, if you like sweet cocktails, i will recommend to try it.
It was great experience,  I highly recommend this place.

Excellent Service and Great Experience!

I had a fantastic dining experience at Tattu, and a big part of that was thanks to our amazing waiter, Raul. From the moment we sat down, they were attentive, friendly, and professional. They took the time to explain the menu, offered great recommendations, and made sure we had everything we needed without being intrusive.

Our drinks were always refilled promptly, and the food arrived at the perfect pace. What stood out the most was [specific detail, e.g., ‚Äútheir warm and welcoming attitude‚Äù or ‚Äúhow they went out of their way to accommodate a special request‚Äù].

Overall, the service was outstanding, and Raul truly made our evening special. I highly recommend this restaurant and will definitely be coming back!

Fantastic venue with good views and excellent customer service... food was very good but a bit over sauced...little too rich for my liking but definitely still worth a visit... especially for larger groups and a special occasion

The place is unbelievable great. The atmosphere is amazing. Loved how they decorated the dining room, especially the cherry tree in the middle of the room. The food is great. Had brunch option and enjoyed every minute of my experience. Service is great, very attentive and friendly people. Highly recommend it for any occasion.

Great experience at Tattu London. The location and view is great.
The staff was very welcoming and accommodating. I asked extra dim sums  in the mixed set as we were 3 and they arranged it without breaking a sweat.
The food was very fresh. Some dishes were a little bit too salty for my liking but it is down to preferences.
For me the highlight was the Wagyu, the fishmonk and the pork bao.
While for some of my friends, they loved the mushroom truffle spring rolls, the angry bird, and the clay pot.
After seeing pics and reviews, I thought the rice portion would be small but they were pretty generous.
The dim sums were very pretty, the colours were gorgeous.

We didn‚Äôt manage to reach the dessert stage as we were pretty full but overlooking other tables they looked outstanding.

A great variety of dishes to pick from.
Very nice spot in London for special occasions.

Pretty interior.  Faux trees were very cute. Food was good, but tbh very overpriced.  Air con was too cold, despite being adjusted.  Staff were way too overtly keen to get good online reviews.  Wouldn't go back.
Ahmed was a fantastic server and made our experience so special. He was especially attentive to any dietary restrictions that our group had. Will certainly be returning.

Beautiful restaurant with an ok ambiance, however the service let this place down. Admittedly we were late for our reservation but there was a complete lack of communication around seating us. After about an hour and a half at the bar, we were seated and the food was tasty. We had the pork buns(delicious), waygu dumpling (not my cup of tea), duck fried rice (delicious), pork ribs and beef short rib. The protein was way too fatty. It felt like I was chewing fat mostly, which put me off to be honest. Desert (lemon drop) was delicious. The cocktails were also decent but I‚Äôve had better; I went for the Chinese New Year Special. Overall, I think the food quality and  service needs to improve to justify the ¬£100+ per head price.

My fiance took me to London for my birthday and we decided to celebrate it at Tattu.

We were greeted by a wonderful server who is the only reason this place doesn't get 1 star. I won't mention her name as to not get her in trouble as it wasn't her fault that the meal never made it to our table.

The manager saw that we had our appetizers and asked if everything was OK and we said yes and he decided to cut the kitchen early. He asked if we were still waiting for food as we had been waiting patiently and we said yes of course. We are waiting for the entrees we ordered. He said he was sorry but he assumed the appetizers were all we were eating and since we said everything was good we didnt need the entrees that we ordered?

He apologized and said he would comp our appetizers but still left 2 on the bill.

We weren't going to cause a fuss but if we are going to spend one of our few nights in london at your establishment, celebrating a meaningful day and ready to spend hundreds of dollars these types of things are simply unacceptable.

Also if you say you are going to comp the appetizers you should do as you say. We flew in from overseas and decided to spend one of our meals here and we were left totally disappointed.

The only saving grace was our lovely server. She was warm and inviting and truly sorry for what happened even though it was not her fault. We saw her ring in the entrees and the manager came to us much later than the order was rang in.

All in all hugely disappointed.

Added.. here's a pic of me looking for our entrees.

had the pleasure of being served by Lin during both of my visits to Tattu London, and I must say she is truly outstanding. Lin embodies everything you‚Äôd hope for in a top-tier waitress‚Äîwarm, attentive, and incredibly knowledgeable about the menu. Her ability to make you feel welcomed and well taken care of is unmatched.

Both times, she anticipated our needs without being intrusive, made thoughtful recommendations, and carried herself with genuine kindness and professionalism. Lin‚Äôs service elevated our dining experience and left a lasting impression.

Thank you, Lin, for your consistency, charm, and excellence. Tattu is lucky to have you!

We had a very elegant night out in the middle of central London. The restaurant is at the top of a new hotel and the place was buzzing from the time we entered toll the time we left. Each dish was cooked precisely and had good flavour combinations that worked well together. The cocktails also complimented the dishes we ate too. Would recommend Tattu for a business dinner or special occasion
An unforgettable experience. Will definitely go again. We had an incredible view over Tottenham court road and the Dominion Theater. It was the perfect place to have our Masters graduation dinner.

We had a fantastic meal here for my birthday. My wife and I really enjoyed the whole experience. The whole place has been decorated beautifully. We started with cocktails on the terrace and then moved into the restaurant. We had the Tattu Signature menu and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The portions were so large that we had to take some away with us. I would like to make a special thank you to Lin, who was serving us, for being very helpful and kind and made the whole experience run like clockwork.

Our waitress was Lin, she was so helpful and knowledgeable, guided us through the menu and provided her recommendations. Her recommendations are top tier, she loves the food and wants to share that love with her guest! Her hospitality is so warm and welcoming, it was a pleasure to have her host us on our anniversary dinner. We felt so special!

I had the pleasure of dining at Tattu in London again today, and, as always, it was nothing short of delightful. The food was absolutely delicious ‚Äì full of flavour and beautifully presented ‚Äì and the atmosphere remains as charming and stylish as ever.

A special mention must go to Bruna, my waitress, who was wonderfully kind, attentive, and genuinely helpful throughout. She made the experience all the more enjoyable.

Tattu continues to be one of those rare places where excellent service, great ambience, and outstanding food come together seamlessly. I left thoroughly satisfied and am already looking forward to my next visit.
I love a lovely date here with my boyfriend. The ambience and the food was amazing. Best part was Aysa, she was very kind and she recommended food. I will definitely come. Back

We opted for the Signatures sharing menu, and while the food was great - especially Shanghai Black Cod - the experience fell short of expectations.

The Ice Dragon dessert, while creative, didn‚Äôt particularly impress us. Service left much to be desired. Small but significant lapses, like serving a cocktail with a piece of paper stuck to the bottom of the glass and bringing dessert too soon after the main course. Watching the server awkwardly circle the restaurant to delay serving the dessert emphasized the lack of attention to timing.

Additionally, the venue was uncomfortably warm, and the music was a bit too loud, detracting from what should have been a more relaxed and enjoyable meal.

Cocktails were decent though, and the decor was undeniably beautiful.

While the food quality was high, the overall experience felt pretentious and overpriced for what was delivered. Unfortunately, I can‚Äôt recommend this place.
really nice atmosphere and excellent service by Lin. we were blown away by the food, especially the starters. highly recommend and would come back to try the other menu items

I had the absolute pleasure to have a dinner reservation at Tattu London for my birthday accompanied by my mother and sister. I do not usually do reviews but this time I just have to. I say absolute pleasure because this is how it was from the helpful and friendly people at the entrance, to the ambiance, to the Alex‚Äôs service, to the quality of food and the deliver, to the little and thoughtful surprise they prepared for me. From professionalism explaining and showing everything on the menu, to the balance between making you feel like home but respecting your time and space. It was absolutely impeccable and I will always recommend this place to everyone with all my heart. Alex‚Äôs service, energy and attention were outstanding and delivered with class, mindfulness and demureness. Thank youuu guys for everything you are the best and you have my love forever!! <3
Lin was a great host, atmosphere was good, great food with amazing views and scenery - definitely book for your birthday and special occasion

The food was amazing. Absolutely delicious. Each bite was an explosion of flavours. The decor was out of this world, entirely mesmerising. Lin was a perfect host. Welcoming, warm and tasteful. Awesome place to enjoy birthday, we will be coming back. Thank you Tattu for a the evening to remember and the pictures to admire. Thank you Lin for your hospitality.

Unforgettable Celebration at Tattu LondonWe recently celebrated my wife's birthday and our 3rd wedding anniversary at Tattu London and it was an absolutely incredible experience. The food was simply divine - every dish was a masterpiece of flavor and presentation. It was the perfect combination of elegance and taste.We were particularly impressed by our new waiter, who was exceptional. His attentive and friendly service elevated our dining experience to a whole new level.We would also like to commend the entire staff for their patience and kindness towards our son. He can be challenging at times, but everyone went above and beyond to make him feel comfortable and welcome.Thank you, Tattu London, for creating such a memorable evening for our family. We will definitely be back! Again and again! Many thanks üòä

My friends and I went to TATTU on Saturday.
We had made a booking a few months in advance for 5 people. However, on the day one of us couldn‚Äôt make it, so I called to say that it would only be 4 people. They were very accommodating and said that would be fine.

When you arrive, they have a cloak room to leave your coat. I kept my coat with me and they brought us to our table. It is such a beautiful restaurant with a great ambiance and vibe. Oriental elements and beautiful blossom tree in the middle. We had a really good table.

There were lots of options on the menu. I opted for the Caramel Soy Aged Beef fillet. I asked for it to be Medium Rare, this was so delicious and I highly recommend it. My friends enjoyed their meals also.

The service was great, it was obviously very busy for a Saturday evening, but the staff were so good. They kept our water refilled and they checked if we were enjoying our food. Even though they were busy, they had smiles on their faces. Very thankful to them for making us have a great experience.

There is also a rooftop bar bit. We spent time there taking lots of photos and enjoying our time. It is also closer to their live DJ.

Price was decent as well, a little over ¬£60 per person. Which is a great deal. Would definitely come again.

Here in London celebrating our 35th anniversary and doing what we have always done - searching for good food.
Tattu came up on radar and we decided to try.
Place is beautiful and offers great views of the city. The staff is very friendly and made us feel welcomed.
We ordered Modern Sharing with its four waves, ranging from starter to dessert.
Every single item on each of the waves was deliciously prepared and neatly arranged.
The size of each item served is plenty and we were well satisfied 3/4 of the way down the list. The dessert had to be boxed and eaten later.
Our server, Matthew, was very professional yet kind and friendly.
One of the best restaurants we have been in years. Highly recommend it.

Delicious Chinese food! The interior design is beautiful, from the indoor tree to the furniture and tableware. There are many options to choose from, and during certain days, there‚Äôs a special you can opt in for. The food was great overall, but certain dishes were rather average. The mushroom bun was almost mind blowing. They put effort into decoration and using various flavours and textures im the dishes. The service was very kind overall but not very attentive as we came during a busy time during the weekend.

Me and my partner had a lovely meal here over the weekend. The food was amazing, we went with the Modern sharing option. Great choice if you want to try a few different things and lots of food. We had a lovely waiter called Denis. Thank you for your friendly service. The decor and atmosphere did not disappoint. We will definitely return üôÇ
Honestly one of my favourite restaurants tried various menus this is my 3rd time and our host Ahmed was amazing food is to die for!
Food was amazing. Ahmed, our waiter was lovely.we hat the 3 couse set menu, portions were good.

The food was absolutely outstanding. I‚Äôve dined in many restaurants around the world, but the quality and preparation here were truly next level. Every dish was a masterpiece ‚Äî perfectly balanced, beautifully presented, and full of flavor.

The staff were incredibly courteous and attentive throughout the entire evening. A heartfelt thank you to Michele and Raul, who took exceptional care of me and made the experience even more special. I felt truly welcomed and appreciated as a guest.

Highly recommended ‚Äî I‚Äôll definitely be back!
Melissa you are an exceptional host and ambassador for Tattu ..food drinks exceptional üëå missed having the dj but the in-house music was not bad ...we had a fantastic time

First time at this absolutely gorgeous restaurant in London, just a few minutes from Tottenham Court Road!

Upon arrival, we checked in with the receptionist and shared our reservation details. We then took the lift to the 6th floor.

The views from there were stunning! The restaurant itself felt like a conservatory with its glass ceilings, beautifully decorated in a chic oriental style.

We were seated at a reserved space for four, which was much better than a table in the middle.

For lunch, we opted for the set menu, which included two courses and unlimited cocktails from a selection of four. (See photos!)

I tried all four cocktails. My favorite was the apple one, served in a half-sphere round glass and green in color. The cherry and pineapple cocktails were also delicious, and the grapefruit one was quite special.

We will definitely be back‚Äîthe experience was top-notch.

Totally recommend!!! ^_^
Amazing service from Lin, she was so friendly and welcoming. Furthermore the food was fabulous, so packed with flavour. Impeccable service!

Tattu London is a truly stunning dining destination that combines incredible design, exceptional food, and a mesmerizing atmosphere. The decor is absolutely breathtaking, with intricate details and ambient lighting that create a cosy and romantic setting, perfect for special occasions or an unforgettable night out.

One of the standout features is the stunning view from the large glass windows overlooking the London streets. It‚Äôs truly mesmerizing and adds a magical touch to the dining experience, blending the restaurant‚Äôs chic interior with the beauty of the city outside.

The staff are incredibly friendly and attentive, ensuring fast and efficient service that makes you feel well taken care of. The overall cleanliness and attention to detail are impeccable, further elevating the experience.

As for the food‚Äîoutstanding in every way. Every dish was served at the perfect temperature and packed with flavor. The chicken dishes were the absolute highlight, tender and perfectly seasoned, while the noodles were equally delicious and beautifully presented.

Tattu London is a place where every element, from the food to the decor and the captivating city views, comes together flawlessly. Highly recommended for anyone seeking an elevated and memorable dining experience!

Another great meal at Tattu. The service was faultless as usual, Lin looked after us very well.
Food was good just felt all the sauces were a little sweet this time would have liked my angry wok chicken more spicey and less sweet. But that my only complaint, the cherry ice cream we had as a dessert was very tasty.
Be back in December for out Firms Xmas party.

During our evening visit to Tattu in London, we were absolutely impressed. This restaurant offers an exceptional Chinese cuisine experience, blending traditional flavors with modern culinary techniques.

The food was nothing short of delicious ‚Äì every dish was beautifully presented and packed with flavor. It‚Äôs clear that great attention is paid to both quality and detail in their menu.

The ambiance was another highlight of the evening. The space is atmospheric, with a stylish and elegant design that creates a warm and welcoming vibe, perfect for a memorable night out.

Finally, the staff were delightful ‚Äì friendly, attentive, and professional, ensuring our dining experience was smooth and enjoyable.

If you‚Äôre looking for an extraordinary Chinese dining experience in London, Tattu is a must-visit. Highly recommended!

OK, so it's decadently expensive, our meal for 2 with 2 bottles of wine was over ¬£350, but the food is also astonishingly good, the service from Maria so spot on and the interior design, music and vibe so on-point it's absolutely worth it.
