Best to reserve a spot online so don't have to wait at all. The service was great and I really love the food. Will come back next for their afternoon tea.
Amazing spot for afternoon tea. Excellent scones, sandwiches and cakes - especially the chicken curry sandwich and the cheesecakes. Also highly recommend thier gin martinis.

Our visit to The Wolseley was absolutely wonderful. From the moment we arrived, the atmosphere felt elegant yet welcoming. We enjoyed a lovely brunch, followed later by afternoon tea, and everything exceeded our expectations. The coffee was rich and expertly prepared, and the afternoon tea was beautifully presented, with a perfect selection of sandwiches, scones, and pastries. What made the experience truly special was the impeccable service ‚Äî attentive, warm, and thoughtful without ever feeling intrusive. Every detail was handled with care, making our visit truly memorable. We can‚Äôt wait to return.

A long-anticipated visit that turned out to be thoroughly (VERY)disappointing.

This was a place I had always intended to visit at least once in my life, but never quite made it‚Äîuntil now. Naturally, I arrived with great anticipation, only to be met with profound disappointment.

Let me begin with this: at a fine restaurant, one may forgive many things if the food is exceptional. However, when a place commands high prices, one expects not just culinary merit but also a certain standard of ambiance, service, and refinement. Sadly, this establishment failed to deliver on nearly every front.

First: üëâ ‚ÄúDo note that a separate cover charge is applied per person.‚Äù WHY???????

Reservation required a credit card to guard against no-shows. Fair enough; that‚Äôs become the norm.

Second:
Upon arrival, we were left standing awkwardly at the entrance, ignored by the staff who were too busy chattering among themselves. When they did acknowledge us, it was with the tone and volume one might expect in a marketplace, not a dining room. Despite several empty tables and our having a reservation, we were inexplicably left waiting.

Third:
While not directly the restaurant‚Äôs fault, the sheer volume of noise from other diners made it almost impossible to hear the serving staff. The acoustics were poor and the overall atmosphere chaotic.

Fourth:
Feeling rather unwelcome, we limited our order to just the main courses. I must say, I have never encountered lamb that tough in my life. However, I will give credit where due‚Äîthe sauces accompanying both the lamb and the chicken were quite delicious.

Fifth:
When I politely enquired about the location of the lavatory, the response I received‚Äî‚Äúunder the clock‚Äù‚Äîwas delivered with an unmistakably unpleasant expression. I had asked using the proper British phrasing, and given the exterior suggested a formal establishment, I had not expected to be met with such brusqueness. I couldn‚Äôt help but wonder if this was a matter of inadequate training or simply poor manners.

Sixth:
While the venue might appear elegant at a glance, there was no apparent dress code. Some diners looked as though they had just come from a jog or stepped in off the street in slippers. Whatever impression of sophistication this place hopes to project, it is swiftly undone by the casual presentation of its clientele.

Seventh:
As we were leaving, not a single member of staff asked how our meal had been, whether we needed anything further, or even offered a farewell. We might as well have been walking out of a supermarket rather than a supposedly refined restaurant. It left a distinctly sour taste.

‚∏ª

In summary:
This establishment is sorely lacking in training, decorum, and genuine hospitality. A serious re-evaluation by management is urgently needed.

This is just a wonderful restaurant. Amazing interior, it‚Äôs honestly worth going for that alone, great service and excellent food. I went for breakfast and it was very good. Had the haggis and eggs on toast to start, then pastries and a hot chocolate gourmand. All really good.

Breakfast at The Wolseley was a wonderful experience! The Pancakes with Berries were fluffy and full of flavor, and the Egg Royal was perfectly poached with rich hollandaise. The elegant ambiance and attentive service made it even better. A lovely spot for a refined breakfast!

I had high hopes for the food and thought it would be really good but it was just "ok" l had a the set menu but regardless of this the food could have been better. The goulash lacked flavour and the cauliflower soup was just like eatting a bowl of fatty cream. The waitress also kept coming over to try and take our bowls when we had not finished to the point that l had to say... "are we slow eaters?" the decor is beautiful but the price of the food isn't justified. My desert was ¬£13 and l would have got better from Mark's and Spencers.

My first time at The Wolseley in Piccadilly. I took a friend to lunch there, as a birthday treat. It‚Äôs a lovely restaurant, with a Viennese feel to the food and d√©cor. We were sat at a window seat, and the whole experience was high quality. The food was wonderful, the staff were friendly and attentive, and the restaurant had a very nice atmosphere. I especially enjoyed the kedgeree. We will definitely return in the near future.

The food was decent, but the service was very slow. It was a busy Sunday night, and the server seemed to be covering too many tables. He was friendly and clearly trying his best, but it felt like there just wasn‚Äôt enough staff to provide proper service. Btw, service charge is 15%.

Had breakfast here very recently. My second visit but the first for my friends who loved the decor and atmosphere.
My only slight issue was that the waitress, spoke very quietly, didnt explain well and misunderstood one of our orders.
Although a minor issue we would definitely return, a real gem.
You must book ahead to get youf preferred timings.

4.5/5 - this is my dream atmosphere, hands down. My husband gave his food a 3.5 but I gave mine a 4.5 so we settled on 4.

Lovely teas, coffee, and it's a great spot to have breakfast. Their prices are changed from when I took the menu picture but that's the gist of their options!

Exceptional service and truly delicious food. The oatmeal with jam and the salmon eggs Benedict were out of this world! The interior is absolutely stunning ‚Äî a beautiful place to enjoy a perfect breakfast.

This central London institution has long been a favourite of the city‚Äôs power players‚Äîit was once said that more deals were done over breakfast here than in the boardroom.

The atmosphere is pure old-school London glamour, with dark wood, crisp white tablecloths, gleaming silverware, and a quiet confidence throughout.

It draws a mix of upscale tourists and suited regulars, all soaking up the timeless charm. Breakfast is particularly excellent, with flawless service and perfectly executed classics. Yes, it‚Äôs expensive‚Äîbut it earns it. For a refined start to the day or a special morning meeting, it doesn‚Äôt get much better.
The Wolseley has a long history of serving English cuisine, spanning over a century. Patrons from around the world enjoy its excellent breakfast, lunch, and private dining options.

My first time at the Wolsey, I‚Äôve wanted to go for a while and it lived up to my expectations. No booking restaurant very busy, I said could you squeeze me in for lunch only me so happy to sit anywhere, no problem sat down in 30 seconds with a bottle of water and a menu, lovely tradition surroundings, waiting staff immaculate dressed with waistcoats and aprons. I went for the Smoked Haddock Kedgeree, stunning dish slightly curried with a freshly poached egg on top nice portion and just the right amount of smoked haddock mixed in with the rice, ¬£24:95 had a mint tea to follow served in a glass t pot and a nice glass cup ¬£5:95, ¬£5:95 for a large water came to just under ¬£50 with a 15% Tip not cheap but so nice to be served so well in a very busy restaurant by nice people. Will definitely take the gang back next time. Another good point as I was alone I had a few work emails to do on my phone so I was there for almost 21/2 hours no problem at all, no rush and felt very comfortable. Great place

A beauty in a caf√©/restaurant like I‚Äôve rarely seen! Not only was the food and tea absolutely delicious, but I was also welcomed with great hospitality and attentive service. A place I can highly recommend!

The Wolseley offers a charming atmosphere with elegant d√©cor and a classic menu. The service was attentive and professional, and the food was well-prepared, especially the breakfast options. While it‚Äôs slightly on the pricey side, the overall experience feels special and worth it for a treat. Would definitely return.

The Wolseley sits in my list ever since I saw it from others‚Äô posts. The food was delicious and the decor was stunning. However, staff were always busy, we waited a bit to get our bill. Overall, it worths a visit!

We went here for afternoon tea and WOW! Although there are a lot of trendy other spots in London, the pricing is a bit absurd and didn't feel suited for us because we didn't want to eat a ton of pastries. This was the perfect stop for that reason. The price was beyond reasonable and the atmosphere was just as nice. We enjoyed tea with scones. I highly recommend stopping by if you're interested in trying tea without wasting hours and breaking the bank.
A beautiful place! Stunning interiors and lovely staff. Food was great, and served in good time. Will be back!
We had their afternoon tea set with reservation, scones are great, clotted cream is very delicious! Others like sandwiches and desserts taste traditional.

Warning: California/Oregon Native here so this review will have a west coast American bias.
We went to The Wolseley for afternoon tea on our first day in London. My wife had been there several years ago and wanted me to experience it.

We both did the CLASSIC AFTERNOON TEA. I selected the English Breakfast Tea and my wife went with Earl Grey. Both were brewed perfectly and served in the cutest kettles. Almost all the Kettles we saw around us were unique/different which I thought was a lot of fun.

If you have never done afternoon tea it's definitely something you should experience. The clotted cream with scones was just amazing and paired perfectly with tea. The small sandwiches were mostly good. I wasn't a fan of the onion one, but the cucumber, salmon, and egg were all excellent. Our least favorite bits were the desserts, but they were okay. Just not something I would specifically go back for. I'd take more scones and clotted cream to be honest.

If you're going to go for Afternoon Tea in London, 10/10 would recommend going here. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.

My partner and I were tourists in London. After a lot of research, we decided to go with the Wolseley for our special Afternoon Tea reservation. I‚Äôm so glad we did because I can‚Äôt recommend it enough. From the moment we walked through the door we had beautiful service. The space is beautifully decorated with high ceilings and floor to ceiling windows, making it light and bright. It‚Äôs certainly not a sleepy atmosphere - on the contrary it was quite bustling which gave a feel for the ‚ÄúLondon‚Äù cityscape experience. Even so we never felt rushed and really appreciated the second plate of savories they brought out to us.

I also have to mention THE SCONES. It has been 7 months since our visit and I still dream about them, along with the clotted cream and jam. They are literally the best scones I‚Äôve ever had in my life. I can‚Äôt wait to return!

Staff should note: Never give the bill while customer is eating.

The service was indifferent - the waitress didn't ask and pour the glass and took away the bottle. No manners.

Booked the afternoon tea and canceled because of the service mainly.

I‚Äôve been to The Wolseley a couple of times now ‚Äî once for breakfast and more recently for dinner ‚Äî and both visits left a great impression. Breakfast there was a standout. The vibe in the morning is calm but buzzing, and the menu has that perfect mix of classics done really well. The space is stunning‚Äîclassic, elegant, and full of that old-school charm that makes you feel like you're somewhere special.

Dinner had that same timeless atmosphere. I tried the caviar, which was good, though honestly not the best I‚Äôve had. Still enjoyable, just not a standout. The rest of the meal was solid, and the service was exactly what you‚Äôd hope for; warm and professional.

Overall, it‚Äôs definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre in London and looking for a beautiful setting and a refined dining experience. I‚Äôd go back, maybe skip the caviar next time and try something else from the menu.
One of the best spots in the city to start the day! The Wolseley has a large menu for both sweet and savory lovers. I enjoyed the eggs and french toast.

Beautiful location. Small portions for afternoon tea. No options for choices of food, just tea. Only ate 2 of the 4 sandwiches due to not liking the other 2. I think this is about the experience and company during your tea.

The Wolseley was an absolute pleasure to dine at. The cauliflower soup was one of the best i‚Äôve had, and the sea bream was light and crisp. The benedict is a bit expensive for what you actually get which was a bit disappointing but overall, food and service were great and it was a pleasant experience.

Really disappointed about the food. The atmosphere is good en de service is friendly. It starts going wrong with the menu. It is all over the place. They have wienser schnitzels, lobsters, kaviaar and cheeseburgers combined with wine bottles up to 700 pound.
The food itself is very boring and consequently very expensive for what you get. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

The high tea wasn't that good as sandwiches were dry and tasted stale. The scones, too, were not nice. Cakes were ok but not amazing. I would have rather gone to the Ritz. The waiters just came once to take our order but didn't come again until I asked for more hot water and the bill. Tea pot was rusted and dark brown inside with tea stains.

I am so glad we visited The Wolseley during our first trip to the UK. The restaurant interior is very classic and beautiful. The service was great, we didn‚Äôt wait long for our food even though restaurant was very busy. Food was amazing! Cant wait to come back!

I had high hopes for The Wolseley, but this visit fell well short. The food was expensive for what it was, particularly the schnitzel, which was eye-wateringly overpriced for the quality, and my partner‚Äôs fishcakes were overwhelmingly salty. Service was actively poor throughout: wine was poured into a water glass, we had to ask a multiple times to have enough spoons for our table when all of us ordered soup, and the maitre d‚Äô randomly took a single glass while ignoring the rest of our table. Worse still, the wine we ordered was inexplicably handed off to another table. This was replaced, but only after calling attention to the fact that we should have more than one glass left.

A cold draught ran through the dining room, which didn‚Äôt help the atmosphere. For a restaurant that trades so heavily on its reputation, this was a letdown. Two stars only because the setting still has charm, just a shame the experience didn‚Äôt match it. It was supposed to be a special occasion, but I left feeling really disappointed.

It was the best cafe I've been to in London. I liked it so much that I went there twice while traveling in London. The eggs benedict was really delicious, and I was especially impressed by the French toast. It was the best French toast I've ever had. In addition, it was a really classy and luxurious atmosphere, and the gentle staff made it a memorable and happy time. I will definitely go there again when I come to London.
The atmosphere of the place is more than wonderful,  service is excellent, food is delicious, and the staff is smiling and cheerful.

Americans listen up. So this was the first restaurant that this american went to while first visiting london. It was very much worth the trip. It was so authentic and the table set, as you could see in the photo is just so nice. They asked me if I wanted a newspaper to read and I almost did, but I stuck to my phone lol. If you are wanting a good shop to have your tea with lunch or breakfast go here I know I'd bring any friend here with me if I went again. Also their hot chocolate was very decadent as well. ‚ù§Ô∏è

The food was all good quality. I ordered the 3 course set meal and was happy with my French onion soup, souffl√© suisse, and salted caramel eclair, the latter of which I found I liked much better than I expected. My mom also enjoyed her eggs benedict and cr√®me br√ªl√©e, and my dad his sea bream. We were seated in the bar room, so it was rather loud and crowded as it half-served as a waiting room. We spent about $100 for 3 people. It was a good experience, but I didn‚Äôt think it was a must-visit and it didn‚Äôt blow me out of the water. The bathrooms were also only so-so.

Had afternoon tea here. Decor is very nice and atmosphere is great. Food itself was mediocre. There‚Äôs nothing particularly stand out on the afternoon tea. They do handle allergy very well so really appreciate that. Service wasn‚Äôt great as there was mix up on our orders. Personally prefer people to write down the orders instead of going off of memory and get it wrong. Pricing for the afternoon tea is alright. Only downside is that they don‚Äôt have kids pricing. Overall, would not come back for the afternoon tea again.

Came here for afternoon tea. It was fairly decent. The sandwiches were nice, scones were really fresh and tasty and the desserts were ok. I didn‚Äôt think it was particularly outstanding but it was tasty. Some of the desserts were a little too sweet. I enjoyed the hot chocolate. Service was great, our waitress was lovely and gave us gold recommendations for tea. She kindly let us takeaway our leftovers too and wrapped up an extra person for our friend who couldn‚Äôt make it.

The Wolseley, an elegant caf√©-restaurant in London's Piccadilly, offers a quintessentially British dining experience that pays homage to its history as a former motor garage. The interior exudes a grand atmosphere, reminiscent of classic European brasseries, making it a popular spot for both locals and tourists.

Their Traditional English Breakfast is a highlight, featuring perfectly cooked eggs, crispy bacon, premium sausages, baked beans, grilled tomatoes, and toast, all served with a side of black pudding. The portion is generous, embodying the essence of this beloved morning fare.

Equally noteworthy is the Bubble and Squeak, a comforting dish made from leftover vegetables, particularly potatoes and cabbage, which is pan-fried to create a crispy exterior while retaining a soft, flavorful inside. The Wolseley elevates this classic dish, adding a touch of refinement.

Overall, The Wolseley combines historical charm with exceptional British cuisine, making it a must-visit for anyone seeking a taste of traditional fare in an iconic setting.

The Wolseley Caf√© is a fantastic spot for classic The Wolseley Caf√© offers an outstanding dining experience that perfectly balances delicious food, luxurious ambiance, and impeccable service. From the moment you step inside, you‚Äôre greeted by an elegant interior that exudes timeless sophistication. The high ceilings, stunning chandeliers, and classic art deco design create a luxurious atmosphere that makes the visit feel special even before the first bite.

The menu showcases the best of traditional English cuisine, and every dish we tried was prepared to perfection. From hearty classics to refined options, the flavors were rich, and the ingredients tasted fresh. It‚Äôs clear that a lot of thought and care goes into the preparation of the food.

The service was another highlight. The staff were attentive, friendly, and professional without being overbearing. They were quick to accommodate requests and made us feel welcome throughout the meal.

The Wolseley Caf√© is more than just a restaurant; it‚Äôs an experience. Whether you‚Äôre looking for a place to celebrate a special occasion or simply indulge in excellent English food in a luxurious setting, it‚Äôs the perfect choice. I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting London, as it‚Äôs truly a memorable spot that combines elegance, tradition, and culinary excellence.

Inattentive staff. Did not refill our glasses of water for over 20 minutes. Admittedly they ignored us for everything else as well. The scones were blah, the jam tasted like nothing. I don't know what's in the chocolate cake, but no thanks. And please don't add a ¬£13.95 "service fee" onto the bill before anything is delivered to our table. What IS that? If I want to be tricked into tipping, I'll head back to the States.

Also, turn some lights on in the toilets. I thought I was locked in and nearly had a panic attack.

I‚Äôm very partial to the Wolseley no matter what they say and through how many hands it passes down. They have a robust wine list still and their breakfast are a still a number. They are probably one of the few in London that still understand the ways and means of a Ma√Ætre d'h√¥tel. Gigondas - my favourite from the list of all reds - you‚Äôll find here. They‚Äôll give you some nibbles out of courtesy and good taste and despite closing nearing, they‚Äôll not rush you. Soutine from the same brand had it from a different Ch√¢teau, but off the menu. Probably Colbert has one of it now but I‚Äôm a Bermondsey Soho relevant, so can‚Äôt be bothered to travel.

We went there for afternoon tea.  The food was good enough, this is a general comment on afternoon tea. I never understood the appeal for cucumber sandwiches or any of those sanswiches.  I much prefer the cakes and scones.

We can't fault the atmosphere and service.  There were 5 stars.

By all means go there for an experience but food is over hyped.

Great cafe. I went there for breakfast and was greeted by friendly and attentive staff throughout the meal. Ordered the eggs Benedict which was delicious. I also ordered a pain au chocolat, it was very nice, however would have liked option to be warmed. The cappuccino I order wasn‚Äôt great coffee which was a shame.

Amazing food, even better service, now this place is class. The simple scrabbled egg on sour dough toasted bread, which I order before the French Toast, regularly. if you read my reviews regularly you know why! It was tremendous, you just taste the soft, buttery, creamy, luxuriously simple scrambled eggs wonderfully toasted with sour dough one of the best scrabbled eggs on toast I‚Äôve had. Left me speechless. Now the French Toast woaw again these top places, it had the perfect balance came with berries some jam not to sweet and maple syrup that topped of a great breakfast. Busy breakfast day very popular place but while still feeling a sense of privacy liked it a lot my sort of place perfect London atmosphere, reserve.

A beautiful restaurant located in the vibrant, busy & lively Piccadilly! We stopped to take our chances to find a table and managed to snag the small round 2-top tucked away in the window nook near the host area. It was jam packed and service was understandably tough to get. I ordered a beer and the wife ordered tea. Everything good but would have loved to stay for a proper dinner at a (bigger) table. Next time - reservations!

A glamorous spot for a special breakfast, brunch or lunch.
Staff are friendly and relaxed, service superb,
The surroundings make for a visit to remember if it's a treat, recommend booking ahead or the wait times can be lengthy at the door.
Simply one of the best spots in town for a special occasion.

Always found a table without reservation, try your luck and be kind. The table will eventually appear. Thank you for hosting me on various occasion but especially thank you for having me yesterday when I looked a real mess straight out of the airport after 15 days of backpacking throughout Italy . The guy at the front desk was extremely courteous. For those claiming this place is filled with rude and stuck up personnel, you clearly got an inferiority complex.

A nice restaurant but quite overhyped.

We were expecting a bit more from the food and whilst they all tasted good... that's it. Just good. Nothing special or amazing that would make us want to return regularly.

The veal chop in particular was tasty but so salty that you end up drinking lots of water for the rest of the night.

The desserts we tried are, again...just OK.
I know it's a popular place and you can tell by how busy it always gets but we just don't see what the big deal is.

The service was very good, in theme with the traditional vibe of the establishment.

The atmosphere itself felt quite similar to a typical pub. Very very loud and you get to smell all of your neighbours' dishes as soon as you enter through the door. There's no sense of intimacy or class, as you'd expect.

In our opinion, it also looks a lot better in the photos than in real life.

Overall we were quite disappointed and will not be returning here for the foreseeable future.

The bill (inc. service charge) came to ¬£224 for the two of us. You can double this if you like to drink.

Food 10/10
Service 10/10
Atmosphere 10/10
we we there for a birthday dinner
Personal welcomed us saying happy birthday which is a nice gesture :)
Overall must seen London place
Breakfast @ The Wolseley was delicious and fancy.  A great way to start the day!  I recommend the Crispy Bacon Wrap with the Fried Egg

This used to be the iconic place to go and always fully booked. I was surprised to get a table at short notice. Now I know why. Service wasn't good compared to all other visits over last 10 years, food was average compared to fantastic as it used to be and it was empty by 9pm. Sad to see its decline.
Wonderful experience visiting . I had the champagne afternoon tea for my birthday. Great service . Could not fault it

We've been to The Wolseley several times to enjoy both the experience and the food. It's always a lovely place to visit due to the excellent and attentive staff who make every guest feel special. The location itself on Piccadilly also helps as it's quite dramatic and feels nothing like a car showroom!

The food in this grand caf√© is also memorable with dishes ranging from scallops to steaks and everything in between. We certainly enjoyed our brunch although our teenage children were less impressed. Perhaps the meals on offer are best appreciated by an older clientele?

The only downside is that you can definitely feel the effects of wage and food inflation when you come to pay. We ended up spending over ¬£300 for five people (with no alcohol) which is not something that you can do everyday. So come to The Wolseley for the special occasion and you shouldn't be disappointed.

It was the best place to experience British creamy culture. I think it would be good to make a reservation and the staff was friendly. The interior was very delicious and I was able to have a good time thanks to it.

We wanted to try the afternoon tea once in London in a fancy setting without making a hole in our pocket so tried the Wolseley. Much to our surprise they let us share it, so at $50 for 2 ppl it felt like a deal. While the restaurant decor itself is stunning, the food was a mixed bag. We ordered the Vegetarian Afternoon Tea and loved the sandwiches. The tea and scones were also decent but the pastries were just average. Overall a good experience for the price.

This restaurant exudes elegance and sophistication, with its beautifully arched ceilings and opulent interior design. The ambiance is both warm and refined, making it an ideal setting for a memorable dining experience. The attention to detail in both the decor and the service is evident, creating an atmosphere that is both inviting and luxurious. Whether you're enjoying a meal or simply soaking in the surroundings, this restaurant offers a perfect blend of comfort and class.

Our waiter was perfectly nice but one of the waitresses was quite off. Not enough Staff as we didn't get our water topped up even once.

Food was good. Great menu choice.
Prices were reasonable too. I would certainly go again.

This was a great place to have a traditional English Tea. It's a big place and it can be noisy (so you may not want to come here if you want a quiet place for tea), but yet the atmosphere just works for a taste of the hustle and bustle of London. The place had that classic feel that you want when in central London. The food was excellent and would definitely come back. The service was amazing as well.

This is a beautiful restaurant that is fitting for a business lunch, romantic dinner, or just a desire to try high-end local, British cuisine. The menu was expansive, with options for any diet, and everything was delicious. We went for dinner but they also have an afternoon tea. Highly recommend reservations and getting a drink at the bar while you wait.

+ An expensive breakfast, but worth the experience. A renowned caf√®-restaurant located in a prime location. Sophisticated dining in a beautiful setting, with good service. A nice treat.

- The English breakfast could have included a piece of toast at least for the price paid, rather than being an extra, charged, add on :/

Booked the Wolseley via OpenTable as it worked out best for us .
Lunch was marvellous the ambiance is terrific such history in a building.i will try time dependent go again and again .
For food advise always read the website for the latest menu and advise.

I visited The Wolseley for cream tea without a reservation. Despite it being fully booked, Katrina was kind enough to arrange a wonderful seat for us with a stunning view of the restaurant. We were served by Yash, who treated us with exceptional respect and kindness. As tourists, we truly appreciated his warm hospitality. The scones were delightful, and the vanilla iced latte was fantastic. I would definitely return on my next visit to London.

Delicious food, beautiful location and excellent service. Make sure to book if you want to be certain of a table, they are always busy. That also makes for a good atmosphere - the low buzz of chatter.
Beautiful afternoon teas. I love their spread, and they definitely serve one my favourite sandwiches in London. Would recommend.

We had a pleasant dining experience at The Wolseley in London. The ambiance was elegant and inviting, and the staff were attentive and courteous. We ordered a three-course meal, and while the food was good, it didn‚Äôt quite hit the exceptional mark for us. Overall, it was a solid 4 out of 5, and we would consider visiting again for the lovely atmosphere and service.

---

Such a posh place. That used to be a Chinese restraint before, and so great that they keep some fragments from the past! I really enjoyed food & dessert in the company of my friends. Great place to be!
I had the salad ni√ßoise and cream tea. The scones are absolutely divine.

I've been going to the Wolseley for years and love the theatre of it. It's always exciting to be there and I have generally eaten well. However the superfood salad is more a form of punishment than a pleasure and they really have to rethink it. If I fancy a healthy salad it's not because I want to suffer. I still need something delicious. Kale and couscous doesn't do it. Come on guys, you can do better.

Just had a really splendid all out birthday afternoon tea at the Wolseley (my Top Tip - eat as little as you can for 24 h beforehand to do full justice to this menu!).

Some beautifully executed food, including a fantastic twist - their London Rarebit adds top quality bacon & soft yolked egg to the toasted cheesy sourdoughy magnificence of a Welsh Rarebit. Absolutely delicious. Plus one of the nicest hot chocolates I have ever had (and have done some extensive testing over my life!).

Best of all was the beautiful service from our lovely waiter Ian. One of my dining out benchmarks is whether people pay attention when I ask for the really icy water I adore. Ian brought me my very own well laden silver ice bucket and tongs - superlative! A highly capable, nice and kind man, nothing too much trouble and almost everything already quietly provided before we even knew we wanted them.

Also a very beautiful environment to dine in.

Thanks for a wonderful birthday treat - we are already planning our return in the New Year!

Since it was our first time in the UK, we felt that trying the famous afternoon tea was a must. However, the experience fell short of our expectations in several aspects‚Äîfood, tea, service, and atmosphere.

Starting with the food, it was decent but not particularly memorable. We had seen reviews mentioning unlimited servings, but that wasn‚Äôt the case for us. The selection included sandwiches, scones, and a few desserts, along with a single pot of tea without refills. The scones were fine‚Äîperhaps slightly better than what you‚Äôd find at Starbucks‚Äîbut nothing exceptional. The sandwiches were underwhelming, and while the desserts were enjoyable, they weren‚Äôt particularly impressive.

As for the service, there wasn‚Äôt much to comment on, as it was practically nonexistent. Since we‚Äôre in Europe, we didn‚Äôt have high expectations for service, so this aspect wasn‚Äôt particularly surprising.

The biggest letdown, however, was the atmosphere. The space was incredibly crowded, with tables placed so closely together that it was difficult to have a conversation without overhearing those around us. We were also seated at the very back, which didn‚Äôt contribute to a particularly pleasant experience.

That said, given the price point, this was one of the more affordable ‚Äúluxury‚Äù afternoon tea options in London. While we had hoped for a more enjoyable experience, we recognize that it offered a relatively accessible way to try this tradition. However, considering the overall quality of the food, setting, and service, it didn‚Äôt feel like great value for money. Overall, we‚Äôd give it three stars.

Went today for my birthday breakfast which was (as usual ) - amazing! The service is fantastic & special shout out to Claudia , who was lovely-
Many thanks for my birthday donut - lovely surprise!

A great and cozy establishment with beautiful decor. Booked for high-tea on the weekday at 4pm, table wasn't ready. Not a great start but an understandable circumstance. Food was honestly average at best. Jasmine tea was over brewed and insanely bitter, tea strainer was still dirty. Sandwiches were nice, sweet treats were not great. Cheesecake was not smooth, cakes were overly sweet from icing sugar and strawberries were sour. Scones were great though!

Service wasn't anything great nor bad, just looked tired and needed a mood boost..

Overall quite a disappointing visit, would stay away from The Wolseley for a good afternoon tea experience.

Such a wonderful and fancy place to have a breakfast,brunch or afternoon tea as well. It‚Äôs not my first time here and for sure not the last.
The service is perfect all the staff are amazing and so respectful, your order will be ready in few minutes.
The place and atmosphere is incredible including the decoration.
For sure you should try the pancake, French toast and Mashed Avocado with Confit Tomato on Wholemeal Toast. I got an americano and hot chocolate for drinks and it was all amazing.

Not bad.  But not the best food I've had for the price.

Escargot we're good size but lacked flavour.  The fruit de mere had sand in the clams. Quite gritty but sauce was nice

Loved the Wolseley. It was absolutely packed yet the service remained on point. We had a lovely waitress who was attentive, really lovely and friendly.

Our food was delicious especially the Hake. Rated 4 stars though because the Flat Iron Steak was a rather chewy and bland in flavour,  the new potatoes were way too salty and the green beans a bit too overcooked so slightly on the mushy side!.

However the rest of the meal was lovely. We had goats cheese & asparagus tart and ham hock terrine to start. Complimentary bread with the best most delicious butter!! The Hake was fish of the day and beautifully cooked and served on stunning mushroom base. Couldn‚Äôt fit in a dessert but we were surprised with amazing macarons as a complimentary anniversary treat. Would definitely go again. ¬£140  (2 starters 2 mains 2 cokes pot of tea double espresso and service charge)
Delicious food & drinks and nice atmosphere. Best macrons I‚Äôve ever had!
Perfect setting. Great service. Really good food.
Óóä

Mielo ‚Äì Mediterranean Excellence & Warm Hospitality!!!

What an incredible experience at Mielo this late afternoon! We tried the goat cheese salad ‚Äì full of hearty, rich flavor ‚Äì along with the burrata salad and their warm bread served with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Everything was absolutely phenomenal. The ingredients were fresh, the presentation elegant, and the flavors perfectly balanced.

Both dishes, along with sparkling water, came to just ¬£40 ‚Äì excellent value for money considering the quality and generous portions.

The staff were professional and genuinely friendly. They gave us space to enjoy our meal without hovering or pushing us to order more, which made the whole experience even more relaxing and enjoyable.

Mielo truly captures the spirit of Mediterranean hospitality.

Been here a few times. Food was always great and service was even better. Was there with some friends and two babies for brunch - the staff were all so friendly and helpful with the kids. Even gave the babies fresh fruits for snacks without us asking. Definitely 5 star experience. The only suggestion is that they should probably think about having more than one high chair üôà it‚Äôs such a great restaurant with nice setting and enough space for small and bigger groups. Plenty of space for buggies (what mummies love). Will definitely come back

‚ú® FAMILY DINING TIME AT MIELO ‚ú®

This cozy spot in Marylebone was perfect for our family night out! We kicked things off with delicious prawns, crispy arancini, and refreshing ceviche. üç§üßÄüçã

For mains, the lasagna was comfort food at its finest, the lamb was melt-in-your-mouth tender, and the burger was a hit with the boys! üçùüçñüçî

We couldn‚Äôt resist dessert‚Äîevery bite of the tiramisu, rice pudding, and cheesecake was pure bliss! üç∞ü•Ñ And to top it all off, we were treated to a delightful box of chocolates! üç´‚ù§Ô∏è

Thank you, Mielo, for the warm atmosphere and incredible service. We left with full bellies and happy hearts! Can‚Äôt wait to return! ü•≥

#FoodWithKindness #FamilyDining #MieloMagic #maryleboneeats #reels #trending #trend #memories #foodie #food #foodblog #foodie #foodlover

This is a great restaurant.
We had a stunning lunch. Beautiful Seabass ceviche, followed by Zucchini fritters and then Saut√© scallops. All were cooked perfectly. The chefs are doing a great job and are being supported by friendly and professional front of house. We loved our lunch.
You can go here with confidence.

What an incredible experience at Mielo celebrating a milestone Birthday.
Everything was absolutely amazing from entering and leaving the restaurant
Food was delicious üëåüèª

The staff were very professional,  which made the whole experience even more relaxing and enjoyable.

Would definitely come back again!

Booked Mielo for an ‚Äúearly bird‚Äù supper (or a very late lunch) before going to see a show. We went for the lunch/early evening set course menu & had two courses for ¬£25 each. I was expecting the portions to be a bit smaller because we went for the set menu but I was wrong, they were really generous! The food was delicious and very flavourful. The service was lovely, very attentive and friendly. One of the staff even chased after us after we left to give us complimentary after dinner sweets. The atmosphere was relaxed and the interior was stylish. Top marks for the great music too! Would recommend if you‚Äôre looking for good food at a decent price in central London that isn‚Äôt a tourist trap.

Salmon tartare is on spot. Quite salty to my friend‚Äôs taste but to me it was nice. The arancini is nice, everyone was recommending it but I think it tastes like a good beef ball. Squid linguini is the best so far. Complete in love with it. Chicken on quinoa salad is fresh, flavourful and crunchy. Steak was quite dry, the beetroot paste tastes weirdly nice. A good experience overall.

What a lovely restaurant! Went yesterday with a few friends, service was excellent, food was absolutely delicious and such a lovely atmosphere, with live music and some great songs! I will absolutely be returning again.

Mediterranean restaurant. A bit confused menu. Some dishes were ok  and some were outstanding.  4 out of 5. Octopus was really good and soft.  Staff were amazing,  especially the managerss who responded to our reviews, took it to her heart to improve our experience and recommended and gave us the best dessert on the house favourite was Le Fondant au chocolat and lemoncello. Because of the managerss wonderful service I will definitely go back again. Uplifted the rating from 3 to 4 and 5 for service.  Please try

I wouldn't say I was overly impressed, but nevertheless it was good food with good service. I think what spoiled it was how noisy it was, not with people but the live musicians in the corner. Too loud, which meant everyone was talking loudly and we on our table were struggling to enjoy a conversation.

Food was good, but not wow. I've had better.
Great selection of spirits and wines.

A lot of the menu I thought was over priced for what it was. Some was fair.
The 15% service charge was a bit much, considering the atmosphere was too busy.
Charging ¬£6 for a bottle of water cost ¬£30! So ended up paying over ¬£100 just in service charge and water! That I was not impressed with.

I did enjoy the evening and food was good, but unfortunately not worth 5 stars.

Very nice restaurant, very elegant vibes. The prices are okay sincer we are on a pretty important street. The bread we got in the beginning is to die for, really good. The entire food is exceptional. And the staff really nice.

This is a great restaurant all around. Delicious food. Beautiful facilities, pleasant music. Good service. We went on Easter Sunday had the chicken and lamb shank it was delicious! Good menu, plenty of choice. Would highly recommend it.

My wife and I had a wonderful meal at Mielo last night! The food was delicious. In particular the octopus was very tender and all of the meat was high quality. Thank you to Engin and his team, especially the Manager and Jericho for looking after us so well. The restaurant had a lovely atmosphere with nice live background music playing. Would highly recommend!

We visited Mielo as a group of 12 for a Christmas gathering and had a good experience overall. The service was attentive, and the staff made sure we were well looked after.

I ordered the lamb loin, which was cooked perfectly and paired nicely with the accompanying vegetables and sauce. However, the portion size was smaller than expected, and I had to order an extra side. The garlic mushrooms were tasty but quite expensive at ¬£6 for a small portion.

While the food and atmosphere were enjoyable, the pricing felt a bit high for the portion sizes. Still, it‚Äôs a good spot for a special occasion, especially if you don‚Äôt mind splurging a little.

A nice touch was the small box of chocolates we received at the end which added to the festive feel.
Wonderful experience at Mielo. Food was tasty fresh and prepared with care. Service was attentive and friendly. Recommend the Sherlock Holmes cocktail and both dishes you see pictured

Niko and JD was the perfect additions to our delightful evening. They were funny, helpful and such a nice guys. The food was perfect and the service provided by Niko was something else. One of the best night i‚Äôve had in a long time just because of our waiter and now friend Niko.

It‚Äôs more of a 4.3 for me but limited by the rating system. The overall ambiance and food quality was good although not quite a 5. We loved how dog friendly they are and we were able to sit inside by the window with our dog. We really liked the mezze platter which was a highlight for us. The garlic shrimp was least impressive but the lamb shank and sliced aubergine was good (just not great). Overall a solid experience and would recommend if you‚Äôre in the area
Fantastic experience from professional service, absolutely delicious food to lovely vide. I can‚Äôt recommend this place  enough. London must try!

One of the best Mediterranean restaurants in London. The food was exceptional, the starters, mains and desserts were all elite. I found it really difficult to find something to pick at. The seating was gorgeous and importantly in London, spacious. It was a packed and busy evening and with both tables beside us full, I couldn‚Äôt have been more comfortable. The staff are incredibly polite and attentive, making sure our glasses were always full and that we had everything we needed at all times. On the way out we were even gifted these little boxes filled with amazing chocolate almonds. Really great experience, highly recommended and I will definitely be revisiting again when in the mood for top tier Mediterranean food.
Had the two-course set menu‚Äîdelicious food, quick service, and a beautiful restaurant!
Amazing place, very nice staff and food is stunningly good. Special mention to the cocktail bar, especially the spicy margarita.

Came here on a Wednesday lunchtime and this is not my first time at Mielo. The food is amazing and the lunch menu is such great value. I had zucchini fitters to start followed by grilled salmon and it was just the best. We were served by Evita who was an absolute star. The staff are so attentive and polite. One of my favourite restaurants in London.

Fantastic food and reasonably priced in the heart of London. Splendid service and great hospitality. Many thanks to Garry, very polite and quick response, always ready to attend to customers. Will definitely come back again if I come to London

The service is top notch and very friendly. I love the menu and the foods as well. Very child friendly placeüëåüèª This is our second year and we went there two times. As a foodie having michelin started food elsewhere, I think the cod will get at least 1 star. It has all the flavors, perfect!!
Food was amazing, on the table in less than 5 minutes, portions were great and well priced.

In for a treat - everything was just perfect. I wasn‚Äôt expecting live music on my Saturday night visit - but was really pleasantly surprised by my choice. Lamb was very juicy and tender. Would also recommend our choice of starters - rice ball and prawn skewers. Will skip dessert though.

I don‚Äôt often give 5 start however I feel this place deserves it. I loved my experience from beginning to end. Staff were extremely pleasant and accommodating. The restaurant is decorated beautifully I can imagine it to be lovely place to come in the summer as they have some outdoor seating. I visited to celebrate my nieces birthday with family. Everyone enjoyed the food, I tried things I would not normally go for and I was not disappointed. There is great options for non meat eaters which was appreciated with our party. I had a fabulous cocktail called ‚ÄúZilli‚Äù it was so good that I would come back just for that cocktail. I also really enjoyed the asparagus salad which is not something I would normally go for but very impressive. I cannot end this review without mention the bread for the table, I believe it was complimentary however it was soo delicious and fresh! We also brought our own birthday cake which was not a problem, they bought it out with plates and napkins for us to serve ourselves. Overall great experience and I would 100% recommend and I also cannot wait to return.

Came here for lunch after realising that Wulf and Lamb next door closed permanently. While not a vegan restaurant it does decent have vegetarian options.

This time I felt like eating seafood for starters and ordered two right away: king prawns and scallops. Both were delicious. The complimentary bread is terrific and I really liked the fact that they mixed olive oil with balsamic vinegar to accompany it (nice touch!).

Finished with the mushroom risotto as my main course. Great experience with a very attentive staff. Would recommend to anyone!

It was such a nice surprise! Menu sounded good. But experiencing it was a complete different story. We were not expecting such good quality of ingredients, which made the culinary experience so satisfying. Staff is super nice and professional they treated us so well even when we entered looking like hungry poor turists. I will never forget how accommodating they were with us and even gave us a complementary chocolate at the end. Everything was perfect in this culinary experience. The lamb shank is to die for.

Excellent restaurant, well cooked, hot food with attentive but discrete service.  Also had live music, two solo singers alternating, both very good and the music at a level where you could hear it easily but it did not interrupt conversation.

Final bill was around ¬£45/person including drinks which for the quality and it being London was good value.  Would definitely go back.  Thanks for a lovely evening.
Foods and services are nice! especially the rice ball and spaghetti we tried! The lamb chop was okay, not particularly like the seasoning, and kinda hope it‚Äôd be a bit softer.
Flew to London for 3 days. Ate here twice! One of the best restaurants in London. You must come here even if it‚Äôs just for the bread!

What a surprise to have such amazing service in London, this place was outstanding. The food was fantastic and my friend and I had a wonderful evening together sharing wine and having some lovely food. We sat outside and the weather was great and the servers very attentive.

Booked through the Fork website and got 30% off on the food bill. Comfortable and spacious seating. Friendly service. Food was good but I wasn't overly impressed by the flavour overall.

Before our meal, they served some complementary bread with olives and their house special avo hummus. I loved the hummus, it tasted very fresh. The bread was interesting though, it was more like a pizza dough baked with spices on top. It was delicious.

For starters, we ordered smoked aubergine ravioli and arancinis.

I wasn't a big fan of the ravioli as the pasta was a little too thick and tasted overcooked. The smoked aubergine filling was good, so more of these wrapped with a thinner pasta would be good. The ravioli sauce was quite thick and I wasn't sure if this was supposed to be a sauce or a cream soup? Flavour was good but again, not sure if this goes with the raviolis themselves.

The arancinis were served lukewarm and were small. Although the flavour and the crunch were there, I would've preferred them to be served hot with more meat fillings.

Coming onto the main course, we had the Mediterranean lamb shank and salmon.

I liked the lamb shank, though not exactly what I expected as it's more like a curry lamb shank. In general, the meat comes off the bone but not the parts closer to the bone. I loved the mashed potatoes! I don't know what they did but the texture was better than a standard mash. Overall a good dish.

The salmon was seasoned well and goes well with the refreshing sauce. I thought it may be slightly overcooked because the centre was not as tender as I like.

For some reason, they gave us a free tiramisu at the end which was a pleasant surprise! Thank you!

The meal experience was largely good. We were sat next to the bar area and it was very noisy at times when the bartender was making drinks.

Overall, I think it's a pretty good restaurant but I'm not sure I would pay full price to dine here. For me, the food has to be outstanding for this price range.
We came during their slow time. The food was okay, not impressed, not really wow you, but also not disappointed you.

One of the best places I've been to in London.  Mielo stands out for all aspects: mouth-watering flavours in all dishes offered; significantly delicious dessert and extremely friendly staff. Special thanks to Nicol. Seabass with white wine and lemon sauce, chicken fillet and ink linguini are highly recommended üëå
Fantastic place and service, really good place to dine üçΩ. Coming again this Friday, 23rd of may to celebrate ü•≥ a friend birthday üéÇ. ELIAS

I visited alone on a Monday without a reservation. I ordered the 2-course lunch menu for ¬£25 and a glass of white wine. Among all the restaurants I visited during my four-day stay in London, this place provided the most satisfying experience in terms of food quality, service, cleanliness, and atmosphere.

The asparagus salad was the best asparagus dish I‚Äôve ever had (too bad i forgot to take a picture), and the squid ink linguine was loaded with seafood and perfectly seasoned, not overly salty. Even the bread and olive oil served before the meal were delicious! I could tell it was a quality olive oil. ÌïúÍµ≠Ïù∏Îì§ ÏûÖÎßõÏóêÎèÑ Ïûò ÎßûÏùÑ Í≤É Í∞ôÏïÑÏöî!

A special thanks to the male server who recommended a South African white wine that paired perfectly with the dishes. After expressing my appreciation, he kindly shared some tips on choosing white wine and even let me taste an excellent Pinot Noir, saying I might like it. It was truly an enjoyable experience. The female server was also very professional and friendly. Her menu recommendation was also spot on.
If you‚Äôre looking for a restaurant near Marylebone, I highly recommend this place.

We had a spectacular time at Miele on Sunday evening. We were early for our reservation, they took us no problem. Our server was a wonderful young woman who made sound suggestions and was super attentive. The food - awesome! Our table started with scallops, pedron peppers, both wonderful and cooked on point. Then we moved to the asparagus mushroom risotto, the cauliflower steak and octopus (with an added salad since this is a starter). We finished off with tiramisu and the pistachio almond cake. We raved about our meals all the way home. Of course, our server couldn‚Äôt  let us leave without our beautiful little box of chocolate truffles. The attention to detail is bar none the best I‚Äôve seen in a long time. Mielo comes highly recommended from this girl!
The steak, lamb, and recommended wine were all delicious. I especially enjoyed the spinach I ordered as a side with the steak; it was so good that I ended up ordering another serving.

I cannot praise this Restaurant enough. I visit this restaurant regularly but normally with a couple of friends and it is normally my number one choice in the area. Last Tuesday we had a leaving do and 24 people were present. I was a bit nervous because I wanted everything to be perfect and they did not fail me. They set up a beautiful table for 24 people, the atmosphere was so warm and vibrant, the food was excellent with fresh ingredients and the service was exceptional. We agreed to have each one a separate bill, Nico did it with no sweat, he remembered what each has ordered. Nico and Rogerta (manager) I can‚Äôt thank you enough for a beautiful evening you have managed so well. You are really super stars.

Some hits and some misses on the dishes. Octopus and linguine dishes were overcooked. The rest were good, although ALL the desserts we ordered did not hit the mark. The chocolate fondant was overcooked and crispy on the edges, the pistachio cake was dry like it had been sitting there for days and the tiramisu lacked flavour.

You can enjoy the wonderful service of the staff and fusion Mediterranean cuisine that you have never tasted before. I used this restaurant to celebrate a friend's birthday. I highly recommend it. One pleasant surprise was that the portions were large, so please be aware of that.
The food was great. The lamb shank and the squid pasts were something else. But what makes this even more of an experience is the service. The lady serving us was helpful and always wore a smile.

Amazing food and atmosphere, very nice staff and very caring. We have great memories to cherish from here. We could actually talk and didn‚Äôt have to shout, we felt really comfortable and not crammed. The starters on the house were a great surprise and something not very common in London especially the amount. Even the chefs smiled and waved goodbye as we walked out. Will return in the future, thanks for helping us create great memories :). PS the lava cake served to me as birthday surprise was absolutely amazing, I woke up craving it‚Ä¶

Absolutely delightful dining experience! The food here is incredibly tasty, with each dish bursting with flavors that linger on the palate. The ambiance is cozy and inviting, perfect for a relaxing meal. The staff is attentive and friendly, making the whole evening enjoyable. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a great meal in a pleasant setting.

This was easily the best meal of our two week vacation. Every course, every single dish was flawless. The service elevated the experience and was exceptional. The cocktails perfection. I‚Äôm running out of superlatives. I left very, happily, full and will remember this meal and the service for a long time. What a way to end a trip!

Had a wonderful dinner. Started with the eggplant caviar, the seasoning and sauces made it the best dish of its kind I‚Äôve tasted. The spinach frittata was simple but good, maybe something else to spice it up. Our mains were each superb, 3 meaty lamb chops perfectly seasoned and grilled, and dark meat chicken kabobs so good you could eat them w/o the wonderful tzatziki dip. Do both. Sides were perfect roast potatoes and what they called Greek salad, but was really horitaki - excellent. Service impeccable. Atmosphere with the live music and comfortable seating outstanding. Glad we chose this as one of our 5 dinner locations.
Great experience- food was very very good, the waiters were super nice and very attentive. Price wise, very reasonable! I am very happy with my experience in the restaurant and do recommend it  üôå

We had a really nice early dinner here on a Thursday. As a relatively large group we felt very well looked after, drinks were great, starters were lovely and mains were also very good. The restaurant had a good ambience, staff were very friendly and accommodating and we had a fantastic experience.

Perfection! Stopped by on a sunny day, managed to grab a gorgeous table outside, in the shade people watching busy central London. Service was exceptional, warm, friendly and welcoming. I went for the set lunch menu which was decent price (25 for 2 courses) and for what you got was very impressive. Complimentary flatbread whilst I waited. Prawns were delish & the squid ink pasta was stunning. HUGE portions. Couldn't recommend this place more for a cheapish lunch set menu. Will definitely be back.

Had a lovely dinner for two at Mielo. The food was excellent, the ambience had a special charm, and our server Garry was both friendly and professional. Great experience all around‚Äîthank you, Mielo! üçØ

A trendy brunch place in Marylebone!

Since we were not too hungry, we ordered 2 of the small sharing plates and 1 main. Our order came with a complementary side of warm bread and olives which were very tasty and soft.

The two appetisers were good, the fried lasagna could do with a bit more seasoning and fillings and a the lasagna sheets could be a bit thinner for a much better mouth feel in my opinion. The fried filo was extremely delicious and it tasted just as expected, the sweet chilli sauce provided was nice but unnecessary since I feel as though it took away the rich flavours of the cheese and the fillings a little too much.

We had the lamb shank for the main course. The meat was super tender whilst the mash potato and sauce had a rich flavour. The sauce tasted similar to a south east asian lamb curry which I really enjoyed. The meat itself could use with a little more seasoning, but when eaten with the sauce and mash it was perfect, so maybe it was intentional.

Overall, the food was good and the place and service was nice.

Not 4.9

Mielo offers a comforting, homestyle dining experience. The octopus starter was exceptional, but the ravioli needed more cooking. The lamb shank is highly recommended, flavorful and tender. The sea bass was decent, though not remarkable. The ambiance is akin to a cozy home kitchen, with simple plate presentation and a casual service style. However, considering the simplicity of the dishes, the prices felt a bit steep. Ideal for those seeking a cozy meal but be prepared for a slightly higher cost for the home-cooked feel.

Meilo Restaurant at 39 Paddington Street is an absolute delight for anyone who loves Mediterranean cuisine.
The ambiance is cozy and inviting, perfect for both casual dining and special occasions.
The menu features an impressive selection of dishes, all prepared with fresh ingredients and authentic flavors.

The staff speciallyMr. Niko  at Meilo are incredibly friendly and attentive, ensuring a top-notch dining experience from start to finish. The highlights of my visit included the perfectly cooked lamb kebabs and the fresh, vibrant Greek salad. The baklava dessert was the perfect sweet ending to a fantastic meal.

If you‚Äôre in London and craving Mediterranean food, Meilo Restaurant is a must-visit. Highly recommended!

Absolutely love this restaurant! They always go above and beyond to give excellent customer service. They give free bread (and it‚Äôs nice and toasted) with oil and balsamic, and the main portions are huge! They also do a great two or three course deal. My mum is celiac and they kindly gave her gluten free bread and said they could make anything from the menu gluten free!

Went here for brunch. We had booked but actually the place was empty enough to walk-in. Service was very nice and the food was great (good portions and swaps were catered for). Not a fan of the decor but besides that good experience overall!
One of the best restaurants that I‚Äôve been to in London. The food was absolutely amazing and we got excellent service by the waiter Jake ‚ú®.

Had the most wonderful dining experience! Not only is the aesthetic beautiful, the food was also delicious. We started of with the Zucchini Fritters, Fried Albarino Rice Balls and Octopus (something new for us, certainly did not disappoint), everything was beautifully seasoned and fresh. We went on to have lamb chops and chicken skewers which were succulent and beautifully presented. The San Sebastian cheesecake was the star of the show! Absolutely divine.

Not only was the food beautiful the staff were also wonderful. Engin made us feel so special along with all the attentive waiters/waitresses and amazing chefs! A must visit in London.

Mediterranean restaurant with a good atmosphere. Live music was great and service was really efficient. Nice decor as well. My main issue was the food being so inconsistent.

The Squid Ink pasta was really good and our favorite dish but the burrata was very average, the beef carpaccio was okay but the portion was so small for the price! We usually get served double that portion for the same price. All of our other dishes were okay but not great and very expensive for this quality.
Had items on the 3 course lunch menu - all the items were excellent. The squid ink pasta  and tarte tatin were exceptionally good. Portions are generous. Service was good too.

Stylish restaurant, with accomplished deco. The dark blue ceiling doesn't make it oppressive due to the use of bold and bright colours and fabrics elsewhere. Classy but relaxed. More a 4.5*

They start you off with complimentary olives, bread and avocado humus, the latter particularly tasty.
I had the tenderised grilled octopus as starter. Beatifully cooked and presented. Lamb loin fillet as a main, served on a bed of vegetables. Delicious, again perfectly cooked and presented and the sauce rich but not overpowering. A very accomplished dish.
Dessert San Sebastian cake with warm chocolate, good but could have been better. I guess expectations were very high after the first two courses...

It was unexpectedly busy on a Monday evening end of last month, perhaps with people taking advantage of The Fork offer!
The atmosphere is lively but allows for intimacy, and both groups and couples can feel very comfortable. The background music was good as well, not too loud to allow conversation without having to shout.
As for service, it was super attentive and relaxed. All staff very welcoming and helpful. They definitely get a 5* from me.

In brief, lovely restaurant, with good quality food, beautifully cooked and presented. And the service is excellent. Highly recommended!
Some friends recommended the restaurant, and it was up to our expectation. We had a good time with good music. The food was great ( the slow cooked lamb is delicious ) and the service was nice !

Stopped here on my way back from the Warner bros studio tour. Decided to get off at baker street and explore rather than going to Victoria station. A good move by accident as I found this gem of a place for dinner. Rashid, our waiter was amazing and paid attention to every detail. Food right from the starter to the dessert was excellent. The atmosphere is very cozy and upscale. Do stop by if you are in the neighborhood. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.

Visiting Mielo restaurant with my family on my son'
birthday to enjoy Mediterranean food was an amazing experience. Heart of London Baker Street well layouts bright and modern. The staff were incredibly friendly. Head chef especial dish was amazing.
We highly recommend this restaurant just try you will definitely collect some great memories from Mielo.

Very good food. Multiple vegetarian options available, I recommend the grilled aubergine. The atmosphere was nice too. However, the service was a little slow, we had to wait more than 20 min between the first and second dish. The price is on the expensive side.

We had a really lovely lunch at Mielo, the seared scallops are cooked to perfection, the courgette fitters are crispy on the outside and fluffy inside. The burrara is oozy and melt in your mouth. The Arancini are so light it made a perfect starter. We really enjoyed the prawns and scallops squid ink pasta, the seafood was perfectly cooked and the scallops cannot be fresher.
Even smaller dishes like the grilled asparagus were perfectly seasoned, we finished the meal with the rice pudding flavoured with orange zest, what a lovely touch!

The service is prompt, friendly and attentive. Last but certainly not least, I like the decor and ambience of Mielo, it‚Äôs stylish and full of life. Will definitely come back.

wonderful restaurant with deliciously prepared and beautifully presented dishes. I loved their lamb, their ceviche and the cocktails are amazing too! polite and very attentive staff, especially the young man who seated us. I definitely recommend Mielo.

I‚Äôm celiac and had the most exquisite experience here!!! The service from every person I interacted with was top tier. They had so many options for me, made sure everything was double checked in the kitchen as gluten free, and even sent out complimentary gluten free bread toasted to perfection. I highly recommend the risotto, it blew my mind. I cannot wait to make a return visit next time I‚Äôm in London.

Hi jimmy. I‚Äôm sorry that I‚Äôm too late
Thanks to you, We had very happy moment at lunch. We remember you and every staff. If I go back to London, I‚Äôll go to the restaurant and then I‚Äôd like to have another delicious dishes
Should be healthy until meet again

Loved this place. It‚Äôs unpretentious really flavorful food. Great server who was very knowledgeable about how they cook things. My kind of healthy place to hang for a nice dinner without breaking the bank

Given all of the 5* reviews, I feel like somewhat of an outlier with my 4* review (which would be 3.5 if that were possible), but for me the overall experience does not warrant 5* (or 4.9/5).

The service was generally very good but the atmosphere a little strange. Between 8pm and 10pm on a Tuesday night, the restaurant was, at its maximum, one quarter full. The music was initially quite loud, which, together with hard surfaces and a loud group of four nearby, made the noise quite unpleasant. Things improved to some extent, but it's not an especially relaxing room. It's also quite dark, even with the glass doors on the front side. The open kitchen was reasonably well-ventilated, but some grilling and frying smells drifted over.

The food was pretty good. The grilled lamb loin with 'healthy vegetables' wasn't quite as virtuous as it appeared, as the vegatables were ungenerous and there was a significant volume of unadvertised creamy sauce. It was well cooked, though, and the meat was decent enough. The chicken has unadvertised vegetables stuffed inside and was overcooked. The chips were disappointing - pale from undercooking, and underseasoned. The ultimate mezze was quite strange, in particular the cheese selection, which amongst others included two fruity English cheeses and what appeared to be marmite cheddar. They were incongruous with the rest of the mezze. The cured meat was not very nice, nor were the dolmades. All in all, despite the fancy plating and with the exception of the dips and bread, the mezze felt like an assembly of mediocre-quality supermarket ingredients.

After (politely) querying the thinking behind the cheese selection, the mezze was taken off the bill. We were also given a free dessert (which was good) and tea, because of our comically unstable table. To be fair to the staff, as soon as they noticed this, they offered to move us, which we declined.

I may return to try brunch offering, but would probably not go back for dinner.

Wow- What a great find today, while in London. If you haven‚Äôt tried this place , please do! You will not be disappointed! Fantastic!
SJ - California

Beautiful decor & varied menu catering to a number of dietary needs. Food served in generous portions, loved the squid ink linguine with ample prawns & scallops. Cocktails could be a bit larger in volume but flavoursome overall.
Great warm atmosphere for a new year eve‚Äôs dinner. Food was nicely done and presented. Service team was professional, friendly and efficient.

A last minute lunch with a friend visiting London for the day. One of the best fixed price lunches around. The dining room is comfortable, relaxed and spacious. The staff were friendly and attentive. The portions on the fixed lunch were generous to say the least (arguably too large!). If you're in the area then this is a must visit restaurant.
We went here based on Google reviews, since we were closed by. Super right decision! The food is high quality and delicious. The staff were welcoming and friendly. We had a great time!

Nice space and very comfortable seating ( inside and outside). Had a very nice breakfast, creamy scrambled eggs and Damon with a touch of dill which made the extra difference. Excellent coffee, perfectly steamed milk on the latte and the espresso really balanced. Will re-visit for lunch / dinner. Service was very attentive and polite as well.

Really good food and even better service. We shared a few small plates and especially enjoyed the seabass ceviche. The waitress was never over bearing but always available when needed and added lots of little touches to make the visit great

Great service and the food was tasty, the manager was really nice and professional with us, they also had live music on Saturday at 8:30. I recommend for a cosy romantic night and the tiramisu is a must try üòãüòã
Óóä

We had an amazing evening at Faros in London! The food was absolutely delicious ‚Äî the truffle pasta was rich, creamy, and packed with flavor, easily one of the best we‚Äôve ever had. The ravioli were equally impressive, perfectly cooked and beautifully presented. You can really taste the quality of the ingredients and the care put into each dish.

The drinks were also a highlight of the evening ‚Äî creative, well-balanced, and served with style. The atmosphere was warm and vibrant, and the staff were incredibly friendly and attentive without being overbearing.

Faros exceeded our expectations in every way. We‚Äôll definitely be back and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a memorable dining experience in London!

The atmosphere and the food were great. I especially recommend trying the risotto. The staff were warm and attentive, making us feel at home. Everyone was lovely, but with Ruby it felt like we had known each other for years. I can definitely recommend Faros with peace of mindüòç

5‚òÖ ‚Äì A great experience from A to Z!

Faros Restaurant is the perfect place if you are looking for excellent food, friendly service and a beautiful interior. The food was exceptionally tasty ‚Äì fresh ingredients, perfectly seasoned and beautifully presented.

The staff were very nice, professional and always smiling. The whole lunch went without a single mistake. The atmosphere is stylish yet cozy ‚Äì ideal for lunch with a partner or with friends.

I definitely recommend Faros to anyone who wants to enjoy great cuisine in the center of London. I will definitely be back!

Traditional Italian cuisine. The pizza is made exactly right, with thin crust and soft cheese melting in your mouth, the pepperoni is good quality with strong flavor. The service is also impeccable- Ruby is very attentive. The atmosphere is cozy and nostalgic with good sound tracks in the background. We will definitely come back again.

We had a lovely family dinner at Faros London this evening. Although there was a small issue during the meal, it was quickly addressed by the management in a professional and efficient manner. I truly appreciate how responsive and helpful the team was.

The food was absolutely delicious, and the overall service was great. Special thanks to the management and staff for turning things around so smoothly and making our family gathering a pleasant experience.

Unfortunately, I was disappointed with the experience at Faros. Me and my partner visited on a weekday lunch since it had a very high rating, and we wanted to try it out.

We had calamari fritti and octopus carpaccio for starters. Calamari was one of the toughest I've had. Octopus carpaccio had no flavour despite me trying desperately to get any flavour out of it. :D

The mains were better. Margherita pizza was nice, simple but tasty, with thin base. Seafood risotto had a big problem of tough seafood, not feeling fresh at all. Beef ragu pappardele was okay. Just expected deeper flavours with beef ragu cooked for 6 hours. Overall price and quality of food did not match.

Sitting space was very limited. We had a tiny table with barely enough space for 2 plates, cutlery, and glasses. In addition the table next to ours was very close. I was worried of smn sitting there since we would definitely have intervened in each other's spaces.

Service was good. However, I feel like the restaurant is trying to overcompensate poor food quality and high prices with overly attentive service.

Came to Faros in February. This is the best meal I‚Äôve ever had. Food was exceptional, and the staff were more than happy to give me as much basil as my heart desired (which is an absolutely obscene amount‚Äîmuch more basil was brought after this photo was taken). Service was incredible. Chef and his son are adorable. I wish I could eat at Faros every night. Every single course was a work of art. ‚ù§Ô∏è
Amazing restaurant. Super clean, food is fresh and delicious and our waitress Riya is just the sweetest person and offered excellent service. Definitely will be back.

My wife and I celebrated our 51st anniversary at this wonderful restaurant,   the food variety and quality was outstanding.
The staff were very helpful and friendly, we were served by Asma and Ozzy, both were very professional and courteous.
We had a wonderful time in very elegant surroundings.
We highly recommend this restaurant, we will be back in the near future.

It's so wise to choose this restaurant for your birthday this time! The moment I stepped into the restaurant, I was immediately drawn in by its warm and elegant atmosphere. The soft lighting and soothing music blend perfectly, and every corner is filled with a sense of ceremony. The dishes are delicious. Waiter Mehmet provided meticulous and measured service throughout the meal, always paying attention to the needs without disturbing the dining rhythm. I had unforgettable birthday memories here. Both the food and the service were impeccable. Highly recommended!
We were hosted by Ozzy and his service was amazing. He was friendly as well as very attentive. Food was lovely. Thank you for creating such a memorable experience for us!

Exceptional experience, the food was excellent the fresh truffle pasta was delicious, as were the other dishes the other guest had, our glasses were never empty. The staff were kind and accommodating, special thanks to Mehmet, the atmosphere was light and the decor and music was timeless. Great for a lunch dressed casually or a dinner dressed up. They also surprised us with a birthday cake and song, would recommend.

Had a great dinner at Faros! The Calamari Fritti was crispy and tender, and both the Risotto Mare and Linguine Allo Scoglio were rich and full of flavor ‚Äì we all loved it. Finished with a perfectly balanced Tiramisu, not too sweet.

Big thanks to Ozgur for the friendly and attentive service! Will come back againüíï

amazing food, lovely atmosphere, and outstanding service from Ozzy! his recommendations were spot on and made our celebration even more special. can‚Äôt wait to come back for more dishes and cocktails‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

Very nice upscale restaurant in Oxford Circus. My family was seeking Italian food while on holiday in London and we found this place via Google reviews. We were not disappointed. The setting was great, the server was nice and patient and the food was amazing. The portion sizes are a little small considering the price. This was the only restaurant we visited that hit us with a VAT tax charge as well as a 12.5% service charge. The restaurant was packed and it was loud but we could still talk and enjoy our meals.

The most beautiful surprise, we had accidentally come to this restaurant and were not disappointed at all. No comments about the food, go taste it for yourself, it‚Äôs amazing‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. Also you will be lucky if Fozil is your waiter ( very kind guy ). Much recommended

Wonderful Italian restaurant in SoHo. We showed up with a family of 5 without a reservation (not recommended!!). The staff was kind and accommodating. They turned the heaters on outside and even offered a lap blanket to my wife. Pasta was delicious and service was excellent. The vanilla ice cream was out of this world! We have spent the last week trying to find it for purchase. Pricey to feed a large family but worth every penny.

Decided to go here on a whim and it was completely worth it. The restaurant was beautiful, the food was amazing (the best Italian food I‚Äôve ever had) and the staff was warm and welcoming. It was an overall exceptional dining experience. I absolutely recommend checking this place out if you are ever in the area.
