review: Óóä

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Beautiful atmosphere and delicious Indian food. I got the butter chicken, but don‚Äôt let the mild spice level fool you, it is spicy, but the perfect amount for someone who enjoys spice but doesn‚Äôt want to die from the heat. It was my first time trying orange wine, for those curious, it tastes just like a glass of white with an orange tint in color. Would return for solid Indian food and it is the perfect spot to grab a bite before enjoying a show at the Lyceum Theatre

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
We had the best pre-theatre meal here.
The service was fast, efficient and friendly and our server Sam couldn‚Äôt have done more for us.
The only downside was that we accidentally ordered a more expensive wine than we intended to‚Ä¶ it was lovely though.
Thank you so much!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
I had a great lunch experience at Paro in London. The food was fantastic ‚Äì truly one of the best chicken curries I‚Äôve ever had. Full of flavour, perfectly cooked, and beautifully presented.

Our waiter, Sam, was excellent ‚Äì friendly, attentive, and made us feel very welcome. Although my tea was initially forgotten with the order, the staff fixed it immediately when I mentioned it, which I really appreciated. Mistakes can happen, but how they‚Äôre handled makes all the difference ‚Äì and the team handled it perfectly.

Overall, excellent service and very nice staff. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back.

Best regards,
Tobi

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Delicious food and top-quality meat.  Everything was full of flavor and freshly prepared. The service was excellent. Special thanks to Fuhad and his team for being so friendly, attentive, and professional. We felt truly welcome. Highly recommended!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
What a surprisingly great tasting and highly authentic Indian restaurant tucked away behind Covent Garden. Everything from the FOH, waiting staff, ambience, and of course the food, was impeccable.

I highly recommend any of the generous prawn dishes, starter or main, and the onion bhaji's are so well cooked, really crisp but full of body and flavour, and the complex flavouring of the spices in each dish is elegant but punchy. Just what you want in a proper Indian restaurant.

We'll almost certainly be returning, and not even alongside a theatre night, as Paro stands alone as the best Indian in this part of Central London.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: The ambiance is cute, food was okay. I felt like it lacked some depth. The samosa was okay and the korma was very sweet. Service could have been better. We had 7:00 reservations and felt rushed when it wasn‚Äôt even busy. They wanted to quickly clear the table and then told us there is a reservation and we had to leave. It was 8:10 at that point. We weren‚Äôt even there that long and was rushed out. Even when the check was brought over things were very rushed. Dessert wasn‚Äôt offered or anything else for that matter. It wasn‚Äôt terrible but wont be rushing back any time soon.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Had a lovely dinner at Paro last night and taken well care of by Sam. Lovely 2 or 3 course pre theatre dinner was delicious and had massive portion sizes. Nice list of speciality drinks too. Very attentive waitstaff.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Fuhad served as and the service was excellent!
Very attentive and fast!
Came with my daughters, and he made them feel so welcome.
Food was delicious, tasty flavours. Just would have liked the chicken to be softer and for it to flake off! It was quite tough across both chicken dishes.
Restaurant deco was so nice, good vibes

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Such lovely atmosphere and staff! Adil served us and was very helpful with picking dishes and friendly throughout! They have a special on at the moment where you can get over 40% off when you get the signature Thali! Very generous portion size in veg or non veg! Highly recommend coming here when you are in town for a nice night out!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: A very cute cozy place.. food was delicious and staff were super friendly. Sam was attentive and took care of my needs sharp. If you are around for shows or shopping, definitely recommend this spot for lunch or dinner. You won‚Äôt regret.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: First time here, very good service and very good food! Joy and all the staffs so friendly, we will come back again!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: We had a delicious meal at Paro in Covent Gardens. Our waiter Sam was incredibly welcoming and helpful, making recommendations and providing brilliant service. We would definitely recommend this restaurant!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: The food was excellent, and the service by Fuhad was outstanding. I loved the restaurant‚Äôs ambiance, with its great selection of music and stylish furniture. The thalis were delicious and generously portioned. The mango lassi is one of the best I‚Äôve had, and the Kabhi Khushi Kabhi Kosmo cocktail was also very good. Overall, a must-visit if you‚Äôre in London.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: We just had the most amazing food experience at Paro. I‚Äôve tried quite a few Indian restaurants in London and I wasn‚Äôt quite convinced but my husband wanted Indian food for his birthday and I found this amazing restaurant as one of the top suggestions. Paro completely changed my view on Indian food, the Cream Chicken Korma is to die for, nothing like I have ever tasted before, all food portions were absolutely worth it, the place is super nicely decorated and Fuhad went up and beyond to give us the most wonderful service, I will be definitely coming back, 100% recommended!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: The food here is well priced for the neighbourhood and very delicious. I asked for a lamb korma which wasn't on the menu, but they made a great dish for me and our service was very good. Sim did an excellent job with the table, thank you to him!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Amazing experience.  Our last evening in London and we wanted a good last dinner. It was easy to reserve a table through their website. We arrive and were greeted and taken immediately to our seat. The restaurant is so clean and the vibe is perfect.

Fuhad our server made our experience even more amazing. He had amazing suggestions. We loved everything!

Thank-you for making our last evening in London enjoyable.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Lovely food and service!
This was a really great find. I searched online for a long time to find a good restaurant with dairy and gluten free options. I'm so glad we came here, the food was amazing, and we were looked after so well, particularly by Adil.

Thanks so much for a great experience.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Joy the head waitor was extremely attentive.
The restaurant is stunning the decor is old relaxing and romantic with a touch of Indian culture .
The food is 10/10 the flavors are out of this world.
Thank you for making my birthday celebration memorable.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Nani-grandma chicken was amazing, food came hot and in a good time. Also got the meat thali and it was great to taste everything loved the lamb rogan. Waiter Fuhad was lovely!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Paro is a fantastic Indian restaurant in London with a beautiful, boutique-style ambiance that really sets the mood. We tried both the veg and non-veg thalis, and they were absolutely delicious ‚Äî full of flavor and variety. The portion sizes were very generous, almost too much for us to finish, but definitely great value for money.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Amazing night at a great restaurant! Sam was a great waiter; super attentive and friendly. Service was really good and quick. Food and drinks were delicious. Prices were very reasonable. Went with a few people with food allergies and was pleased that the staff took it seriously. The menu was clear with what food contained gluten, nuts, etc so we felt comfortable what we could order. Will definitely return next time I am in Covent Garden!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: We had such a lovely meal here. The food was amazing and Joy was a great host. All the staff were very welcoming I would definitely recommend this place- great for gluten free as well. It was my boyfriend‚Äôs birthday and they gave us free ice cream and card :)

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
We had diner here with 2 families. The food was really tasty. I can recommend the lamb samosa and onion bhaji as a starter. For the main the meat thali is really good.

The cocktails are to die for. Fahad was a great host.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Came to Paro, for a birthday celebration. Joy was our waiter, he was so attentive. Food out was outstanding. Deco was old Kalkata. Meet Naiz Khan the owner, came over to wish my friend  a happy  birthday üéÇ

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Paro had excellent food, the flavours were all really good. We were served quickly and did not feel rushed at all, everyone was very friendly, especially our waiter Joy who was amazing at his job!!! Also the place is very well decorated and very clean. 10/10 thank you joy :))

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
We had the Thali through top table offer. The thali came with naan, basmati rice, dhall, raita, pickle, lamb curries, butter chicken. It was really good food, tasted like traditional bengali cooking.
The cocktails a little pricey, a long island iced tea is ¬£26 which seemed overpriced. Musa gave us great service and we were well looked after.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Americans first time visit. We don‚Äôt get Indian food much, but this was outstanding and we‚Äôll be referring to anyone else that visits England. Our server was Fuhad and we so enjoyed speaking with him and he was helpful with our menu choices and provided excellent attentive service!  (Restaurant a bit warm).

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Fuhad !! You are a star !!
This guy treated us like part of his friends, serving and explaining the menu perfectly and .....the food was delicious with generous portions at the point to not finishing all of thr dishes .
Highly recommend!!!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Great food, lovely service. Sam was super helpful with choosing which items to order.

The Thali portions are insane!

Not to mention they serve Kingfisher Beer! ü§åüèΩ

Delicious Mango Lassi as well.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: I had an amazing experience at Paro London, and a huge part of that was thanks to Sam, our server. From the moment we were seated, Sam was warm, attentive, and genuinely welcoming. He struck the perfect balance between being professional and personable, making us feel looked after without ever being overbearing. His knowledge of the menu was spot on‚Äîhis recommendations were fantastic, and he made sure everything was just right throughout the evening. It‚Äôs rare to come across service that feels this thoughtful and effortless. Thank you, Sam, for making our visit so memorable!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
We recently dinned at Paro on Saturday during I guess their busiest pre-theatre times and here‚Äôs my experience:

Entrance/Service: Greeted by a doorman then  booked in straight away advising how long our table would be (excellent ‚≠êÔ∏è). The decor was gorgeous through out. Love the touch of artificial jasmine flowers hanging from the ceiling.

Food: WOW! Between 3 of us we ordered a mix of lamb, prawn rice and naan. Not too oily, well seasoned and tasty. The taste was balanced through the meals and the portions are big as you have to order main sauce dish then rice or naan to compliment. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

Service throughout: there were so many staff. To serve and to help so you was never waiting too long if you had a query or for food ‚≠êÔ∏è

The takeaways: prebook to avoid disappointment. If it‚Äôs pre-theatre booking check the menu and ask for pre-theatre menu as it‚Äôs more cost effective but expect to be very busy. And finally clean toilets. However due to the restaurant sharing the building with Lyceum Theatre, toilets are located underneath the restaurant.

Will definitely recommend and worth re-visiting. ‚≠êÔ∏è

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Paro is a stylish Indian restaurant in the heart of Covent Garden with a vibrant floral-themed interior that creates a unique and Instagram worthy dining atmosphere. The food delivers authentic Indian flavors with a modern twist beautifully presented and satisfying in taste. Service was courteous, although a bit slow during peak hours. While the ambiance is impressive, a bit more attention to table service could elevate the overall experience. Worth visiting if you‚Äôre exploring central London and looking for a flavorful Indian meal in a visually striking setting.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Popped into Paro on a Monday night, thinking it would be quiet, but I was surprised to find it almost full and was lucky to get a table.
Fuhad looked after me and gave me a poppadom on the house with a chutney tray, which was a nice touch.
For my main course, I ordered Chicken Naga and Basmati rice.
The portion when it came was very impressive. There were plenty of chicken pieces.  As for the Naga sauce, it's not the hottest I've had, but the flavour was still there.  I also had a big bottle of Kingfisher lager.
The restaurant has a nice atmosphere and is attached to the Lyceum theatre. The toilets are actually shared with the Lyceum.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Our first time visiting Paro before seeing a show this evening and it was fantastic. The food was beautiful, so many succulent flavours, served piping hot and very quickly. The servers couldn‚Äôt do enough for us, especially Musa. Thank you for a lovely experience we definitely will visit again the next time we are in London.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: My husband and I are visiting from the US and received a recommendation from a friend for a great spot for curry near our hotel. Paro was fantastic!! The restaurant itself it beautifully decorated, staff are all amazing, and the food is 5 star. Our server, Joy, was fantastic and provided excellent service. We ordered the onion baji, chicken korma, butter chicken, and garlic naan. All were great and we will definitely be coming back here next time we are in London. Thank you!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Had a fantastic meal at Paro while visiting London! Our two young boys enjoyed the experience immensely. Shout out to Fuhad for exceptional service and a warm and inviting welcome! We will be back!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: This place was wonderful. The food was delicious and came very promptly. Staff are all lovely, our waiter Fuhad was excellent! Would definitely recommend.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: I was looking for a good Indian restaurant and this was the top recommendation on my search. It just happened to be right near my hotel. I came in and was seated right away. The service was great. I went with the server‚Äôs recommendation, the lamb shank as a main course, and it was delicious. My server was Joy and he was kind and attentive.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: This is my second time visiting Paro and it did not disappoint. I went for their Thali offer that they had available for ¬£15ish and I still can‚Äôt get over the portion of food - I had to take it away for the next day. Absolutely recommend!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: The food was delicious, spices were flavorful and had amazing depth. Not overly hot or too salty. Joy was an amazing waiter and recommended some great starters in the Lamb Samosa and 48 spice Prawns!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Amazing food. We did the set 3 course meal and you cannot find better value for money. Staff were very friendly and polite. 10/10 üëè

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Fantastic service from Fuhad. True hospitality and extremely generous - we will hopefully return soon! Amazing value and one of the best curries I have ever had

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Superb restaurant. Fuhad and the rest of the team were incredibly kind and very attentive. Food was delicious and atmosphere of the restaurant was fantastic. Would throughly recommend.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Sam was amazing! He took such great care of us. He was patient and explained the menu to us and we even got some dessert on the house. The food was delicious and the portions were huge. I would definitely recommend if you‚Äôre craving some quality Indian flavor.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Absolutely beautiful food!  10 out  of 10 delicious fresh & quality food is outstanding customer service is excellent lovely staff & shout out to FUHAD the waiter very helpful & good customer service! Would highly recommend this Indian restaurant ü§§

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Amazing food, quality and quantity was spot on, great value for money!
The service from Sam & the team was extremely attentive and exceptional.
Thank you for making our visit so warming.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: From the moment we walked in staff was friendly ,warm and welcoming. Food here is absolutely outstanding, this is my 3rd visit and the food never disappoints, fresh, vibrant and delicious. Fuhad looked after us today, loved his knowledge about the food, and very polite . I was impressed he remembered me from my last visit

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Restaurant was well decorated and felt very homely. Lamb shank is definitely something to order! Prawns as starters are very delicious too.
Table for 2 is quite small. I recommend reserving a booth

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: We've been looking forward to eating in Paro and were not disappointed. The food was so delicious and the team at the restaurant, in particular Fuhad, went above and beyond to provide us with the best dining experience. Also everything was beautifully presented!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Shuyeb was very kind and helpful and made sure we were satisfied with our food and drinks. The food was delightful, so flavourful and the staff are so welcoming! The service was also so quick perfect if you‚Äôre coming from work to watch a show in a theatre and need to get dinner between. Couldn‚Äôt recommend more!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Soooo good! First Indian food experience and it did not disappoint. We had Joy as our server and he was great! Definitely recommend if you‚Äôre in the Covent Garden area and need a good bite to eat!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Best Indian food I‚Äôve ever had! 10/10 best eat spot! It‚Äôs beautiful inside! Fuhad was great!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: The food was completely amazing! Everything was very authentic and served great. The restaurant is lovely and well kept as well as having amazing staff who are very patient and welcoming with foreigners. I would recommend this to anyone in London who is craving Indian cuisine and hospitality. Our waiter Adil was especially kind and made this experience memorable as he is one of a kind. üòçüòçüòçüòç

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: The most amazing Indian food I have ever had !! Such a gorgeous atmosphere and our Waiter Sam couldn‚Äôt do more for us! We will definitely be returning and recommending to our friends, thank you.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Fantastic service by Sam, nice suggestions and wss patient with taking orders. We just ordered stsrtes initially and then the main course. Yet the food wss ready to serve with less waiting time.

Must have chole mango fusion very delicious

Kheema naan is tasty fr non veg
Main course quatity is nice.

Starters quantity needs to be bit more its just enough fr 1 person.

Very unique names of food varierty and cocktail drinks.

Nice candle light type of ambiance cosy yet spacious.

Ambience is very colorful and mordern touch to Indian traditions.

Amex is accepted.

Nearest tube station is charing chross

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Beautiful restaurant!! Had a great time here with my partner. The service was great from Adil. We were happy and stuffed after eating. Will come back again!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Location is next to Lyceum Theatre, Atmosphere is good but the food is a MASSIVE LET DOWN. We visited to celebrate our anniversary, booked table for 7pm, left the restaurant by 7:40pm.

At the rate the food was coming out, it was very obvious the food was made before hand and just heated up when ordered. Which contributed to the stale smell and taste and half the dish being cold. Explained below:

We ordered Mixed Poppadums, Panner Tikka (Grill), Bang Bang Chicken, Veg Thali and Meat Thali.

Mixed Poppadums were not fresh, they were flimsy and stale.
Panner Tikka was bland, tasteless and chewy, alongside the stone cold onions which meant they were pre made and just heated up and served. The "rub" they coated the paneer with had obvious bright red food colouring and tasted of nothing.

Bang Bang Chicken was basically swimming in Lemon juice, again couldnt taste anything other than lemon.

Meat Thali had Lamb Curry and Butter Chicken. Lamb was tasteless. Butter Chicken was more like Water Chicken, runny and tasteless.

Veg Thali had Paneer Curry and Mix Veg. Paneer was bland, no spice, no taste, just felt like having tomato puree and cold chewy paneer pieces. Mix Veg - I couldnt even swallow it. Tasted and smelt stale and offputting, a mixture of salty, lemon and bitter.

The naans we ordered were Garlic Naans, again no butter on the naans and dry.

The only thing that was edible was the daal and rice. The daal had flavour to it.

The meal costed ¬£100+ between the 2 of us. Will never return!
We drove 2hrs each way into Covent Garden and were at the restaurant for no more than 30/40mins.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
My first visit will not doubt be back again prethetre dinner time
Amazing team
Welcoming smile from Sam
Upu is very  good service excellent
The cook must be doing a great job üëç
Keep it up

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
From the moment we walked in, we were welcomed into a vibrant, beautifully designed space with a warm and buzzing atmosphere. The food was absolutely incredible ‚Äì bursting with flavour, beautifully presented, and served in generous portions that left us more than satisfied. There‚Äôs a huge variety on the menu, catering to all tastes without compromising on authenticity.

Our server, Sam, was incredibly friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable. His excellent service truly elevated the entire experience.

Whether you‚Äôre a local or visiting London, Paro is a must-visit. We‚Äôll definitely be back ‚Äì highly, highly recommend!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: We had an incredible experience at Paro! The food was absolutely amazing‚Äîfull of flavor, beautifully presented, and perfectly balanced. The restaurant itself is gorgeous, with a warm and inviting atmosphere that made the evening feel really special. A big thank you to our server, Joy, who was top-notch‚Äîattentive, friendly, and made us feel so well taken care of. Five stars all around, highly recommend!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: The food was very good and we ordered meat thali very memorable platter! The service was especially attentive and Fuhad kept asking about our experience!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: My wife and I have just had a most wonderful meal in a superb atmosphere. We were also very impressed with our waiter Sam. He was very attentive and made sure we were served quickly. The best restaurant experience I‚Äôve had for a long time

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Beautiful and very popular Indian restaurant, recommend booking, we had booked a table but were kept waiting 30 minutes which isn‚Äôt what you expect, however we we‚Äôre in any rush and had a cocktail while waiting, we did have someone keeping us updated about the table so we weren‚Äôt left in the cold!! Staff were friendly and attentive.  We had starters, mains and wine which was about ¬£60 per head, not bad as the food was excellent and we did take home a doggy bag!! Would definitely return.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Absolutely loved this place! The food was full of authentic flavors‚Äîperfectly spiced and incredibly tasty. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, but what truly made the experience special was our server, Sam. He was so friendly, attentive, and helpful with great recommendations. We‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: We had a really nice time. Joy was very kind and helpful with anything we wanted. The food was tasty, but a bit too fatty.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Nicely decorated restaurant, with very nice service. The food was good, but not spicy at all which was disappointing. The waiter recommended I pick the medium version of the dish I chose, and I should've taken the spicy one, as it was really tasty but couldn't feel any heat. My friends loved their picks though, so I would maybe come back and try something else!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: The food was lush!! Especially their Nani grandma chicken it was amazing, the food came in a good time and was hot and well seasoned. It was a bit too dark in my opinion (in relations to lighting) but that‚Äôs the only critique I have. Our waiter Fuhad was incredible always checking in on us and was a great help!! 10/10 I highly recommend.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
I had an incredible dining experience at this Indian restaurant near Charing Cross! From the moment I walked in, the warm and inviting atmosphere set the tone for a fantastic meal. The food was absolutely outstanding‚Äîrich, flavorful, and authentically spiced, with each dish cooked to perfection.

What truly made the evening exceptional was the impeccable service from Adil. He was attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to ensure we had a great time. His recommendations were spot-on, and his genuine hospitality made us feel so welcome.

If you‚Äôre looking for amazing Indian food with top-tier service, this place is a must-visit. I‚Äôll definitely be returning soon!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: All dishes we tried were brilliant. All flavours were very well balanced and we can say it could be up there with one of the best we‚Äôve ever tasted. Our server Fuhad was amazing and extremely helpful!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Thanks so much for perfect night
Amazing food and great service
Specially Joy
I highly recommend

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: The food was amazing and incredibly authentic, we got one dish of each meat as we couldn‚Äôt resist ourselves. The lamb was soft and tender, the chicken was juicy and flavorful, and the shrimp was extremely fresh! Overall amazing. The staff is also very nice and the service is surprisingly quick.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Musa provided amazing service, best Indian meal we've ever had. Will definitely come back.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: The food was amazing and very big portion. The price is reasonable as well. Sam was very friendly served us! Will come back next time

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: Atmosphere is nice. Staff is friendly but a little bit distracted. Waited around 15-20minutes just to order. Forgot our tap water. But this is nothing. The food itself was tasteless. We tried pretty a lot of stuff, everything except drinks was tasteless‚Ä¶ sorry but I had better indian food on the streets of Malaysia or Thailand, but this was watery ‚Ä¶ we left the food and went to another place to eat. Not the nice place to visit on holidays, maybe ok for casual day eating.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Absolutely gorgeous meal at Paro with incredible service from Fuhad.
Generous with their recommendations and explanations and super fun to banter with as a sole traveller.

I had the Meat Thali and it gave me a taste of all the delights with some added samosa and icecream to totally send me over the edge.

Generous serving sizes and a lovely atmosphere. Recommend particularly if you're crossing off an English Indian curry and West End Show for your bucket list.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review: The food was so delicious! Our server Joy was very attentive and had amazing customer service. Definitely recommend

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
I would have loved to give a 5 star for the food but the only thing that let it down was the prawns used for one of the meals where they charge ¬£3 extra but the prawns are small and rubbery.
On a positive note, the restaurant is decorated so nicely and the service was decent. I can‚Äôt recommend enough the lamb pathia - by far the best main meal! And the starters were delicious too!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Amazing service from Sam. Love it. Food really nice and big portions. I was impressed about this place. Small entrance but a really nice restaurant, clean and tide. Fast and good service.
I really recomand it.

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
I had a lovely evening at Paro in Covent Garden! From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere was warm and inviting, with a modern yet authentic touch that set the perfect tone.

The food was absolutely delicious ‚Äî full of rich, bold flavors and beautifully presented. I particularly loved the Lamb Rogan and garlic naan, which was some of the best I‚Äôve had in London.

Special shoutout to Sam, our waiter, who made the experience even more memorable. He was friendly, knowledgeable, and genuinely attentive without being overbearing. He checked in on us just the right amount.

Whether you‚Äôre craving a classic curry or looking to explore something new, Paro is a must-visit. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

business_name: Paro - Covent Garden & Strand - Best Indian Restaurant London
review:
Food and service was amazing!
Ambience and decoration in this place are truly beautiful!
Musa was great looking after our food and service !thanks so much!
Óóä

I highly recommend! The waitresses are super friendly and making sure you have everything you need! The food was fresh and so delicious. There are so many food options to choose from. You even have a button to easily call your waitress to come at any time. I loved the atmosphere as well - very comfy chairs and clean tables. I would return again! This is the best restaurant we've been in London!

Me and my mom had dinner there tonight.Mind you we found the place ‚Äúby accident‚Äù,by walking past it and our eyes being captured by the pictures and especially the prices.They gave us a table immediately and everyone was very polite.It was out first time here and the servers let us take our time to choose and compare our options.The food was absolutely delicious,almost the same as shown in the pictures.We also attended 2 little shows that made out evening funnier. The desserts were inviting that we were spoiled for choice and it was hard choosing one!

I had such a great experience at Happy London! The food was absolutely delicious ‚Äî everything was fresh, flavourful, and served in generous portions. There‚Äôs a great variety on the menu, with plenty of options even for fussy eaters, which is always a big plus.

The desserts were a real highlight ‚Äî truly indulgent and beautifully presented. The staff were all incredibly friendly and attentive, making the whole visit feel warm and welcoming.

On top of all that, the decor and atmosphere were spot on ‚Äî modern, vibrant, and really comfortable. I genuinely can‚Äôt say a bad word about my lunch here. Highly recommend!

I had seen a lot of hype on social media about Happy so was expecting the quality of food to be a bit higher. We enjoyed our meal but it was nowhere near as good as people had been saying. The service was good but the food was just ok and because of the price, I‚Äôd choose another less touristy restaurant next time I‚Äôm in London

This place is amazing. One of the best services , fast and efficient. The menu is quite rich and includes Asian, Mexican , Italian and British cuisine. I definitely recommend it. There is a good selection of desserts and cocktails.

Had a great time at Happy London! The food was delicious üòã especially the chicken buns and mozzarella sticks. We tried three kinds of fries and they were all super tasty. The smashed burger was okay, but overall, a very satisfying meal üôèüèº

We were impressed by the super fast service and the overall quality of the food. The menu offers a nice variety of dishes that almost everyone can enjoy. We tried the l crispy chicken bun, and  pasta, all of them were delicious! Definitely a place we‚Äôd recommend if you‚Äôre looking for tasty food with quick service.

The food and desserts were really tasty, and the vibe was super lively ‚Äî there were even a birthday celebration going on that night! Overall, we had a great time. The only downside was that it was a bit hard to get the attention of the staff sometimes ‚Äî we had to wait quite a few times when trying to call someone over, probably because it was a busy evening. Also, the service charge was 20%, which felt a little steep. But honestly, the food so was good that I‚Äôd still recommend this place
Great visit here yesterday. Service was great, food came out quick and was delicious.  Lovely atmosphere and we all had a lovely time. Reasonably priced for the center of London.

Had lunch at Happy London and tried the crispy chicken Caesar salad and the steak with sweet potato fries. The salad was fresh, tasty, and well put together. The steak, however, was just okay, the default cook is medium, and I prefer medium rare, which affected the overall flavour and texture. Sweet potato fries were nice, but the steak didn‚Äôt stand out.

I had a fantastic experience at Happy London!! The food was delicious, and the atmosphere was so cheerful and welcoming. It's no surprise they won an award for being one of the best restaurants in England! A special shoutout to Alexander, who served our dishes with a smile and was incredibly friendly and attentive. Definitely recommend this place for a happy meal!"
It‚Äôs our first time trying Happy and it is really a great place to dine. Love the ambiance and staff are attentive and friendly. I enjoyed my steak and pasta. Will definitely come back soon ü•∞

Great food at really good prices for London and definitely the best service. Visited twice within 4-5 days we were here for holidays. 100% recommend. Only 3 stars on the atmosphere because it was both times fully packed and quite noisy but that's really not their fault I guess. Anyway, you should come here for food and you won't be disappointed.

I had an amazing experience at Happy Restaurant in Central London. The food was absolutely delicious‚Äîevery dish was cooked to perfection with rich flavors and high-quality ingredients. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, making it a great place to relax and enjoy a meal. The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive.

Superb burgers - the best I've had in this country, a league above most other burgers including plenty of 'gourmet' burgers. Big, fat, juicy burgers literally dripping with flavour - exactly what we've been looking for and too often disappointed, but not here. I had the Real Deal burger - 2 black Angus burgers with a chicken fillet on top, with grilled onions and an amazing cheese sauce that a really nice smokiness to it but not OTT. I had sweet potato fries and whilst I would've liked a few more as like you got if you ordered chips, they were cooked well and nice.

Very very nice, thanks.

Staff were friendly and attentive, prices were fair.

I went here In January for my birthday I had such a good time! There were 7 people including myself we were able to skip the line outside as we were a big group, they put us in a booth but then moved us to somewhere bigger. The food and drinks were amazing, service was good and so was the entertainment the vibes in the restaurant was indeed happy, since it was my birthday they came out and sang happy birthday for me with sparklers and a free slice of cake I have absolutely nothing to complain about. Dont mind me writing this review months laterü§£

All menus were excellent. The spaghetti was al dente. The squid and chips so crunchy. Normally, I don‚Äôt eat squid except this dish.
Atmosphere was good with nice song. Staff were friendly.

You are here for the vibe and atmosphere really and not so much for the food, I ordered the steak that should be medium rare and was a bit dry and overcooked.

But loved the birthday celebration that the restaurant provides to the customer, so much joy and fun.

Had the best experience at Happy, everything down from the customer service, starters, main perfection. Massive thank you to the lovely Vanessa who provided excellent customer service, made us feel very comfortable and had an amazing smile on her face which just made us feel immediately warmüòåüòå

We loved our meal at Happy üòä The venue is beautifully decorated and the staff were friendly and efficient. The food was delicious and the portions were a good size too! This is my 3rd time coming to Happy and I'll definitely be back when I'm next in London üíï

I had a great experience at Happy Bar & Grill! I ordered a burger which was absolutely delicious ‚Äì juicy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. I also had a lemonade that was super refreshing and really hit the spot.
The atmosphere in the restaurant was pleasant and welcoming, and I felt comfortable throughout my visit. The staff were attentive, friendly, and always available when I needed something. I was especially impressed by how punctual and responsive the waiters were.
The food arrived quickly, and everything was fresh and well-presented. Overall, I had a wonderful time and I‚Äôll definitely be coming back. Highly recommend!

After seeing this place on Tik Tok which I usually always trust for food, we decided to give it a try. It was such a disappointment and we won‚Äôt be back. Food was mediocre, have had better quesadillas at Taco Bell for a fraction of the price. Very expensive but the staff are friendly. A large proportion of the menu wasn‚Äôt available too which was also very disappointing to see. Don‚Äôt believe the tik tok reviews. It is nothing special.
Fun and relaxed atmosphere but the food and drinks were modern and upscale without being pretentious! A traveling foodie can jump in as they are for a delicious dining experience!

Always our first choice when we say we want good food. From our favourite authentic Italian carbonara to their steak and calamari, all are ‚Äòchef‚Äôs kiss‚Äô. Photos uploaded were from our last two visits last Feb and Apr 2025. You‚Äôll usually see a long queue during dinner time but they can accommodate you in just few minutes of waiting since they have a huge place.

Having previously enjoyed Happy Bar & Grill in Sofia, Bulgaria, I was eager to experience their London location, and it did not disappoint. Situated in the heart of Piccadilly Circus, the restaurant boasts a vibrant atmosphere that seamlessly blends lively music with engaging birthday celebrations, creating an enjoyable dining environment.

Culinary Experience:

Our meal commenced with the Fried Calamari, which was impressively tender and flavorful, earning an 8.6/10. The Cheeseburger Roll followed, offering a delightful fusion of classic burger flavors in a unique format, meriting an 8.7/10. The Beef Tacos were a highlight, featuring succulent pulled beef atop tortilla bread, complemented by cheddar, caramelized onions, chili mayo, tomato salsa, baby gem lettuce, guacamole, and ranch sauce‚Äîa harmonious blend that also deserved an 8.7/10. The meal culminated with the Beef Cuban Sandwich, a satisfying combination that achieved an 8.9/10.

The children‚Äôs menu was well-received by my kids; however, the mac and cheese had a notably rich buttery flavor, which may be overwhelming for some young palates.

Ambiance and Service:

The restaurant‚Äôs lively atmosphere is enhanced by cheerful birthday celebrations, complete with clapping and singing, adding a festive touch to the dining experience. Each table features a convenient push-bell system, ensuring attentive service without interruption.  Ôøº

Overall Impression:

Happy Bar & Grill in London successfully delivers a diverse menu and vibrant atmosphere, making it a worthwhile destination for both families and individuals seeking a memorable dining experience. I wholeheartedly recommend this establishment to anyone looking to enjoy a delightful meal in the city.

I was going to eat at the hard Rock cafe but at the last minute decided to eat here instead and I'm glad I did! At first I was sat next to a family with a screaming baby, but when I asked they -happily- moved me to a different table. I ordered the Mac n cheese with meatballs and garlic toast and it was delicious! So many menu options it was hard to decide. I also had the magic lemonade which had a lovely presentation! I found the portion sizes to be just right. I wanted to try one of the desserts but was too full. I'm so glad I found this place, I might come back before I leave London to try a different dish!

what a great restaurant! the food was absolute top tier. the chicken tacos really stood out to me as the chicken was shredded and lots of toppings. the truffle fries though were the star of the show! great service aswell and nice and quick. didn‚Äôt have to wait long to get in and out as we were at the theatre and only had a small gap to eat dinner!

Love this place first time we tried it on our wedding anniversary 23rd June, initially the name put me off as we were passing as it didn‚Äôt really look like somewhere I‚Äôd want to go for a anniversary meal but how wrong I was and I‚Äôm glad we went through the doors ! There‚Äôs so many choices on the food we struggled to choose as they all looked good, from the off the staff were all very happy and welcoming and went out of their way to say hello as we walked through to our table, the toilets were even nice, the seating at the tables were very comfy arm chair like chairs and the food was quick and very good and I had travelled from East Sussex for a day out in London and would come back here again very soon !

What can I say? The steak was juicy and well seasoned. I paired it with mashed potatoes and was the perfect match.
The place is clean and refined. The service is pleasant and decent.

Amazing food, tasty drinks, nice atmosphere, nice music and smily service.üôÇme and my girlfriend loved it. Is out top restaurant so far. Thank you guys for welcoming us here. 100% we will come back to try different items from your menuüòá

Overall experience was great, the staff performing, dancing and singing was amazing. It took us by surprise but added to the already fun and cheerful atmosphere.  The food on the other hand was quite average. Not bad, but I wouldn't go specifically to look for something good to eat. They have plenty of different options to pick from but the quality of the food is not spectacular. Although the cocktails were pretty decent. Typical price for London at an average of ¬£10 per cocktail. I would say it's a good place to go with a group of people for the experience itself.

The food was perfectly cooked and the environment was very beautiful. The service was good the food came relatively quickly and they made sure everything was good. Lots of birthdays so the staff had to kept going round singing which was interesting.
Amazing place, it's big and the most important, despite the open kitchen, you won't leave smelling of food. Highly recommended. Very well located next to Piccadilly station.
Had a great time, food was tasty and the vibe was chill. Big shoutout to Mihaela and Ofeliya for the awesome service. Super friendly and made sure everything went smoothly. Would definitely come back
Fun place to visit. Good food and funny cocktails that had a great taste. They have great selection of food and you will have to come again to try the rest of menu, because it is all good üòÑüëç.

Genuinely just try it, and you will understand how worth it this place is. Venci provided impeccable service and was very sweet, made sure we felt welcome. The food should be on TV, for the quality it feels like we were robbing the place blind.
100% recommend, also a man dressed as Jim Carrey‚Äôs The Mask came in and was running around having fun, 5 star experience.

I wanted to go to this place for a very long time, because the menu looked really good and there is always a long queue. I went last night with my boyfriend and we were very excited about it.

It was a Saturday evening and the queue was a bit long, but the wait was not bad at all. It is really big inside with many tables, and the atmosphere is really nice. It is a busy place and, whilst we were there, the staff sang happy birthday at least five different times to different tables, and the whole restaurant engages with them. I can see how this can be fun for groups whilst it might bother other people. We thought it was entertaining. No complaints about the service, the staff was really nice and didn't take long to serve.

The food itself was a bit disappointing or not as good as I would have liked. We had the thin fries, which are crispy and greasy. This was probably our mistake to order, but annoying that they don't offer french fries, only the thicker fries, which were not amazing either. We had the prawns with parmegiano sauce, which were alright. Then, some chicken with guacamole and fries; the chicken was okay, the guacamole and fries just alright. We also had the steak with mac and cheese. This was probably the worst part; the mac and cheese was okay, but the steak had a very weird soft texture that you wouldn't think it was a steak, and we did not enjoy. They also served the sides with a sauce that had a smokey-weird flavour. We asked what was in there and the waiter just said it is a secret recipe. Fair enough, but I only wanted to know why I didn't like it. We thought we paid too much for the quality of the food.

The cocktails looked cool, but didn't have any, so not sure how good they are. Same for the desserts.

If I had to go back I would probably choose a burger, maybe safer option.

We had an amazing time. With amazing food. And all of the staff that served and helped us were friendly and happy to answer any questions we had. It was a very welcoming place. The cocktails were amazing!!

Fun Spot in the Heart of London
Happy Restaurant in Piccadilly Circus was a pleasant surprise. The location couldn‚Äôt be better right in the middle of all the action. The vibe is lively, the staff are warm and welcoming, and the food hits the spot: big portions, tasty, and nicely presented.

It‚Äôs not fine dining, but it doesn‚Äôt pretend to be. Just a fun, casual place that delivers exactly what you‚Äôre hoping for. We did have to wait quite a while for dessert and the bill, but they were packed so fair enough. Would still go back!

Happy Restaurant in Piccadilly Circus is a great spot with a varied menu, offering something for everyone. The food is delicious, especially the Mexican section‚Äîquesadillas are a must-try! The pulled beef bao buns are exceptional and not to be missed. The service is impeccable, and the staff is incredibly friendly, hospitable, and attentive. The atmosphere is lively, though it can get overcrowded and noisy at times. Still, it‚Äôs a great place for a fun and tasty dining experience!

The starters were literally 10/10. It‚Äôs really hard to find good foods like this. The service team was excellent. 2 girls serving us at lunch was very helpful and quick. Food came out quick aswell. Just abit disappointing with the BBQ rib size and steak was 6/10 but will definitely visit again and try new menu‚Äôs. Thank you

I have a new favourite restaurant in Town. I defy anyone to not enjoy the dining experience at Happy. The menu is so varied you will find something you'll like and you'll love the service and ambiance. But take care to book or get there at slightly off peak times, unless you like to queue!

What a place, the food was amazing, so much choice to choose from. Nice menu lay out with every dish pictured, and watching our dishes and other tables food come out they all looked like the picture in the menu.
The flavour was fantastic and a really good size plate for the reasonable price.
Highly recommend, and can't wait to go back to London so I can try another dish.

Service is great, all the food we got was not great. I ordered a steak for medium, it‚Äôs not just well done, it was EXCELLENT‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ (way too overcooked). spaghetti bolognaise had no flavour, just taste like cheap cheese. Overall too overpriced for the quality of the food

Not a great experience  at this place. Menu is very misleading as portion size portrayed is exaggerated in the menus. Service was poor and link to allergens was not available. We tried 3 different devices and were not told or provided with an alternative format. The waitress was annoyed at us and was rude. Stake was not cooked as asked. not worth paying ¬£25.00 when you can get a sirloin for ¬£6,00 at tesco and cook it better at home. Some of the food was tasty would recommend the calamari

We went there for a small family  celebration and it was perfect. The interior and atmosphere were great, beautiful and welcoming. Food was excellent although our opinions about the cheese cake with Brazilian chocolate were divided. It's the only thing none of us will order again.
The service was lovely and our waitress was nice, smiling and helpful.
There was a lot of singing Happy birthday in English and Bulgarian - depends on the clients and even dancing a famous Greek dance.
Lovely place, definitely will visit many more times.

If you‚Äôre looking for a restaurant that truly lives up to its name, Happy is the place to be! From the moment you walk in, the energy is infectious‚Äîbright, lively, and effortlessly fun. The vibes here are unlike anywhere else in London; it‚Äôs the kind of place that puts a smile on your face before you even take a seat. The playlists? Absolutely spot-on‚Äîa perfect mix of feel-good tunes that make your dining experience even more enjoyable.

Now, let‚Äôs talk about the service. The staff are some of the friendliest, most genuinely happy people I‚Äôve come across in a restaurant. Always smiling, always attentive, and making sure every guest feels special. It‚Äôs rare to find such a warm and welcoming team, and it truly makes a difference.

But the real star? The food. The selection here is one-of-a-kind‚ÄîI don‚Äôt think any other restaurant in London offers such a unique variety of dishes while maintaining such exceptional quality. Every bite is an experience, and the portions? Incredibly generous! Whether you‚Äôre in the mood for something hearty, fresh, or indulgent, there‚Äôs something for everyone‚Äîand it‚Äôs all absolutely delicious.

Happy is not just a restaurant; it‚Äôs a mood, an experience, a place that guarantees good times and great food. If you‚Äôre near Piccadilly Circus, do yourself a favor and go. You‚Äôll leave with a full stomach and an even fuller heart.

Very popular chain back home so we decided to try their London branch and we were not disappointed. Whilst the menu here is different, we still found many great options. My daughter didn‚Äôt quite like her first choice but we were offered a replacement without having to pay for the first dish. I found that fantastic - and very clever - because of that gesture we are now guaranteed to come back!
The staff were really nice and friendly, the interior is pretty and the place is clean. See you soon!
The food is really amazing , the atmosphere is awesome, the staff is really friendly and good music, yes maybe a bit expensive but it's all worth it

Had the pleasure of dining here recently Anis Barakat was an absolute fantastic host, memorable service and incredible atmosphere. Sat right between the bar and the chef station. Didn't pay service charge and Anis gave me no pressure for doing which was pleasantly refreshing. The place is called happy for a reason every single person and face was so welcoming out of the staff and I didn't see one disappointed customer. Food was literally amazing and I would, have and contine to visit this place.
Everything was amazing! The food and drinks were so delicious and the waitress was so kind. The place is modern and nice.

Good food but small portions. Well presented.
Service is quick and courteous.
Weekends usually have a wait time.  Recommend that you book your table here.  The ambience is good.  (Except the toilets that are shabby and best avoided).

Usually casual atmosphere.  Definitely worth trying and you never know you may fall in love with this place depending on your state of mind.

I came here with my partner on 24th May 2024 and also 9th February 2025.

Although I really wanted to visit here as it seemed like a great choice to come and dine, on both my occasions I found that the food was not great at all.

On my 1st visit 24th May I had came
Here with my partner, we ordered the crispy beef alongside my main the steak and chips and also partners meal chicken tenders.

Both my meal and the sides came warm/cold which I had asked the waiter to replaced. The water had asked me if I would like it to be warmed up again which I was quite offended and said no I would like another one made fresh as the meat was cold and chips were dry as if this was reheated. My starter was not bad but again wasn‚Äôt hot when it was served. My partner‚Äôs food was ok but the mac cheese was full of grease and seemed to be recooked.

This brings me to my recent visit this week on 9th feb, I was skeptical to come back here with my partner but as there wasn‚Äôt a long queue we decided to give it another go‚Ä¶

We ordered our food with a waitress who didn‚Äôt know any of the menu which wasn‚Äôt helpful at all, I defied to go for the half chicken with chips and my partner went for a piri Piri chicken with mash potato (both dishes were simple).

On arrival I found yet again that the food wasn‚Äôt hot enough, the chips again after my last visit almost a year ago was dry and didn‚Äôt taste like a chip, my chicken had no flavour at all instead was extremely salty and almost uneatable! My partner liked her chicken but as you can see the was hardly any mash potato on her plate but instead a pool of water grease! I didn‚Äôt hold back and asked the waiter to replace my chips and my partners mash potato which he kindly did.

After we finished our meals and asked for the bill we noticed we weee charged for both replacements at ¬£4.99 each plus service charge. I asked the waiter to take this off because of the above which he didn‚Äôt seem to want to do until I had a go at him which he went and spoken to his manager.

We ended up getting the items removed but overall ¬£45 for 2 chicken meals and a small portion of fries o mash potato is not worth it.

I gave this place a second chance and they blew it! I can‚Äôt recommend this restaurant as it left us leaving ‚Äúunhappy‚Äù rather than Happy.

Whilst the food was very good. The service was average.. We received very sarcastic service from a female waiter when we asked where is our order and for a fresh set of cutlery. When I previously asked a male waiter for an order update he couldn't even understand English

The manager apologised afterwards but this is still not what I expect from service

My friend & I visited Happy & we shared the garlic & herb dough balls, beef sliders, BBQ pork ribs, bao buns with crispy chicken, and pulled beef loaded fries. The dough balls were underwhelming, appearing only to have garlic on the top (where it is visible), so I would have been better off just getting garlic bread. However, the beef sliders were exquisite; succulent and tasty, immediately getting Happy back on my good side. The pork ribs were strangely small, but the rack itself was so comically long that it evened out and, most importantly, they were very tasty. The bao buns were also very enjoyable, but the pulled beef on the loaded fries were unimpressive - the fries themselves however were perfectly fine. Overall, a mix of pleasure and disappointment, but the positives were good enough for me to say I‚Äôd definitely visit again.

THE BEST RESTAURANT IN LONDON!
I went to Happy in Piccadilly Circus on my birthday (19th Feb) and had a wonderful time with my friend. Where do I start from?!
I had a booking at 6:30pm and although there was a very long queue ahead of us, me and my friend were given the opportunity to jump up the queue and get a table straight away. The hostess that greeted us and sat us down (the lovely Bulgarian girl with dark brown hair) was incredibly welcoming and friendly, and had the prettiest smile and aura.
The moment we were sat down another waitress with very long brown hair (forgot to ask about her name) came to the table and took our orders. She was very nice and had very good customer service skills. She looked very happy and made us feel very welcome and at the right place.
It took us 4-5 days ahead of our reservation to choose the meals we wanted to have as their menu is very big and has literally everything you can think of. (A little advice - check their menu online before the day of your booking.)
I ordered the Greek salad as a starter, and my friend ordered the garlic cheesy bread, as well as another type of bread (photos have been attached) and we were both very impressed by the taste and how easily they could fill us up. For our main course my friend ordered the black Angus Cuban sandwich as well as a side of mac and cheese which both left him speechless as they looked and tasted amazing. I ordered the beef skirt fillet in their signature sauce with a side of truffle mashed potatoes. Oh my god! It was so yummy!! After I ate it all, I had no space for dessert. Awesome value for money!
Drinks-wise we ordered two lemonades that we weren‚Äôt a fan of as well as the dragon daiquiri and ‚Äòthe tall one‚Äô which were quite nice. The presentation of the drinks was immaculate!
Last but not least, I wanted to mention that the atmosphere was very unique and made me feel at home as I am from Bulgaria which as we were told by the hostess -  90% of the staff actually were too. I love how their staff played some Greek music and started dancing which I‚Äôve never seen before at a restaurant and which I think is a very interesting entertainment concept.They also put a lot of effort into birthday celebrations - they play birthday music, and a bunch of their staff gathers around the table singing a song to you which I find to be very fun and memorable.
The food arrived very quickly and our waitress as well as the runner were very professional and friendly at the same time. Shout out to the hostess for making us feel welcome and taken care of.
Me and my friend will definitely come back!
10/10 ü©∑
Thank you Happy!

Happy has become a staple for my fianc√© and I when we visit London! The food is always delicious, (although I wish there were some fresh vegetable options for a side dish or something other than a salad!)

The arancini is to die for though, so I fully recommend that... every single time. The service is always incredible, super friendly and entertaining. We really enjoy that it's non-intrusive, there is a 'doorbell' on your table which allows you to call the waiter when you want them!

We'll continue to eat at Happy every time we come to London, and we'll always recommend it to people who tell us they're visiting!

Very delicious food and good service. I know the restaurant from Sofia (BG) and wasn‚Äôt disappointed ü•∞

Without reservation we (table for 3) just got in after 5 min of waiting. üëåüèº

PS: If there are a lot of people on their birthday, you gonna here quite often to ‚ÄûIt's My Birthday‚Äú
by will.i.am and Cody Wise üòÖ

‚ÄúHappy‚Äù restaurant in Piccadilly Circus is a delightful spot for a casual dining experience, offering vibrant energy and family-friendly vibes. The food itself scores a solid 7.5/10, with tasty starters and lovely cocktails that elevate the menu.

The real highlight, however, is the atmosphere and staff, who go above and beyond to make celebrations, especially birthdays, feel extra special. It‚Äôs a lively and festive environment, perfect for group gatherings.

On the downside, it can be challenging to find a table without a reservation, especially during busy hours. If you‚Äôre planning a visit, booking ahead is highly recommended to avoid long waits.

Overall, ‚ÄúHappy‚Äù lives up to its name with a cheerful ambiance and a strong focus on celebrations. A great choice for special occasions or a fun night out!

I was served raw ribs.. I took one off my sons out for my birthday meal.
no apology nothing offered. Manager was rude and couldn‚Äôt care less. No feed back from chefs until I left and asked.
Was advised by the manager ‚Äòit‚Äôs impossible for them to be undercooked‚Äô the chefs feedback.
while I understand ribs can be pink/tender this was what I call alive pink. I have become unwell and response from happy isn‚Äôt great. Just be careful and check your food.
We love Happy London! It was the highlight of our trip two years ago and it was just as good this time Summer 2025! I love the pasta, the picture menu, nonalcoholic drinks and the atmosphere‚ù£

Honestly the atmosphere and staff were great. The cocktails are good and it didn't take long to be seated. But the food is so terribly mediocre, I was so disappointed.
We had the mac and cheese steak and nachos. The nachos just use the patty mince im sure of it and it was greasy and flavourless. The steak and mac was tasty, but for the price it devalued its flavour. We just expected more of everything for the price.

This place was a SCAM, one of the worst restaurants I‚Äôve ever been to!!!!! Avoid at all costs. The food was one of the worst I‚Äôve ever had. The chicken was so raw and the bbq ribs were so undercooked and with barely meat, the sauces were so poor quality, they were basically from the supermarket. Also why are the portions so small as if they were given for free ?? Each plate was 20¬£ or more !!!! We paid 50¬£ in total and we left hungry as ever. For 50¬£ you can get actual rich food somewhere else. I‚Äôm extremely disappointed and dissatisfied with this place. The waiters are also so boring, no interest in serving, everything is rushy, this honestly felt like a fast food chain. The toilets were DISGUSTING too. I‚Äôm surprised this has won best restaurant in the past cause I don‚Äôt see it where. I wish I could get a refund or at least an apology cause this was a scam and a robbery. The food was way too small and poor quality for that High price. The music was way too loud and everything just felt too fast food kind of. Horrible experience and I‚Äôm never wasting my money in a place like this ever again. Look at that menu and then look at the actual food. A SPAM ! I‚Äôm so angry cause we all work hard for our money so wasting in places like this is disgusting.
Great food, great vibes and very friendly staff! Just make sure to make a reservation if you don't want to queue outside

Very well located restaurant for tourists. The menu is extensive and typical American diner style. The portion sizes are smaller than expected and are very greasy. One of my favourite restaurants, they have a phlothera of dishes from every cuisine. I always get the shrimp dishes. Pretty reasonable For central London. The entertainment is pretty interesting too üéâ

A very nice experience. Food came fast and was mostly tasty. Portion sizes are on the tad small side. Cocktails all tasted good! Deserts were just okay. Would have been nice to get the same waiter through our meal. Had four that I can remember

Enjoyed the food and drinks very theatrical hair in the creme brulee but they did remove it from the bill recommend the truffle cauliflower the mac and cheese is awful it tasted artificial i have to say service was friendly everyone greeted us everyone said goodbye

Happy's food comes with a sadness. Located in the heart of Leicester and Picadilly Curcus, the restaurant attracts a large number of foreigners and nationals. There was no need for booking, and we have been seated in literally less than 3 minutes from the door to the table. The team was always attentive, friendly, and efficient. They took every order correctly, and the food was served accordingly. I ordered a Kiwi ü•ù  Vodka and my companion a Pinaple fizzy drink. Unfortunately, the 11 (counted) ice cubes leave me with nothing but less than 30ml of cocktail, which is nothing but pricey. The soft drink wasn't any better. The salad was acceptable, but to my surprise, there was a huge difference between the illustration in the menu and the food served to the table, to which the staff commented "this is only for marketing" and I found it very inappropriate. I turned back the plate, and I refused to accept the dish. None of the dishes was presentable enough, nothing more far from reality. I also made use of the restroom, and I lost any appetite thereinafter. A nife that was drpped off the table remained on the floor during the entire time, and the attention to detail was completely absent at this place. The restaurant is in very unpleasant and dirty conditions. Overrated, overpriced, and debatable food presentation. First and last time.

The restaurant has a good variation of food, they have seafood, steaks, chicken, tacos and salads. Everything looks amazing. I had the pasta with shrimp, perfect presentation and flavour. My wife had a salad and it was amazing too. The service was very good.

I fully recommend this place!

We booked a table for two for our wedding anniversary meal following a great review from our son.
The service was very good in general and the food was great, albeit slightly different from the photos on the menu in appearance.
We noticed some birthday celebrations around the restaurant which was a nice touch from the staff (nothing for wedding anniversaries though!).
When it came to requesting the bill, it was displayed on an electronic device and it wasn‚Äôt clear (until we‚Äôd paid it and looked through the printed receipt) that there was an ‚Äòoptional‚Äô service charge of ¬£15.96 added (12.5%). By this point, we‚Äôd already given the waitress ¬£10 as a tip, which she gladly accepted; so it turned out that we‚Äôd paid nearly ¬£26 in gratuities.
I feel this ‚Äòoptional‚Äô charge should be highlighted on the electronic device when the bill is presented.

Almost every 30min they‚Äôre celebrating birthday,The restaurant includes Service charge.Steak was delicious,but the sizes are little bit small.Beers around 6-7¬£,Steaks 22¬£.Garlic Bread 3.50¬£ (3pcs).The location is good.

Wow, what a surprising gem!
I had such low expectations when we came in, because it looks like a typical tourist trap. However, the food is delicious, the prices are very reasonable, the variety of dishes is amazing, and the service is great.

I highly recommend the French fries with the truffle. It is d-e-l-i-c-i-o-u-s. But seems like everything else is great too.

I had the chicken steak with the signature sauce - would come back just for that.

Can't wait to visit again!

Happy is a Great place with various options to get food if you are in central London. They have amazing service and quick seating. Food prices are average for central London and the food portion sizes are fair.
I will be returning here sometime again in the future.

I had never heard of this place and stumbled across it with the wife. We were both very impressed, the food was lovely and the selection, incredible. She had mexican and I had chinese. Food is great. Price is reasonable. Great wait staff and convenient location!

What's not to love about the place. Happened to stumble upon it and decided to grab a quick meal. Was thoroughly surprised with how good it was.

Definitely a recommend for me if you are in the area.

"Happy" restaurant in Piccadilly Circus is a delightful spot we where in London celebrating our 50th birthdays  with family  members and it definitely lives up to its reputation it was a very pleasant experience food  definitely scored 10/10 it was delicious very tasty and starters were lovely and also had a few cocktails that were gorgeous  anyone visiting I‚Äôd definitely recommend booking a table in advance and definitely recommend HAPPY for celebrations and a great night out

I great place for a pure touristy quick lunch or dinner. Everything appears to be catered to Americans (except for the portions). We Americans are use to larger plates and portions. But there are plenty of deep fried favorites coupled with fries. Can‚Äôt go wrong with that combination. It‚Äôs OK to want for home base comfort foods occasionally while on travel. We liked it when we wanted something quick.

The prices are really good, considering you are in the heart of the tourist area. But be mindful that the portion is a bit smaller.

The staff are amazing!! They all were extremely kind, hey, and professional.
Had the most wonderful food here today, absolutely delicious.Highly recommend

I had the pleasure of dining at Govinda‚Äôs in Soho, and I must say, it‚Äôs a truly delightful experience! The food is wonderfully fresh, flavorful, and nourishing ‚Äî a perfect blend of vegan and vegetarian options that cater beautifully to every palate. The peaceful ambiance and warm service make it more than just a meal; it feels like a heartfelt offering. I highly recommend Govinda‚Äôs to anyone looking for wholesome, tasty, and spiritually uplifting food in the heart of London. A must-visit for all food lovers! üçõü§§

Flavorful Vegan Indian Food!
I had a great experience at Govinda Vegan in London. The food was absolutely delicious ‚Äì packed with rich spices and bold, flavorful seasoning. Every dish felt comforting and satisfying.

The staff were very kind and welcoming, which made the meal even more enjoyable. I also love that the menu rotates ‚Äì it keeps things interesting and gives you a reason to come back. I‚Äôm definitely planning to return soon to try more! A must-visit spot for anyone who enjoys authentic Indian vegan cuisine.
Visited today for lunch. Hardik served us. Great guy. The Lady helped with arrangements. Lovely staff overall. Great food. Surely come back whenever we will be in London.

Wonderful food, great selection of lunch/dinner options, drinks, and desserts - everything was fantastic and great value! The atmosphere was nice too, and it was no surprise that the queue was long (worth the wait) and tables all full. The staff were all so friendly and helpful too :)

I tried the ¬£7.95 Veggie Thali at Govinda‚Äôs London, and overall it was a mixed experience. The food itself was quite average ‚Äî while the portion was fair, the flavors didn‚Äôt really stand out. The service also wasn‚Äôt the best. The server seemed impatient which affected the overall experience.That said, the place itself has a nice, homely vibe, and it feels welcoming if you‚Äôre looking for a simple vegetarian meal at a reasonable price.

I've visited Govinda's Restaurant two weeks ago, and I've enjoyed in great food and ambience, that not only filled my stomach, but also my soul. I was inspired with beautiful and peaceful energy! Service was also great and people were always full of laughter! I'm definetily looking forward to visit this place again someday! Greetings from Croatia! ‚ù§Ô∏è

First time eating at Govinda and was definitely not disappointed. The food was fresh and tasty. Great selection. We got the large platter as we wanted to try a selection of the food on offer. The staff were exceptionally pleasant and helpful.
Really relaxed atmosphere. I will return for sure!!!

A Nourishing Experience at Govinda‚Äôs

Just shared a beautiful meal with an old friend at Govinda‚Äôs in London, and I‚Äôm still glowing from the experience. This vegetarian gem which caters for vegans with ease has such a warm, spiritual feel - it‚Äôs more than just food, it‚Äôs soul nourishment. The cuisine was absolutely fantastic: fresh, flavourful, and prepared with love. The staff were genuinely friendly and welcoming, adding to the sense of being cared for. A perfect blend of taste, atmosphere, and heart. Highly recommend for anyone craving more than just a meal.

One of the last remaining gems of old soho! This place has soul and community, not just because of its spiritual roots, but because of its community engagement, accessible food prices and even free food! It‚Äôs so heart warming it‚Äôs survived so long and the people that work here are great!

Food is always delicious, hearty and filling, especially for the price! It can get very busy so during the week I recommend around 7pm to come and eat.

Thank you!
Food was fantastic and reasonably priced. Has a very Mom and Pop kinda feel to it. Not a ton of seating, but if you get lucky you can grab an outside table.
Delicious vegetarian food and lovely atmosphere! I returned several times during my recent stay in London and found the variety of options, portions and prices most agreeable. Highly recommend!

All the food we ordered was delicious and really cheap, can‚Äôt recommend it enough! That being said keep in mind that this place is really popular and gets crowded so you will probably need to wait for some time to get food. Also it was really hot inside so we had to get everything as a takeaway.

this was a super yummy thali!! very decently priced - i got the veggie & my friend got the deluxe which got good reviews. the berry lassi is amazing and also vegan so was very happy with this!! there is a big queue but people move fast and the staff were v friendly. would def return :))

The most delicious vegan and pure vegetarian food available here, mist visit if you want to enjoy such food and also the atmosphere is great. Went to this place as read some good reviews and watched some videos on YouTube and must say was disappointed
